campaign.story:
PS4/Xbox Ports [REACHED!]
As it suggests, we'll be able to port Flynn to Xbox One and PS4! Funds will go to the necessary development tools and time needed.
Challenge Mode [REACHED!]
We'll have some extra resources to put towards a unique challenge mode! Put your Flynn skills to the test in the arena with survival and boss rush trials!
Animated Intro
We'll be able to work with our pals over at Studio Yotta to create an animated intro for Flynn: Son of Crimson! It'll be pretty and juicy and whoa!
Rozia Story DLC
An alternate character in a DLC story played alongside Flynn's journey! We already have this story planned out, these funds would help it become a reality! All backers receiving the game will get the DLC at no charge.
  Flynn: Son of Crimson is a 2D action adventure platformer with metroidvania elements. Set in a wondrous world with a looming darkness beginning to awaken yet again.
What can you expect?
Explore a wondrous world filled with discovery, taking place in unique regions designed with non-linear exploration.
Swap between multiple weapons with quick and satisfying combat.
Dive in to a land with ancient mysteries and rich story.
Travel across the lands, discovering new ways to roam and opening new paths using the power of crimson.
Dip in and out of an alternate dimension to make unique alterations to the real world.
View a realm full of life, carefully formed with hand-crafted pixel art.
Trade trinkets for new combat techniques and runes with an old war veteran.
Call on your companion Dex in times of need, a mystical and loyal creature.
Test your strength in the feared Rustwood coliseum among other challenging feats.
Take on the role of Flynn, a young man orphaned as a child who sets out to chase the shadows of his beginnings whilst awakening the ancient power of Crimson within him. 
Discover relics of ancient Rosantica, effigies and monuments to the goddess Sorrell that reveal hints at Flynn’s beginnings and unlock new powers. Reveal secret pathways, trade with villagers, battle fierce monsters, hang out with dogs.
    What about the Switch?
We've received a lot of requests for the Switch, we hear you! We'd love to launch on as many platforms as possible, but there is a problem. Flynn is being created in Gamemaker Studio 2, which is a great engine, but it currently does not support porting to the Switch. If we were to go for it now, Flynn would have to be recreated in an entirely new engine, which as you can imagine is a lot of work. Just know that Yoyo games is working hard on trying to make a Switch port possible! We can set up a later stretch goal for a Switch port, but until then we'll have to hope for the port to become available during Flynn's development! We'll keep everyone updated as Yoyo games and Nintendo work it out.
  From the very first stages of development, we began designing Flynn: Son of Crimson with fast paced, satisfying combat. We’re strong believers that ‘game feel’ should be priority in any video game so we've been injecting as much juice as we can to make sure every hit packs a punch and feels extra tasty.
Trade gems and trinkets acquired throughout the game to learn new techniques for Flynn’s arsenal, and you’ll soon find that you can figure out your own favourite combination of attacks (Smash, bash, tickle, tickle, bosh!). Designed with quick and easy weapon swapping in mind, you’re never more than a button press away from your desired weapon so you better dispatch your foes with flair, else you’re not the cool hero everyone thought! 
The Crimson Blade, a staple in Flynn's arsenal (and the default starting weapon, but that doesn’t sound as appealing!) is the first weapon of Crimson energy gifted to Flynn by the Goddess Sorrell in a great time of need. Unlocking and mastering the uppercut will provide some serious hang time to any foe that is on the receiving end. Or why not slice through many baddies with the piercing dash? Piece of cake.
The Crimson Axe demands precise timing and enemy prediction, trading the quick cuts of the crimson blade for a weighty windup, this axe packs a punch sure to leave your enemies as a smear on the floor. Use the axe to crush your enemy's shields, and smash brittle walls to access new areas with brute force. It’s a wonder how the young one can lift this, but as we wrote this we realized it is made of energy, whoops.
The Crimson Claws, a swift and energetic set of weapons used to stagger enemies with high attack speed and air superiority, if that’s your sort of thing. Unleash your inner wildcat with unique wall climbing (go home, Knuckles) and a spiral drill attack (you too, Taz) to tear into enemies and dig through soft ground, these high mobility weapons will have you on your toes and keep your hands warm.
What would our youthful hero be without a ranged weapon? That's right, a hero without a ranged weapon. So here's a bow, not any old bow, but a Super Awesome Crimson Bow™ (nice). Acquired early on in the game, this will help you hurt/take out weaker foes from a distance. Use the bow to trigger traps and puzzles, and even augment with elemental arrows such as ice, electricity, and explosive (explosions are an element, right?). Once you've unlocked them, it's your choice which to roll out with, depending on your play style, whoa!
Set in the world of Rosantica after the Great Conflict, a war that carried on for decades between parallel worlds, one of humanity, one of gods. The worlds once kept in peace by the Crimson Goddess Sorrell and Lord Zealock, now torn between each other.
The Great Conflict between overlapping worlds, caused by Sorrell’s forbidden love of a mortal knight, Allistair. Falling for humanity's innocence and good nature, Sorrell leaves her world for another, sending Zealock into madness with her involvement with the "frail humanity".
Decades of war have gone by between worlds, as things begin to look grim for the people of Rosantica. Realizing she can do no more to protect them from Zealock's growing rage, Sorrell initiates an ultimate sacrifice with her and her love, giving their lives to banish what has now become The Scourge. Locking Lord Zealock and his followers away to the malicious world they have created.
But don’t live in the past, the world around you is brimming with exploration and discovery. Track down a mysterious stranger that appears to be following you as the barrier between worlds begins to crack, and investigate her ties to The Scourge and Zealock.
  Roam the fantastic world both on foot and with your loyal companion Dex, a last gift from Sorrell and a guardian of Rosantica, helping both man and beast alike take back their homes. Will you follow Flynn on his journey through this war torn land?
  Venture into the heart of evil itself, and tackle the horrors of The Scourge head-on. A once pristine land of gods, now an infested land filled with hatred. Track clues about your past and the Crimson power that grows within you leading to this nest of evil, and uncover what really lies at the heart.
Flynn must hurry, with every passing day The Scourge’s hold on Rosantica grows, slowly plunging the world into madness and decay with its noxious corruption. You must seek to end Zealock’s reign of disease and lunacy before it’s too late. 
Traveling between dimensions, Flynn controls the ability to tear open portals to The Scourge with the power of Crimson. Finding alternate paths and searching for trapped Rosanticans taken away from their homes. But be wary, The Scourge has many eyes in search of Flynn.
    Journey through the vast island of Rosantica in search for answers to stop the land from falling victim to the corruption. The world is pieced together to transition seamlessly as you travel across the 5 unique regions.
Explore the frigid Mistral Peak – a frozen over mountain once brimming with enterprise and discovery of its rich natural resources and fossils, now fallen victim to The Scourge’s wretched influence in the form of a supernaturally dangerous blizzard. Discover what infernal power has summoned up this ferocious storm and help put a stop to it.
Wade through the once secluded and dazzling waters of The Hollow's Isles. A group of seaside caverns and alcoves that were once the pinnacle of natural beauty and serenity that have been ravaged by the relentless winds brought on by the blizzards of Mistral Peak above. Track your quest into the damp caves to battle off the mutated crustaceans that have forced out the indigenous Neptyn to flee their ancestral homes.
Lose yourself in the sprawling gardens of Rustwood. Home to the legendary proving grounds of the warrior tribe, the Mazir, and their Fighting Coliseum. The Mazir are a beetle-like people that are honor bound to prove themselves capable warriors by duking it out in this immense arena. Be warned, however, for The Scourge has seeped even into this land of once sacred trials. The swamps of Rustwood grow darker as each day goes by, causing hazardous poison storms to awaken.
Your quest for knowledge will eventually lead you to the home of all scholarly pursuits, the famed Shivering Spire. What used to be the beacon of knowledge and symbol of Rosantica’s prosperity, is now home to a portal of the netherworld, with its devout healers and once benevolent sorcerers now becoming vessels for The Scourge’s evil magic to pour into the world of Rosantica. Flynn will be bombarded with acolytes that are now driven mad by their enhanced dark powers, as well as assaulted by powerful warlocks that once dared to challenge gods themselves.
In between journeys, Flynn will return to Sanctia. A stronghold where his most valued allies reside, banding together to help Flynn fight off the corruption. Here Flynn will barter rare Crimson Shards found throughout the world for new techniques and upgrades, as well as complete quests for the villagers.
Flynn: Son of Crimson features crisp, hand-crafted pixel art that's designed to compliment its frenetic gameplay. Readability and strong visual tells are key components in our artistic process, as we realize how important it is for a game to be crystal-clear in its visual feedback to the player.  
Each chunky pixel is deliberately and thoughtfully placed to create a memorable world for players to explore. Mischievous goblins, big-bellied fish men, blood-thirsty wolves, and more are brought to life with expressive animations brimming with personality.
From concept art, to character sprites, and final polished animations - we aim to deliver a product we're truly proud of, and one that communicates to our players how much we truly care for the timeless and endearing craft of pixel-art!
    From our composer, Jacob Lincke: Starting with a clean slate is always exciting and inspiring. “Flynn: Son of Crimson” needs satisfying music to accompany its already magical looking art style. I started looking at things I thought the game reminded me of; other games, movies and even places in the real world. I want the soundtrack to have its own unique voice, instantly connecting it to the game.
I have a deep love for traditional folk music from all over the world which made me think of all sorts of fun instruments and what they could bring to the table. Flutes and keyed fiddles are combined with medieval lutes and finally mixed together with a grand orchestra making you feel less alone. All of this and a touch of retro synths to go along with the cute art style results in a collaboration between Scandinavian folk music and the Far East.
I imagined Flynn wandering enchanting forests such as those found in Ghibli movies and traversing cold mountains of my homeland Sweden. I want the music to help Flynn telling his story, setting the atmosphere and be beautiful at the same time.
    Always felt like you needed something Crimsony for your wall? Me too. Put this pretty 18" by 24" poster all over it and have your friends say, "whoa"! A beautiful illustration by Jaya Ply (@Nikingply).
Get warm with this high quality t-shirt designed by miski! Printed on a 50/50 blend shirt for maximum comfort. We may or may not kiss each one before they ship. T-shirt sizing and possible color options will be provided after the campaign.
Dig your eyes intothe Official Flynn: Son of Crimson art book containing used and unused concept art, pixel art, level design sketches, fan art, a deeper look into the lore, and more! Size of the book to be decided later in development, based on our content. 
Become one with the game with your spooky skeleton in the ground, and your likeness drawn in to your own gravestone to be placed in the Rustwood Graveyard. In other words, your face on a rock. 
Design an NPC to fit in to the game! We'll contact you to work on your NPC's design, personality, dialogue (nothing naughty!), back story, and favorite things.
Get your own custom room! You choose its location, style, what it's full of, maybe a bit of lore, maybe a bit of graffiti, maybe your face everywhere, I don't know. Put your own flair in to it!
Combine every design tier before to create a sidequest! Include your secret room and your NPC in this quest to make Flynn fetch a bucket of water, or to do 50 pushups, whatever your heart desires!
A story being told right from our hearts and fingers, Flynn is a young baby boy that has been on our minds over the last two years. As we write this, we are roughly one full year into development on Flynn: Son of Crimson from when we began putting this design all on paper.
actual paper!
So far being funded completely by our own money, we feel we're now in a good place to introduce Flynn to Kickstarter. In order to continue to fulfill our dreams in making Flynn a real boy, we need your support! We're very confident in the head start we have on the basics in design and development, with a lot of the core features already built and working. A large portion will be going to the art, allowing us to give our artists more consistent hours and maybe even hire extra help. Additionally, the sound is very important to us, so that will be a big investment as well.
Is this your first game? 
First bigger scale game, yes. We have 2 other games we released in the wild on mobile though, which can be found here:  
Samurai Blitz
Raccoon Rascals
We also have a couple projects we have worked on in the past that didn’t quite make the cut (we all have them), but we see them as more of a learning process and who knows, we may come back to them in 50 years time.
Special Thanks
Andrew Filip - Web design/development, help with the trailer.
Johan Aronson - Being part of Flynn's original birth long ago, and the title screen.
miski - Being the greatest for designing the t-shirt last minute with us.

updates.update_content:
Hello Flynn friends, been a while! As we near the end of development, these updates get a little more difficult, so we're sorry for the delay. As always, if we're quiet, we're just working hard :) Now have some news on the release!
Beta Backers

Hey Crimson babies, we just wanted to send out a quick on update on how progress has been during the current world situation, and give you some Flynn gameplay to look at!
We've done our best to keep development going at a steady rate, and Flynn is as healthy as ever! Each member of the team has had their own experience with quarantine, as we are based in several states in the US, as well as England and Sweden. We're lucky to work remotely, so we can continue the same way, but we're doing our best to take care of our personal mental health through this difficult time. We hope all of you are doing well through this tough time!

Hey Flynn fans, we hope you've all had a good start to 2020 so far! It has been a little while since our last update, and we do apologize for the silence. We're still working full time and putting everything we can in to the game, so rest assured our silence doesn't mean any delays are happening in development! Sometimes we just have to keep game secrets for the final release ya know, but here are a bunch of GIFs to look at as usual!
Hello Crimson children! While we are working hard on that 2020 release date, here are some juicy GIFs for you all showing off some gameplay with your favorite puppy companion, Dex!

Hey all Flynn fans, we have big news we can finally reveal today!
We're very happy to announce that we've partnered with Humble as Flynn's publisher! We've been working together for quite a while now, with them helping take a large load off of our shoulders so we can whip Flynn into shape and focus on making the best game possible for all of you!

Hello friends, your favorite horses back with another Flynn update. What better way to start than with some GIFs!
Puzzley bits
We've been having some fun with small puzzles recently, creating a nice balance between platforming/puzzles and combat. Flynn does more than just slice clublins all day!

updates.update_userinfo: Puzzles, NPCs, and info on delays
updates.update_content:
Hello all! It’s your favorite sparkly horses back again for another quick mini update on Flynn!
Continuing from our last update about the release, we don't have the juicy details to share yet. What we can share is that Flynn's story is complete, and the game's overall design is completely laid out and being pieced together. Things are definitely going very well in Flynn world!

updates.update_userinfo: More Flynn candy for your eyeballs
updates.update_content: So we've reached the February 2019 rough estimate we set over a year ago when our campaign first launched. For those asking for an update on that, we of course won't be hitting our estimate but we can assure you that progress lately has been great! We can't show you very much with what we're doing at the moment (spoilers duh), but just know that we’ve been very happy with the progress, even if it has been silent. You will all be the first to hear when we have a release date, but there just isn’t anything we can promise right now, we hope you all understand!

updates.update_content:
Hello once again to all you Crimson babes, we hope you've had a great start to 2019 so far! 2018 was a pretty exciting year for us, even though we have to keep most of it a secret! We'll be sharing these new developments in Flynn town soon, but for now, here's what we've been up to after our holiday season refresh. 
For this year we're planning to update you more often on our developments with frequent, smaller updates just so we don't disappear for as long. Though if your eyeballs are ever feeling lonely and need some extra Flynn pixels, we're often active on our Twitter with GIFs! -

campaign.story:
Hi, my name is Tom Lintern and this campaign is for my graphic novel Girrion. This campaign is specifically for the funding the creation Issues 8 and 9, which will complete Volume1. That means MOST of the book is already complete. I only have about 50 pages to go out of the 225+ pages in the series.
New to the story? Not to worry!  All of Volume 1 is available in this campaign. Also Issues 8 and 9 will be of course available as well for those who have already been following along.
Thanks to the lovely and amazing Kickstarter community I've had Issues 2 - 7 funded on previous campaigns. This project began years ago and has slowly turned into something I am really devoted to and would love to work on for years to come.
GIRRION is a sweeping sci-fi fantasy story of a hero's journey in a distant world in a distant time. The saga is told through the eyes of Jarra, a poor factory worker who dreams of escaping his world of endless toil. His wish comes true, though not in a way he would have ever wanted, when his city is attacked by a dark entity called the Halodron. He escapes the conflict, but only to be thrust into a war of other-worldy magic and weaponry.
Amidst the destruction, history begins to unravel as soldiers of a forgotten war resurface and the secrets of a mysterious technology known as Girrion come to light as its scattered remains suddenly start to “reawaken”. With little time and resources, the hero must help save his crumbling empire from its destructive past.
        Inking in progress
        Volume 1 cover art in progress
     Girrion started off as a hobby over 15 years ago. Initially it was more of an illustration portfolio than a story. I wanted to be a concept artist, so I would spend a lot of time designing characters, ships and environments.
I didn't consider myself a writer back then, but I started getting ideas for a story. When I would draw environments or characters the ideas would just pop in my head. One scene led to another, then another etc. It took a lot of time, but the experience put in over the years not only helped the art, it also gave me time to develop the story more and give it more depth than it had in the earlier drafts.
Age Range: (PG - PG-13 )
- No sex or bad language
- No excessive gore. Girrion is primarily about a war so there is cartoon violence similar to the level of Star Wars, but more of it.
            This will be the first campaign where a full volume book is available. It will be 225+ pages in length. 6.14" x 9.2"
Volume 1 mockup. Cover art and design are in progress.
 Previous campaigns single issues were available in hardcover or softcover, and these formats will be available in this campaign as well. 
Sample Hardcover (Issue #7)
 Hardcover comic issues are 6" x 9". Grey cloth with a dust jacket. Each issue is anywhere from 22 - 26 pages in length.
Softcover samples (Issues 1-9)
Softcover comic issues are 6"x9" and have a glossy cover with a stock thicker than standard comics. The interior art is full color and has a watercolor feel.
Sample Character Sketch
  Sample 4" x 6" print
  How Do Add Ons Work?
Here's what you do:
Click "Manage Your Pledge" in the upper right corner (blue button) Add the total of your Add On to your pledge amount. (i.e. one Giclee Fine art print is $25.) You don't need to change the tier you've selected You are done! Later you'll get a backer survey asking how you spent your add-on dollars and for other pertinent info. Thank you!
  Generally, about half of my expenses come from printing the books and mailing them. The other half of the budget is going into the production. Most of what this campaign money goes towards is large chunks of time for me to focus fully on the book. One issue takes me 300 - 400 hours. If I'm able to knock off some days working freelance on other jobs, the books come out much faster.
  Scout Comics is now publishing Girrion! They released Issue 1 last October and will be releasing books up through this Fall. They are an indie publisher– very supportive of their creators and just a great group of people all around. They also have a wide range of comics which you can check out on their site. www.scoutcomics.com
Follow
Website: www.girrion.com
Twitter: www.twitter.com/Girrion1
Instagram: www.instagram.com/girrion1/
Facebook: www.facebook.com/girrion1/
Music from Kickstarter Video: "Night Owl" by Broke For Free
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Being that this is not the first comic I've made there aren't too many major challenges with getting the book made, but there are some small ones:

Some of the artwork on certain pages goes fast, some takes very long. There are some complex scenes in this issue with lots of characters and elements that need strong design. Again from past experience, the artwork can sometimes take a bit longer than expected. Also, keep in mind I have to mix this work in with the day job.

I've learned a lot from previous Kickstarter campaigns, and I am getting more and more efficient. I'm also trying to find ways to make rewards as cost-effective as possible too. One way of doing this is to do more than one issue per campaign, which cuts down on mailing costs. Before it took so long to complete just one issue and I could only offer one per campaign, but now I plan on doing 2 -3 issues per campaign from now on.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

This pledge rewards backers with 50 total dwarves of their choice from both the kickstarter funding and the red box games dvergr catalogue.
Backers can expand their rewards by managing the amount of their pledge upward by the amount needed to cover the additional items desired.
Please see the project campaign page for full details and descriptions and exact amount needed to cover each of the add-ons.

updates.update_userinfo: Goblins and Trolls and Wolves Oh My!!
updates.update_content:
Hey Everybody!
 I have just released my newest work in the Red Box Games store. Currently on pre order status these new releases will begin shipping around the 22nd of March I have a new set of goblin warriors accompanied by a goblin thief a goblin hunter and two goblin shaman perfect for an intrepid adventure into the ruins of the Cold North. These Goblins are accompanied by two faithful Wolves.....err well....wolves who have not decided to eat them yet, and three Trolls. The figures are all single piece figures cast in high quality lead free white metal but the trolls each have universally interchangeable weapon types and one of the trolls has an optional shield included as well. I have also created a bundle deal that gets you all of the new releases for 20% off RRP but this bundle deal is strictly limited in quantity to 75 so once those are sold the bundle will no longer be available.

updates.update_userinfo: Aaaaannddd Done All remaining packages are going out this week
updates.update_content:
At long last I can report quite happily that we are shipping the last of the packages this week. they are packed and labeled and ready to go to the PO.
There are a couple of backers still needing to give us addresses for the their packages so please check your PM box tosee if we messaged you in regard to this.

Hey everybody,
   I am very sorry for the long silence and most of all for the long drag out of this fulfillment. It has been a trial for me and definitely a very hard lesson. I truly regret stretching yall's patience as far as I have in the fulfillment of this campaign but at long last I can say that we finally have everything we need to complete the fulfillment and that the last few packages will be shipped within the week. I am very sorry for the delays and I do very much appreciate yall's patience with me in this.

Hey Guys,
  I am VERY sorry for the long wait and long silence from me. I have been busy trying to get all the moving pieces into order and get this kickstarter finished delivering and now trying to get the latest RBG kickstarter fulfillment underway. Some of you who are waiting now elected to have your warbands V rewards shipped with your warbands VI rewards. We have had to re order a restock of a few figures from Warbands V. I thought that we only needed some 30 odd figures each to finish the fulfillment of warbands V when in reality we needed some 60 odd figures of each. Those are ordered and due for delivery any day now. We also are awaiting delivery of two figures which were missing from the warbands VI selection to be able to fulfill some of those ordered awaiting Warbands VI and V together. Those figures are ordered and will be shipping soon as well.

   All told the fulfillment of this kickstarter was just a slow moving train wreck. It really has been. I just botched it at every stage and for that I am very sorry.

hey everybody!
   Ok we have received the restock we were awaiting and have resumed shipment of rewards. I wish I could say that we have seen the last of the delays but we do still have a slight hiccup to work through. There was apparently a miss-numbering either in my catalog or in the mold labels as we did not receive restocks of two figures ordered. We are still able to ship a lot of rewards packages and the missing figures are on order and expected relatively shortly. There is no more misunderstanding of the shipping address to contend with and there are less figures needed in the restock so they should arrive in short order, but I did want to keep you guys in the know as much as possible while we sort through this.

hey everybody,
   Ok the awaited restock was mistakenly shipped to my previous address in another state. But not to worry the caster had the package rerouted and has received the package already and will be re-shipping it to me tomorrow. So the long awaited restock will be in hand next week. Possibly by Monday, we shall hope anyway. So if yall can bear with me just a little further we will FINALLY have this all wrapped up very soon!

Hey everybody,
    Sorry I missed last week's update. I was at Adepticon. There were a lot of packages that did go out last week though! More going out this week as well! This WILL be wrapping up very soon guys! I really appreciate yall's patience with me on this and i assure you that we are working on this as quickly as possible.

campaign.story:
Pocket Ops is a 2-player game of deduction and area control. As Spymasters, position your Spies and Specialists to outmaneuver your opponent and dominate the battlefield.
Players must stay one step ahead of their opponent on a battleground that is as much in the minds of the Spymasters as on the board. Predict your opponent’s moves to prevent them from gaining ground, and when all hope seems lost, snatch victory away from your opponent with clever use of your Specialist agents.
If you are the first to capture both parts of the Doomsday Device, it’s game over for your opponent.
A quick review of the game board and object will reveal that Pocket Ops is based on the familiar framework of tic-tac-toe — but don't write it off as child's play just yet! The prediction mechanic and Specialist abilities have been proven to offer playtesters both challenge and laughter. Don't believe it? Check out the sample Print n' Play files below:
   ...or check out the Tabletop Simulator mod on Steam!
  Pocket Ops is the first published design of Brandon Beran, with art and graphic design by industry veteran Josh Cappel.
         Pocket Ops is quick to pick up, because you already know how to play; If you've played Tic-Tac-Toe before, you have the fundamentals: place markers in a grid, trying to get three in a row. But wait! The simple but game-changing twist with Pocket Ops is that before you make a move, the other player gets to secretly predict where you are going to go. After your move, if they were right, your move is canceled. In addition, a variety of Specialist tokens that introduce all sorts of sneaky abilities will change the way you place and predict. Pocket Ops takes a classic framework and breathes surprising life into it. For a more detailed look, check out this fantastic overview by Tantrum House, below:

                                                              For all backers, we are charging shipping as indicated. For Canadians, this also covers import taxes and customs duties.
Unfortunately, we can't offer the same outside the US and Canada, because it is simply too expensive. However, any EU orders will be "EU Friendly", in that they will not incur VAT or customs fees on delivery.
  We know that international shipping is annoyingly expensive; believe us, we are just as annoyed as you are! However, to help offset the shipping costs a bit, we have created the 4- and 10-copy levels with lower pricing per copy.
     We are very happy to bring this project to you via Kickstarter. Keeping true to our philosophy, we have asked for an amount that will get us halfway to what we need to produce the game. It will take about twice as much money as we are asking to bring Pocket Ops to life, and our part is ready. You showed amazing support for the Guild with Unreal Estate, and we know we can count on your for this current project. 
~Fondly,
Marc Specter, GuildMaster

Risks and challenges
As with any project that involves the production and manufacture of a good to be delivered, there is certainly a real chance for hiccups and delays. Many board game projects on Kickstarter have been seriously hampered by art production delays, problems with an overseas factory, missing units and one shipping snafu after another.

We won't lie - stuff happens. Delays can occur. Sometimes you have to go back and forth on color samples six times just to get the color right, and even then the color isn't perfect. But what we do promise is that we will hold ourselves to the same high standards and transparency we expect from other board game publishers and our previous projects, and we will be completely honest and open with each of you every step of the way.

Aside from artwork changes that may come about as a result of stretch goals, this game is finished and ready to go to Bang Wee, the experienced manufacturer of our two previous titles.

We learned a lot from our first Kickstarter campaign, and we feel confident that those lessons will help us make this campaign successful.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Shenanigans are afoot at the North Pole!
updates.update_content:
Good afternoon, Agents! It's been a while. I hope this update finds you safe and healthy in these challenging times.
As fans of small portable games, I wanted to let you know about our latest project. Grand Gamers Guild is proud to announce our 18-card escape room game: The Kringle Caper!
Endangered needs your support!
Good morning Agents! It's been a while, but today I'm going to ask you to look at a new mission profile: Project Shikoku!

Good morning Agents. It's been a while.
I wanted to reach out and let you know that we just launched our next game on Kickstarter: The Artemis Project.

To you that have supported us previously, we go live at 9 tomorrow morning. Feel free to check out the video and the campaign. We hope to see you there: https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/burntislandgames/1508813296?ref=433593&token=de981c5c

Today ends the voting for the BGG Most Anticipated Games of 2018 nominations. If you’ve not already given a thumb to our next project Endeavor, please do: https://www.boardgamegeek.com/geeklist/231943/item/5764955#item5764955
If you want to find out more about the progress of the project, visit endeavorgame.com. Thanks!

Hey everyone! Fulfillment began earlier this week, and we're getting comments that Pocket Ops is showing up on your doorsteps. Very exciting! Hopefully you can get your first games in this weekend. Be sure to take pictures for us to post on our Facebook page as well as BoardGameGeek.
And speaking of BGG... Can I ask a favor? Would you go and rate Pocket Ops for us? The more ratings we get, the higher we'll climb. The higher we climb, the more copies we'll sell. And the more we sell, the greater the chance for a reprint and additional content.

Good morning Agents! You might be saying, "That is a very strange name for a Backer update." Well, that is the number of miles I traveled yesterday over 13 hours to take care of Pocket Ops fulfillment for you. If you follow us on Facebook, you might have caught the 3 short videos I posted yesterday in my travels.
This was one of those situations where you wait, and wait, and wait, and then everything happens all at once. Our lovely little game was making its way cross country, when I got the call Monday morning that the games were in fact in Ft. Wayne IN and would be delivered to Impressions the next day (Tue Nov 28). The calendar showed that I did not have any commitments, and so shortly after 8a the next day I got in the car and drove to Ft. Wayne.

Good morning Agents! Good news abounds!
We recently got the notification from the logistics company that Pocket Ops is on our shores. As of the original note 3 days ago, it was waiting for customs clearance and off-loading. Once that is complete, it will be separated from the rest of the container in which it traveled and then begin the journey to Impressions in Ft. Wayne, Indiana.

In the Pocket
Pocket Ops has been an amazing success at Essen! It’s very easy to underestimate a game as simple as this one… even being the publisher, I still do it myself! But then I play the game, and BAM, I realize why I signed it. We’ve gotten so many great reactions when people have that “Oh my gosh!” moment.

The only other option is to keep all the discs hidden some way but just being able to flip them to a blank side so your opponent can't see seems to be the most logical solution.

Regarding the standard meeples - I prefer the silkscreen option, but also can see a desire for only 1-sided printing. Not for when they're laid out in front of me after the specialist selection, but for when played on the board. This way, it's easier to analyze the board at a glance because the only visible symbols are those of the specialists. Having them printed on only one side allows for players to choose which they prefer (visible or printed side up) when playing on the board.

campaign.story:
HELLO AGAIN KICKSTARTER!!! RBG FANS AND FRIENDS!
  Once again we venture into the great Cold North in search of secrets, lore, treasure, and adventure. This time though we walk the snowy tracts and icy ruins in the company of Aenglishmen, The haughty neighbors of the mighty Njorn who dwell upon the Great Isles not far out to sea and westward. Our band begins led by the intrepid Lady Elsbeth Halford of Guillingshire and her faithful apprentice William the Astute accompanied by William's Ne'er Do Well half sister Thea the Swift and her " Cousins " Barret's Band; A band of 7 ready and able men at arms whose loyalty is a pure and sure as the gold of the coin that buys it.
  All figures are planned to be produced in high quality lead free white metal and will be supplied with one 25mm round plastic base.
  The figures intended for production through the funding of this campaign are;

   one ( 1 ) single piece female fighter with two handed weapon
       More examples of my Red Box Games catalogue:
           Production..........................  
   I work with a great team of very talented and reliable contractors who handle all of the mold making and metal and resin casting of my products and I have operated for 9 years a live webstore where in you can view and purchase any one of my currently available products.
  http://red-box-games.com
Shipping.............................
  All packages will be shipped with all the necessary cushion and damage prevention measures we can provide to make sure that your goodies arrive safe and sound and in pristine condition.  
WE WILL NOT BE SHIPPING VIA FOREIGN FULFILLMENT PARTNERS.
   I understand that backers would prefer to avoid customs fees if possible but my experience has taught me that I end up paying for those fees in the cost to ship the packages to the fulfillment partners and then I further have a greater amount of work to manage the fulfillment. My past fulfillment partner in Hasslefree has been great to work with but it is just a MASSIVE over complication and over expense of the process. When I can far more swiftly, efficiently, and cheaply fulfill from here in the US direct to any backer anywhere in the world.
  About me............................    
   For those who are unfamiliar with me as a sculptor and with my business red box games I am a sculptor of finely detailed 28mm scale fantasy miniatures. Most often specializing in minis of a Norse theme. I founded my business in 2008 and have been producing miniatures ever since. In that time I have produced some 300 odd figures for my various ranges of Men, Elves, Dwarves, Goblins, Halflings, Orcs, Demons, and Undead of all kind of role for each of those range themes. I have now run 7 kickstarters and have fully delivered on 7. I always strive to produce figures of the highest possible quality and have gone to great lengths to see to it that I deliver fully on all of my promises.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Risks and Challenges........................ I have a great deal of experience in the running and delivery of kickstarters and 9 years experience in the industry dealing with all the various aspects of producing and marketing miniatures. These aspects include design, sculpting, coordinating production, quality control, packaging and shipment. I maintain a very close relationship with my customers and backers well after the sale is made. I have run several successful campaign which delivered on time and to expectation, but even in the kickstarters which delivered late I have always delivered in full as promised. I very keenly understand the hurtles which may present themselves during the fulfillment of kickstarters and I am ready to deal with any of them. You can rest fully assured that I will deliver your rewards to you if you back my campaign. You are who make it possible for me to do what i love to do and I do NOT take that for granted.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Join the Cognitive Drawing Mailing List Here:
Cognitive Drawing Mailing List Signup!
I believe EVERYONE can teach themselves how to draw!
You don't need an expensive education or thousands of hours of practice to start seeing results either. All you need is to learn this simple method of Cognitive Drawing and you will soon be decoding and memorizing how to draw things like you never imagined possible. 
How can I make such a bold claim? Because this technique is exactly how I taught myself how to draw.
I believe that with Cognitive Drawing you will quickly learn how to test yourself and force your brain to start memorizing what you are learning. 
What is Cognitive Drawing?
Cognitive Drawing will be an easy (90+ page) workbook designed to teach you how to learn to draw anatomy from memory. Not only will you learn to draw but you will learn to do it in a way that helps your brain retain what you learned. 
This book is perfect for beginners and intermediate artists of all ages.
The technique in this book is exactly how I (Jason Brubaker) taught myself to draw as a teenager without an expensive art education. At the age of twenty I was hired by a storyboarding agency in Los Angeles and I have been a professional artist ever since working in storyboards, animation and visual development on some of the biggest movies and commercials in Hollywood. (You can see my IMDB credits here.)
We are printing the book on sketch book paper perfect for drawing with pencil.
How did Cognitive Drawing start?
Back in the mid 90's when I was trying to learn to draw, I developed this method while trying to memorize anatomy and different artistic styles. Although I didn't have a name for it yet, it was the way that I was able to learn anatomy quickly. It was't long before I was able to draw anatomy and styles quickly from memory and I attribute much of this success to this method.
Over the years I have tried to explain the Cognitive Drawing method to friends assuming that others were doing it as well. To my surprise, I have never found anyone teaching or using this technique. Twenty years later I decided to make an experimental worksheet to show a drawing class how to quickly learn to draw things on their own. To my surprise, about 90% of the students found my method surprisingly easy and highly effective for learning to draw from memory. 
Since it worked so well for others I decided that it was time to try to make a Cognitive Drawing book using this technique to aid in learning one of the hardest things to learn to draw: anatomy. I announced the idea on my Youtube channel and nearly 100 people signed up to be beta testers for an experimental 40 page anatomy book using Cognitive Drawing. 
After a few months of testing Cognitive Drawing the beta testers were finished and sent me their results and I was once again blown away with the high percentage of positive feedback and massive improvement for almost all of the beta testers.
The beta-test worked better than I expected again but it still needed much improvement to be a real workbook. I received much needed feedback from the testers and studied all the problem areas in their drawings I was able to refine Cognitive Drawing into an amazing and fun daily exercise designed to walk a beginner artist through the entire male figure (from any angle or pose) within a month.
What is in the Cognitive Drawing Book?
Cognitive Drawing will be a 96+ page workbook book designed to fold flat so you can draw on all the pages. 
(The page count will keep growing as we hit stretch goals. I would like to get it up to 140 pages if possible.)
About 60% of the workbook will be cognitive drawing worksheets and the rest of the book is full of lessons and exercises to help you tie it all together. This book will help you memorize proportions of body and face, muscle groups, poses and more and will show you how to use Cognitive Drawing to learn how to memorize any drawing style you find. 
Along with Cognitive Exercises the book is filled with muscle breakdowns and other exercises that helped me understand how to build a figure from scratch. Here are some samples of some of the daily exercises:
The book will be a combination of Cognitive Drawing exercises mixed with anatomy breakdowns and other drawing lessons.
Once you complete the book, not only will you know anatomy but you will also be able to use this technique with all kinds of other reference material like: anatomy books, comic books, robots, dinosaurs, aliens, monsters, machines, manga, your favorite artists or even photos. The sky is the limit!
Who Is Cognitive Drawing For?
The book is designed for Homeschoolers, Drawing Groups, Classrooms and personal use. There is no nudity in the book so it's safe for all ages.
I have seen much improvement in students ages of 8 and up. As long as there is a desire to learn to draw and you can spend about 30 minutes a day focused on doing an exercise then this is for you.
Backed by Science?
Interestingly enough, some of my findings agree with what scientists have learned about how the brain learns and retains information. This is the field of Cognitive Psychology. I have even interviewed a Cognitive Scientist who experimented with my method and he has helped me develop it to be even better than I expected.
I will post an interview with him here where he breaks down the scientific principles used in Cognitive Drawing and why they work.
Production Timeframe
There are about 3 months of production left on the book depending on how many extra pages we can get funding to add. I would like to be able to make the book 140 pages but this would mean hitting stretch goals. So depending on how many pages the final book is will determine how quickly it goes to print.
Once printing begins it will take about 3 months to have the books in my studio and they will be shipped out shortly after that.
I am setting the delivery deadline to April 2018 as a worst case scenario. But the funding amount will determine the exact timeframe and we might be able to have the books in your hands by this Christmas. 
Money
I am planning to print 3000 copies of this book quoted at $10,410. With shipping estimates as well as Kickstarter fees and Card processing fees, it will be over $16,000. We need another 9k for the remaining production costs and assistance to complete all the pages and worksheets. This brings our total to $24,900 to make sure this book can get off the ground.
If we don't reach this goal then I will not be able to invest the time or money to get the book printed so please help by sharing this with everyone you know who wants to learn how to draw.
Who Am I?
I'm Jason Brubaker. I am a self taught artist. I started my professional career at the age of 19 and have worked for more than 20 years in the entertainment industry on big movies (Blade, Pitch Black, Kung Fu Panda 1, 2 & 3) and hundreds of commercials before launching my own company to publish graphic novels and books. Now I self-publish graphic novels for a living. You can see my books here: http://CoffeeTableComics.com
I've spoken at grade schools, high schools, colleges, libraries and comic conventions about making comics and doing art for a living. For speaking enquiries about Cognitive Drawing please contact CoffeeTableComics@gmail.com.

One of these was simply the delivery company not getting it to the backer which was eventually resolved by sending a replacement and the other one was a backer not happy with a defective casting that was resolved by substitution and replacement. We believe we have a 100% backer satisfaction record after two successful kickstarters. We're not perfect but if a problem does arise we do our honest best to resolve any issues. 

An unforeseen event, though unlikely, could be, well, unforeseen. Should anything go awry, I pledge to keep our backers up to date on any delays or scheduling changes that might occur.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
We're preparing the next project and I thought I'd update here to let our backers get a sneak peak.  This one is for fantasy miniatures.  I hope some of you are Fantasy fans as well as Sci-Fi fans.  This is a preview link for the Kickstarter page we are working on.  
Significant Seven Dwarves.  
Our next Sci-Fi kickstarter will be for the brainworm aliens.  Most of the figures are already done for that project but we feel we really need to get the game completed before moving forward with them.  I'll keep you guys up to date as we make progress.

Here are the last of the orders we have received.  As of right now, every order we received has either been mailed or is waiting on the postman to pick it up in the morning.  We still have several unclaimed coupons and they are still valid.   You can turn those in as is convenient for you and we'll get them out ASAP.  I would say we have successfully completed our third Kickstarter Project.

Making Infestor Eggs this afternoon.  Most of the orders we received are already boxed up and likely to ship out tomorrow.  Any of you not turning in your order yet, check your e-mail for you code and get it in.  We're ready to take the orders and ship it out.  We should be able to finish this project up nearly as quickly as you get your order in.

We are sending the coupon codes out right now so you should be getting them soon.  You will be getting a store credit for the amount of your pledge. You should feel free to pick anything you like.  You're not necessarily limited to the item you pledged for.  You don't need to add your stretch goal rewards as they will be added by us when we ship.  Anyone entitled to stretch goals will have those added automatically by us after you place the order.
Here is a shot of the first castings of the stretch goals.  As soon as I get these done, that will just leave the clear eggs for me to get cast.  We should get this ready to wrap up next week.

As noted in the last update, my prints for these two models were way too small and had to be re-printed.  I received the new prints yesterday and have a new master mold for these two insect drones.  I think Trenchworx did a great job printing Kevin Contos'  digital sculpts for us.  I just took these two photos of literally the first metal castings of these models.  So for now, these are the only copies of these two models in existence. That will no longer be true tomorrow.

While we're waiting on the final two prints to be delivered, I'll leave this here to wet your appetite for the next faction.  
This is a better look at the turn around from the end of the movie.  This is the combat amor for the brainworms.  We're currently planning these for a new campaign likely this summer but no date is yet set.  I'm really happy with the way they have turned out so far.  These are sculpted by Kevin Contos.  This display model was painted by Malevminis.
Here is one of the Brainworm models painted by Malevolent Miniatures. We have new backbiters and infested troopers coming too.  Join us next time.  Same infested time.  Same infested channel.

I made an error when I scaled the STL files and sent them in to the printer.  We have metals of everything for this kickstarter now except for the two models below which we should get replacement prints later next week.  Even though the prints we received were VERY TINY, I went ahead and molded them anyway.  Surprisingly, I still got castings at this size.  Below is a photo of the out of scale casting resting on a penny for scale.  Don't worry, the actual models will be about 10 times larger than this and fill most of a 1" base.  I thought it might be fun to let you see these tiny metal mites.

campaign.story:
Enter the savage ruins of Relicblade. Face new horrors with sword and shild or embrace a dark alliance as they delve into the unknown depths of Relicblade.
The Bone and Darkness Kickstarter campaign offers the opportunity to add rad new characters to Relicblade. These expansions not only present the chance to expand the game, but also offer a great entry point for new players. The Bone and Darkness Kickstarter campaign promises to deliver all-new factions, characters, unit types, upgrades, and dark new powers that add wonderfully to an already delightful fantasy-battle experience.
Get both of the new expansions and eight incredible miniatures with the recommended Bold Adventurer pledge level!
European backers will have their rewards shipped from Germany.
Bone and Darkness
Mysterious skull faced villains stalk the wild-lands. Early reports indicated these sinister watchers had something to do with the Pig-Men. Now we find that these dark wanderers are an evil threat unlike anything we've seen before. 
The Dark Wanderer model kit includes the option to assemble the character with a Longbow or a Maul. Choose your favorite or buy an extra kit in the add-ons so you can have both builds.
The Dark Wanderers are unyielding warriors whose martial prowess is undeniable. They often carry powerful mauls or strange bone-bows. One must never underestimate these foes. Some have slaughtered legendary knights in single combat. Others expertly kill from a distance with jagged bone arrows then silently disappear into unnatural darkness.
These wanderers wield dark bone-magic, a new form of necromancy that spurs unnatural growth and creates mutated skeletal monstrosities. Unlike the dead who haunt the ruins, bound to this world by ancient magic, these creatures behave as beasts. They are furious, manic, beings who attack without provocation and with unnatural savagery.
the arms swap on these guys.
The bone construct is the most disturbing of all. It is a towering creature assembled from the magic-warped bones of multiple bodies. Without any life of it's own, these infernal engines of destruction are powered by life-force torn from its allies. These unstoppable monsters are immensely strong, and are able to unleash a fearsome howl that can shatter the will of the most stalwart hero.
3D renders of the Bone and Darkness Faction Pack
The Lone Guard
Much of what we know about the horror of the coming Darkness is through the valiant efforts of the Lone Guard. The Lone Guard is an ancient order of warriors and rangers who patrol the wilderness. They are an ever vigilant force against every kind of impending threat.
The Lone Guard Rangers are hardy frontiersmen who travel hidden paths and have an uncanny kinship with nature. Armed with a keen longbow, the rangers are deadly hunters who stalk both powerful game and fiendish enemies.
Some rangers have forged powerful bonds with the Smilodon Fatalis. These saber-toothed cats are natural predators who take to the partnership in deadly accord. The Saber-toothed cat uses its powerful claws to wrestle its prey into position before using its dagger-like fangs. Working in tandem with a ranger the cat will hold the prey in an exposed position creating an opening for its partner to land a singularly deadly strike.
A Saber-tooth Cat?! UGH! SO COOL!
The Lone Guard Warriors are lightly armored fighters who are quick to respond to any threat. These intrepid fighters dive into combat with razor sharp skill and deadly poise. Their preferred armament is the bastard sword and round shield. They use both as weapons for quick attack and defense, and are a versatile presence on the battlefield.
Oh rad.
The Billman brings a useful set of skills to any warband. His polearm grants a reach advantage, while the hooked end can be used to force the enemy off balance. These trained soldiers work in close partnership with whoever hires them, and are ready to hook a shield or deliver a finishing blow as needed.
Handsome mustache included at no extra charge.
3D renders of The Lone Guard Faction Pack.
The wave two expansions introduce two new character types to Relicblade. The Bone and Darkness expansion introduces the construct character type. Constructs have no life of their own and enter play inert. Through the application of specific magic, players will be able to bring these creatures to bare against their foes. Constructs are a powerful addition to your war band for relatively few points. The real cost to your war party will be what it takes to keep the terrible bone construct empowered. Constructs can only be removed from play by magical attacks while inert, and will likely remain a relevant game-changing piece through the entire battle.
The Lone Guard expansion brings the much anticipated companion character type to the game. Companions operate in tandem with the character that hires them. A skilled billman can be attached to your hero for a few extra points. These two characters can activate together to use their skills and abilities to achieve incredible things.
Ranger and companion Smilodon support one another in this dangerous encounter.
Each of the new Relicblade faction packs will include a special scenario related to the faction. These thematic adventures add fun context to your battles. The scenarios will also seamlessly integrate into the forthcoming campaign rules for Relicblade! 
Learn more about Relicblade on the page for the Original Kickstarter Campaign or at www.relicblade.com
Choose the pledge level that's right for you. Remember, by backing Relicblade you're helping it exist! Get ahold of this delightfully unique miniatures game. Relicblade is 100% natural, pure, and unfiltered imagination that is bottled at the source. It is untouched by the sanitizing influence of a board-room or stock-holders. Enjoy the benefits of live and active gaming cultures.
European backers will have their rewards shipped from Germany.
Your wife won't be mad. It costs less than a (fancy) sandwich...
Take the oath of the Lone Guard and resist the Darkness!
No good-guys for me, thanks. There is only darkness in this mortal shell.
 If you're new to Relicblade the "Champion of Adventure" is AWESOME! At this mega-rad pledge level you'll get the core game along with the "Bone and Darkness" and "The Lone Guard" expansions. This pledge level includes twenty one metal miniatures, the rulebook, tokens, dice, and not to mention 70+ unique cards including all kinds of amazing characters, magic swords, advanced battle tactics, and even snacks incase your pigs get a bit hungry.
Stretch Goals are a lot of the fun of Kickstarter.  I have a few particularly awesome things that I really want to make. Without a little extra success here I won't be able to take on the projects right away. If we are able to unlock these stretch goals they'll be made available as add-ons. So here's hoping y'all love Relicblade half as much as I do, and we can get this mind blisteringly awesome stuff together!
The Deep: Guest Artist Series
As the creator of Relicblade I have enjoyed unprecedented creative freedom, and thanks to your help I've been able to get my unfiltered imagination onto tabletops the world over! It's such an incredible experience that I want to share it with artists who have styles that shouldn't be filtered before smashing up dungeons around the world. In accordance with what is right and just, I'm launching the Relicblade Guest Artist Series.
I first saw Keegan Kaya McGee's work on ye olde world wide web. His art delights me to no end. His style is a similar mixture of badass and goofy like my own. However, his work is completely different in so many fantastic ways! This wonderful blend of similar yet completely wacky and unique made him the perfect choice for my first guest artist. Keegan did the illustrations for the cards, we collaborated on the rules, and I'll do the sculpture! It's all very exciting...
I can't imagine not falling in love with this stuff. but that's up to you. Definitely check out keegankayamcgee.com and use your eye-balls to soak up some @KeeganKayaMcGee and the tag #thingsyoumightfindinadungeon on Instagram.
The multi part miniature can be assembled as the Shark Warrior or the Eel Sorcerer!!
I want the Campaign Rules so bad I can taste it. It's a pretty big undertaking so I needed to place the goal up here at 15k. I know I'll need to take a pretty decent chunk of time out of regular work to make this happen, but I sure as heck want to. I love a good pick-up death-match style game, but especially in a fantasy setting like this I want to see my characters advance and take on dangerous new adventures. 
What are Add-Ons?
Add-ons give Backers the option to add extra bits to their rewards for a little extra money. This is the best opportunity for people to grab extra components to optimize their Relicblade experience.
The Faction sets are right around 65-70 points worth of characters in-game. Since a standard game is 100 points a few Pigs, some extra Bone Stalkers, a Knight, some Thieves, or a noble Cleric of Justice, will bump your war-band to full fighting strength right off the bat.
Using the marketplace below you can look at what is available and adjust your pledge accordingly. I want to make sure you get everything you want out of this Kickstarter campaign, and I believe this will help. 
Shipping
Shipping will be processed through Kickstarter, the old fashioned way. When you select your pledge level you will also be asked to add USA, Canada, or "rest of world" shipping. I do my best to ship in the most affordable way I can manage, but it's still pretty costly to ship internationally. I'm sorry for that.
The note about "add-on" shipping only really applies if you ordered at the digital scholar, or scholar levels. Scholar level will ask for a little shipping, but if you add a box set we'll need to make sure we have enough postage.
Relicblade miniatures are carefully crafted white-metal model kits. Each figure is supplied unassembled and unpainted. Painting miniatures is a delightful part of the hobby that can, and should, be enjoyed by people of all ages!
I put together this little video to help shine light on how it's done. It can be hard to know where to start. Here I'll show you how easy it is to make something look decent with very little effort! The first video covers assembly while part-two goes into painting.
I love this hobby, and It's my pleasure to help you get into it any way I can. In these videos I pretty much say everything I would say if we were hanging out. Give it a watch and play along at home if you like.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
In February of this year I ran a successful Kickstarter campaign to create Relicblade. It was a truly amazing experience. Thanks to the support of backers from around the world I was able to create an extremely rad finished product. Thanks to the expert guidance from my good friend Eben Burgoon, a Kickstarter veteran, and my furious efforts, I was able to ship the Kickstarter Rewards on-time.

I took special care to finish as much as possible before coming to Kickstarter last time since it was my first foray into producing miniatures. This time I am leaning somewhat on my experience to set out a reasonable production schedule to deliver on time. The figures are sculpted and production is under-way. The cards are ready to send to the printer, but without the Kickstarter funds I can't afford to hit "go".

Delays are always possible. 3D printers may break, governments may topple, and trains may derail, but I am confident that I can deliver this product in good order.

Thank you for your continued support!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Greetings Friends,
Today I am putting the finishing touches on the shiny new Relicblade campaign book. With the book set up in it's entirety I wanted to give you all a peek inside. When I first devised the campaign book I envisioned a 30 page booklet that offered some scenarios and the basic rules for linking games. What I ended up with is an amazing look at the world of relicblade.

Hello my wonderful friends,
It is my pleasure to take a moment to give you all a quick update. Things are really coming together. This is one of my most loved stages of a Kickstarter project. Each day I slam into a flurry of activity. My doorbell rings as gigantic boxes of metal miniatures, shiny new prints, and a myriad of other components arrive.

Relicblade Campaign Rules
Greetings friends,
It has been my great pleasure to work full time on writing the adventure campaign rules for Relicblade. There is a lot to cover in the campaign rules, and as always I am working hard to create a singularly entertaining miniatures game! The core design philosophy of Relicblade is simplicity. I strive to make a game that doesn't require complicated rules to play, but through easy to understand character cards and upgrades has a ton of tactical depth.

campaign.story:
HELLO AGAIN KICKSTARTER BACKERS!!! FANS AND NEW FACES!!
  It is with great pleasure that I return to Kickstarter once again to fund a new set of Fantasy Norse 28 mm heroic miniatures!
  In this campaign I intend to produce a  host of 20 new Njorn characters of various roles sure to tread ruin upon their foes in the Frosty Ruins and forlorn wildernesses of the Great Cold North. Berserker, Hird, and Huscarls, Rangers, and  Mages. And the Norns allowing, mayhaps even more. There are many allies at the call of the Northfolk if the need be.
   Backers can pledge for an entire warband ( 10 figures in total as of the launch of the campaign ) cast in high quality white metal, or pick and choose individual figures from the selection funded by this campaign. OR backers can pledge for the same warband cast in high fidelity resin or resin solos of individuals funded by the campaign or a mix of both!   The pledges are as follows:
   SOLO METAL ..................This pledge level rewards backers with 1 copy of any one of the figures successfully funded through this campaign cast in high quality white metal.  
  SOLO RESIN ..................This pledge level rewards backers with 1 copy of any one of the figures successfully funded through this campaign cast in high fidelity resin.  
   WAR BAND METAL ..............This pledge rewards backers with one full set of any 10 figures successfully funded over the course of this campaign cast in high quality white metal.  
   WAR BAND RESIN ..............This pledge rewards backers with one full set of any 10 figures successfully funded over the course of this campaign cast in high fidelity Resin.
   WAR PARTY METAL.......This pledge rewards backers with any  20 figures successfully funded over the course of this campaign cast in high quality white metal.
    WAR PARTY  RESIN.......This pledge rewards backers with any  20 figures successfully funded over the course of this campaign cast in high fidelity Resin.
 Here be the place where stand the long list of the hardy souls afoot in the snows of the cold north and the price they demand for their hands in battle. many of the items pictured here are still slightly WIP but these will all be finished before the end of the campaign.
All items listed in this Section are offered as selections for the " Warband " and " War Party " pledge rewards. each of which offering a VERY hefty discount off of the RRP of Red Box Games figures ( $9-$10 ) per figure. Please keep in mind that these prices expire at the close of this kickstarter and that post campaign pledge-ups or jump-ins will not be allowed. if you want in on this deal you have to be a part of the kickstarter.
    All of the characters listed here cost as follows;
   #1 $7.00 metal, $15 resin
  #2 $7.00 metal , $15 resin
    #3 $7.00 metal , $15 resin
  #4 $7.00 metal, $15 resin
  #5 $7.00 metal, $15 resin
  #6 $7.00 metal, $15 resin
  #7 $7.00 metal, $15 resin
    #8 $7.00 metal, $15 resin

  #10 $7.00 metal, $15 resin
    #11 $7.00 metal, $15 resin
  #12 $7.00 metal, $15 resin
  #13 $7.00 metal, $15 resin
  #14 $7.00 metal, $15 resin
  #15 $7.00 metal, $15 resin
    #16 $7.00 metal, $15 resin
    #17 $7.00 metal, $15 resin
  #18 $7.00 metal, $15 resin
  #19 $7.00 metal, $15 resin
  #20 $7.00 metal, $15 resin
                  .
 After the close of the kickstarter, full collection and transfer of the funds gained by the campaign, and the full production process of the items funded by the campaign, Upon readiness of the rewards for fulfillment you will be issued a link to an external website which will allow you to select the specific items and quantity there of you would like to apply your pledge to as a reward. At this point you will also be billed for your postage as needed. This way all of the information is nice and neat and easily manageable and you do not have to fuss with multiple payments strung out over the course of delivery.
    Here be the place where await the stranger folk a wander in the Cold North. Mayhaps they are friend. Mayhaps they are foe.
        I work with a great team of very talented and reliable contractors who handle all of the mold making and metal and resin casting of my products and I operate a live webstore where in you can view and purchase any one of my currently available products.
  http://red-box-games.com/

     IMPORTANT!!! DO NOT add funds to cover postage to your pledge. Postage will be billed upon readiness to deliver. Any funds collected via kickstarter MUST be applied to the rewards ONLY.
  This project is produced in the US so the postage within the US should not exceed $5 for most rewards packages. The reason I say most is just to caveat for the odd wonderfully insane backer who pledges for 20 sets of 20 figures. Obviously heavier packages that exceed the standard priority rate postage boxes would cost more to ship.
All packages shipped within the US will be shipped with all the necessary cushion and damage prevention measures we can provide to make sure that your goodies arrive safe and sound and in pristine condition. US backers will of course not need to worry about any import duties, customs fees, shipping company collapses, or bands of savage pirates preventing them from receiving their beloved Red Box Games minis.
  I also have confirmation that we Will be fulfilling with help from oir very goodmfriends at Hasslefree miniatures in the UK Many thanks Dameon!!
  AUSTRALIA: I do really love all you guys very much, and I am sorry yall always seem to get stuck at the end of fulfillment. To that end I am going to assure you that your rewards will be the first shipped when fulfillment begins. You have all been so patient and loyal and I do not want you guys to feel taken for granted at all. I cannot however absorb the customs fees and import duties or the postage costs fro shipping to Australia.
  CANADA: again as above. I am eternally grateful for yall's continued support and patience and I assure you all that your rewards will be shipped along side of the Australian backer's rewards. The postage costs to Canada can fluctuate rather dramatically and there could be customs fees incurred.
  I try to keep my postage costs as close to actual cost of the postage and materials as possible, subsidizing the costs of our time to sort and package as part of the cost of making this as affordable as possible for you all.

     For those who are unfamiliar with me as a sculptor and with my business red box games I am a sculptor of finely detailed 28mm scale fantasy miniatures. Most often specializing in minis of a Norse theme. I founded my business in 2008 and have been producing miniatures ever since. In that time I have produced some 300 odd figures for my various ranges of Men, Elves, Dwarves, Goblins, Halflings, Orcs, Demons and Undead of all kind of role for each of those range themes. I have now run 9 kickstarters and have fully delivered on 7 ( 2 campaigns were canceled prior to reaching the funding goal ). I always strive to produce figures of the highest possible quality and have gone to great lengths and even significant personal difficulty to see to it that I deliver fully on all of my promises.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I have a great deal of experience in the running and delivery of kickstarters and 7 years experience in the industry dealing with all the various aspects of producing and marketing miniatures. These aspects include design, sculpting, coordinating production, quality control, packaging and shipment. I maintain a very close relationship with my customers and backers well after the sale is made.
I have experienced difficulties in previous kickstarters but have run several successful campaign which delivered on time and to expectation, but even in the kickstarters which delivered late I have always delivered in full as promised.

I very keenly understand the hurtles which may present themselves during the fulfillment of kickstarters and I am ready to deal with any of them. You can rest fully assured that I will deliver your rewards to you if you back my campaign. You are who make it possible for me to do what i love to do and I do NOT take that for granted.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
