updates.update_content:
Hi Everyone,
Thank you
I just wanted to touch base and thank each of you one last time for believing in this project and buying a book. Watching this book get made, printed, and shipped out has been one of the most stressful, but overall rewarding projects of my career. I'm really proud of SkyHeart and happy to have finished it.

Books are Here!
The books arrived safe and sound from my printer in China. So relieved!

Exciting news! The books are on a boat headed to Provo and get here September 14th.
The printer overnighted a couple of books so I could see what they look like. They turned out so good. Better than I had expected! 
Here's some photos:

I got the proofs back from the printer and the book is looking great!
I'll admit that when I delivered the files to the printer I was SO DONE. I didn't want to think about SkyHeart. But now, seeing these pages, leafing through them with my fingers, it's making me want to drop everything and start book 2!
I'm wrapping up the loose ends with SkyHeart before I send it off to the printers. This week I finished the cover!

You guys, YOU GUYS! Interior pages of SkyHeart are FINISHED!
This includes all the coloring, lettering, copy editing, formatting, back matter, title pages, chapter breaks, copyright page, and end pages. The book is built out in InDesign and ready to export. 
The last thing on my list is designing and polishing the front and back cover.

Before the month closes out I wanted to share with you some colored pages. As of right now I have 94 pages colored, 32 left to do.
Here's some of my favorites so far:
Inks are finished!

Just wanted to wrap up the year with another SkyHeart update.
Ater squeezing in as much drawing as I could in between everything this month I was able to get half of the pages done in this 5th and final chapter of SkyHeart.
You can see some of these pages here. Because of all the detail they took FOREVER.

Hello Everyone!
Touching base here at the end of November to let you know where things are at.
Finished with layouts on Chapter 5. You can see those here below. (Don't look too close if you want to avoid any spoilers.) Chapter 5 ended up being 6 pages longer than all the other chapters. Just couldn't fit everything I wanted to write into 24 pages.

campaign.story:
We hit the goal!  Shiver Bureau will be printed.  But lets see what other fun stuff we can add in the remaining time.
I will add all the original stories I created when I was first conceiving Shiver Bureau.  Fully illustrated covers and sequential pages.  I think this will be at least 20 extras pages of content.  This will be awesome to have in the book just for the sure zaniness of the stories, but it will show the Shiver Bureau in its infancy.  The story, the characters and even me grew a lot in the 8 years it too to get to this point.  I think these pages will really showcase that growth.
Prints of cool interior pages, panels and the cover will be sent out with all physical shipments.
All books will be printed in glorious hardcover!
The hardcover will be upgraded to include some tasteful embossing.  My plan is to emboss the logo, Trish, and Pickle.  Also I will start compiling a massive concept art book for Shiver Bureau volume 2.  All backers who gave $10+ will get a digital PDF copy of this book when complete.
Upgrade Level twooooooo! The book will get a spot UV treatment.  I think that is something like a spa day for graphic novels.  I want to add a shiny, 'invisible' ghost to the back cover.   A spooky friend you only spot out of the corner of eye when the hair raises on the back of your neck.
Shiver Bureau: Welcome to London is a 150 page graphic novel.  That's 150 pages of full on story.  There will be some bonus content in the back as well. It will be a paperback unless we raise enough to afford a hardcover.
Best part is, this first volume is completely finished.  I'm not waiting for the artist to art, or the colorist to color, or the letterer to letter, or even the snozzleblurrer to snozzleblur.  I just need cash money to get it printed.
Suitable for all ages with parental guidance.  There is some cartoon violence and monsters lurking about.  But nothing worse then a Saturday morning cartoon.
This is the first volume of a trilogy (possibly a quadrology) but this volume is self contained and serves as an introduction to the world, characters, and the awesome.
It's also a webcomic that you can read for free at http://shiverbureau.com/
The world is overrun with ghosts and it's up to the Shiver Bureau to keep things under control. But everything isn't as it seems, the bureau is corrupt and there are things lurking in the shadows that are far worse then the shivers.
That's where Pickle, Trish, Mr. Todd and Oliver come in.  The is Pickle's first day in London and already he's been attacked by shivers, fallen out of a blimp and been shown up by his assistant*.  How much worse could his day get?  A lot worse...Welcome to London.
Pickle is taking over the London headquarters.  Not only does he have to deal with shivers, but he needs to clean up the bureau, deal with a power hungry minister, get back his assistant*, and there are rumors about missing kids.  I think Pickle needs a vacation (wink wink volume 2 wink nod wink wink wink wink...sorry got something in my eye).
There are a wide assortment of characters, but the main dogooders are...
Pickle is an Inspectre, a rare type of person with the ability to lay shivers to rest.  He is overly confident, but has the skills and the mouth to back it up...most of the time.  Pickle thinks he's the hero of the story...
Luckily, Trish is there to remind him that he's not.  Trish is the power house of the group.  She's not just a brute though, she has more than enough smarts to keep Pickle and his mouth in check. *Not Pickle's assistant.
Mr. Todd fixes everything that Trish and Pickle break.  He also makes some really cool toys.  Don't let his size fool you, he's no good in a fight...he's a pacifist and very huggable.
Oliver is the next generation.  He embodies the best of Pickle, Trish, and Mr. Todd. Maybe some of their faults as well.  When he's older, he will be someone to reckon with...if he can live that long.
Well I'm me, silly...
More info?  Okay, my name is Walter Ostlie and I am a part-time storyteller who dreams of retiring early to create new worlds and new possibilities, to boldly go where no cartoonist has gone before...or go where they went but put my own twist on it.
Shiver Bureau is my second graphic novel.  My first is Cubicles: The Movie: The Graphic Novel...or just call it Cubicles.  It's a sci-fi comedy about two office workers who get dragged across the universe.  It's pretty funny, you should read it.  It's available on Comixology.  You can read the first chapter for free and the entire novel is only 4 bucks.  That's like 80 pages of hah hah hilarious uproar for 4 bucks. What?  What!
https://www.comixology.com/Cubicles/comics-series/6589
$10 - Not only do you get a digital copy of the story, but also some overloaded bonus content.  You will get the B/W, unlettered version of every page plus all the bonus content I can wrangle up.
$25 - Get the fresh off the presses print edition of Shiver Bureau plus the oversized PDF and a Shiver Bureau bookmark.
$35 - Get a snazzy original ink sketch on the inside of your new print copy of Shiver Bureau plus you get all the cool stuff from the previous tier.
$60 - Get this fashionable Shiver Bureau t-shirt.  Not only is it styling and profiling, but it's functional.  No shirt, no service.  Any pledge 60+ will have their name printed in the 'Thank You' section of the book.

You pick any character you want and I'll draw them looking their coolest.  Keep it to a single character.  Background are at my discretion.  You also get the signed print copy and overloaded PDF.
$90 - This is like the $35 tier but even cooler. Instead of sketching in the Shiver Bureau book, I will sketch on a separate 6" x 8" card stock. You pick any character you want and I'll draw them looking their coolest. Keep it to a single character. Background are at my discretion. You also get the spooky shirt, signed print copy and overloaded PDF.

$400 - Do you want something drawn, need someone to draw it, why not commission me?  Get an original 11x17 ink wash commission by me...the tortured artist mentioned above.  Instead of the commission you could choose one of my already completed original illustrations.  Plus all the other goodies.  See all the available original art pieces at the bottom of this update here.
$600 - The one, the only original art for the cover of Shiver Bureau volume 1.  This is the thing you want.  Plus all the other goodies, obviously.

updates.update_content: Just wanted to let you know about a new project I am working on.  It's the second volume of Is'nana The Were-Spider.  It is on Kickstarter now and already reached it's main goal of 12,000 dollars.  Now it's headed towards the stretch goal of 16,000 and that's when I show up.  If the project can hit the goal, than I will be drawing and coloring a 40 page backup story for the book.  That means the book you get will have an extra 40 pages and you won't have to pay more.  40 free pages, what?!?!

Great news.  The books are printed and they look amazing!
Picking a printer and working through all the printing issues was way more work then I thought it would be.  There is a lot of stress involved when you have to make 2000 copies of one thing.
However, now that I see them, all of them, and see how dope they look, it makes it all worth it.  I can't wait to get these books in my hands.  I may have to lay them flat and lay my mattress on top of them because there are so many but it will be totally worth it.

Here is the "Thank You" page.  I copied and pasted directly from Kickstarter so all names should be correct, but if you see something wrong just let me know.  Originally it was only supposed to be for $60+ backers, but I included everyone since we all did this together.  It seemed right.  However, to be fair to the $60+ backers, their names are larger.
Thank you!

campaign.story:
STAGE OF DEVELOPMENT is a documentary series featuring human stories about real people whose lives have been changed by video games. Some of them make games. Some of them play games. All of them are helping make the video game community one of the most vibrant and exciting collections of humans on Earth.
I made this video with Christian Cicerone over four days of shooting and five days of editing. Imagine what we could do with your backing and support!
I can't wait to show you what these people are really like, what drives them and how they do what they do.
We've begun production on the following two episodes:
Episode 01: FOX, BIRD, BEAR. Spry Fox just released the clever word game "Alphabear". Before that, its "Triple Town" made waves (and attracted controversy). With less than a dozen developers working form all over the world, this mid-sized indie studio is trying to turn modest successes into long term survival. Their next game, "Steambirds" could be the breakout they need. 
Episode 02: FAMILY BUSINESS. John Romero created "Doom". Brenda Romero has worked for decades as a game developer. Now they're working with young Donovan on "Gunman Taco Truck" and helping others learn the joy of game making. This is the story of the Romero's "Family Business".
Additional episodes will include the stories of:
  And if we're funded to our second stretch goal (way less than twice our original goal), we'll be able to make six more episodes — and you can help decide whose stories we tell next!
STAGE OF DEVELOPMENT is the next major webseries from my company, Flying Saucer Media. I've worked for 25 years in media production. I was the head writer and producer of TechTV's "The Screen Savers"; editor-in-chief of the six-time Webby Award winning escapistmagazine.com; co-founder of Polygon.com; and creator Polygon's "Human Angle" webseries, short documentaries about people in video games.
STAGE OF DEVELOPMENT is picking up where Human Angle left off, with an entirely new 6-episode series chronicling the real human stories of video games. And to ensure that no one can pull the plug, call the shots or change the course, I'm asking for your help to fund this series.
Production of STAGE OF DEVELOPMENT has already begun. I've spent my own money shooting the first two episodes of this series. And pre-production has begun on several additional episodes. 
STAGE OF DEVELOPMENT will be six episodes. We're asking for your help to raise $192,105. That's a very precise figure, and one we're confident in. We're experienced video professionals with over 25 years experience making high-quality video. We know how much it costs, how hidden costs can stack up, and how to avoid surprises up-front. We've provided a detailed breakdown of why we're asking for what we're asking below. I think after reading and hearing more about what we're trying to accomplish you'll agree we're aiming for a reasonable goal.
Each 7-10 minute episode of STAGE OF DEVELOPMENT tells a new story about an interesting, exceptional or revolutionary personality in the video game community. What is it like to be an indie developer working with a dozen other people around the world? What kind of child grows up raised by some of the most famous game developers in the world? How do you make a game better than your first game, when your first game was one of the best reviewed games out there? And what kind of person has millions of fans just for making videos on YouTube? STAGE OF DEVELOPMENT will answer all of these questions and more.
The first episode will publish the same day this Kickstarter closes, whether or not the series is funded. New episodes will then follow every month.
At Flying Saucer Media, we run very small crews. For STAGE OF DEVELOPMENT, we'll be working with freelance contributors for almost every shoot, but the core team will be:
Producing six, separate short documentary films covering subjects all over the world is no easy task. I know. I've done it before. I know exactly how much that will cost, how long it will take and (most importantly) how to do it right.
I'm asking for a lot of money. I'm asking for a lot of trust. I hope you agree that telling these amazing stories is worth a little of both.
Crew fees and travel are the biggest expenses. The second biggest expense is backer rewards, that's the stuff we're making and shipping to you for backing this project. I'm borrowing Robert Khoo's excellent analysis of how much that sort of thing costs. I also borrowed Robert's math on how much Kickstarter and credit card companies will charge me for the privilege of taking your money. It's a lot! 
Stage of Development is going to cost us $138,650 to produce (rounded to the nearest dollar). That includes crew fees, travel, contingency (in case something breaks) and fees for music composition and licensing.
Adding in the cost to produce the awesome backer rewards ($38,406.05) and the amount Kickstarter will charge to raise the remaining sum ($15,049.76) we get to $192,105.
Or put another way:
The portion of this chart that looks like Pac-Man is how much we need in order to produce Stage of Development.
The rest is how much we need to spend in order to raise the amount we need to produce Stage of Development.
The first episode of Stage of Development will be available to backers as a digital download the same day this Kickstarter closes. No excuses.
Episode 1: September 16 (The day this Kickstarter closes)
Episodes 2-6: One per month, every month. 
That's not bluster. The episode been shot and is currently in the final stages of post-production.
We are planning to publish additional episodes every 3-4 weeks. Right now we have all of the six episodes booked and scheduled for production and post-production.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The only serious risk is that someone's schedule might change, forcing us to adjust our production schedule, possibly costing us more or affecting the amount of time it will take to finish an episode.

This is the sort of thing where experience leads to a much lower risk. I've done this before. I've run into these issues. And I know how to work around them and plan a schedule and a budget keeping in mind that things may change.

Realistically, there's a 100% chance that something will happen differently than we've planned it. But there's a statistically zero chance that a disruption will be so severe that it will impact our schedule or budget so severely that we can't adjust. 

I don't want to say "never" but I've been managing schedules and budgets for decades. Both "Press Reset" and "Human Angle" came in on time and under budget. As has every production I've ever been a part of. If STAGE OF DEVELOPMENT were to run over budget or take longer than I expected, it would be the first.

campaign.story:
Several years ago I made it a goal to always carry a sketchbook. This lead to the creation of Sketch Wallet - a leather wallet that holds a sketchbook. It comes in black or chocolate brown leather with a matching sketchbook.
 If there is a combination of things you'd like, but don't see in the rewards, just do the math and give me a note explaining what you want. For example, if you'd like one sketchbook and a t-shirt, just select the t-shirt and then add $4 to your pledge for the sketchbook. 
 I've been using a prototype Sketch Wallet for two years and absolutely love it. I can't imagine not having one. It doesn't matter where I am, the doctor's office, a restaurant, or wherever. If I have a few moments I'll doodle a few sketches instead of surfing the net on my phone. I've come to cherish all these quirky little drawings and many of these raw ideas I've developed further into games I create for work and other projects. This has brought the joy of drawing back, and has helped me improve my skills.
The Sketch Wallet is very flat and is designed to maximize the area of a standard men's back pocket without feeling bulky or heavy.
Attention writers and note takers - now you have the option of lined paper! After the campaign you will receive an email survey and can pick blank sketch books or lined paper books.
We respect craftsmen everywhere, but I wanted to use local factories to ensure the best quality and ethics possible. Our wallets and sketchbooks are made in the USA.
 STRETCH GOALS!
UNLOCKED! If we hit $35,000 every reward level, small or large, gets a small metal page clip. 
UNLOCKED! If we hit $40,000 every wallet will come with a custom short *pencil perfectly sized to fit the pencil pocket. *Pencil design may change (still figuring out what type of pencil)
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I've tried to anticipate potential challenges with this project and have made every effort to overcome them. The factory and printers are already in place. The wallet dies and hot stamps have already been made. Not only have a few prototypes been made but I manufactured a small batch just to work out all the kinks in manufacturing before the Kickstarter campaign began. It's extremely expensive to manufacture a small batch, but I felt it was crucial to ironing out any kinks in the pipeline beforehand. While I don't have any leather product experience, I have, over the years, designed, manufactured, and shipped hundreds of products made of metal, plastic, and rubber. While I'm sure I can't foresee every potential problem, I will be very open about any challenges that may arise, and will communicate often with my backers.

campaign.story:
Play as Marcus Ector, the "Shield of the King," as you navigate your way through countless challenges to leave behind a legacy of honor and duty for your two sons in this epic, RPG strategy game!
If the title paragraph isn't enough for you, you can think this game as the "Love child of Chrono Trigger and Game of Thrones, raised by a pack of wild rogue-likes!" 
When we started developing 'The Pauldron' it was always our goal to build a world, and a platform in which we could deliver some core experiences for our players. The Shield of the King is the first episode in this series which promises:
- An engaging episodic story of a father's love for his two sons set in a grounded fantasy universe where the player can jump between timelines to relive key moments for several different characters!
- Strategic turn based combat that hearkens back to classic snes rpg games like Chrono Trigger, Fire Emblem and Ogre Battles, boasting special class based abilities, team positioning and a special action point system!
- Rogue-like crawl and loot missions that will keep you on your toes, and entertained, raising the stakes for your favorite characters that can permanently die in randomly generated encounters!
We are here on Kickstarter asking the public to help us create this world and bring it to you in all it's pixelated glory in the summer of 2016.
The player will discover many characters of all shapes and sizes, many with their own interesting story arcs that tangle together in a web of deceit, mis-placed loyalties and lies.
We have been hard at work developing a scaleable story platform by creating storyboards for the first chapter, concepting locations, characters and creatures, and most importantly, creating a pre-alpha demo of the battle system. You can check out this (very) early demo of how the battles will feel in the game, but be warned...... it's far from complete!
pre-alpha build of the battle system showing off the speed, movement, basic attacks and action points features
We wanted the battle system to be cerebral and strategic, and hearken back to the good old days of snes rpg games like Tactics Ogre, Chrono Trigger and Fire Emblem. Players will customize their parties effectiveness by choosing classes, skills and equipment that will combo well together to prepare for any challenge.
skills are location based and can turn the tide of a tough fight
The pauldron (a simple piece of armor that covers your shoulder) in our world is a symbol of one's family legacy, a symbol of one's allegiance. Marcus, a loving, dutiful, father, prepares for the day when he will pass his own pauldron down to his firstborn son Griff, who would rather hunt deer in solitude than take his father's oath as the 'Shield of the King'. Marcus learns that it may be hard to convince his son what is worthy of a lifetime of devotion, if he himself questions who and what is worth dying for.
We have put a lot of care into character development. We want players to be invested in these characters so that the stakes are raised when their lives are in peril.
 Marcus is the 'Shield of the King'; the man responsible for the immediate safety of king and realm. Marcus earned his pauldron and sigil in a desperate battle where he risked his life to save his future king.
Marcus is stern and wary, good traits for the king's bodyguard.
 William is the best mounted knight in eastern kingdoms. He has never been unhorsed, never lost a joust, and is unmatched in single combat. Despite his large ego, William looks to his older brother, Marcus, for stability and leadership.
William serves as the king's champion. Cavalier and charming, he often frustrates his stern brother Marcus
We are planning to tell the story with special 'story missions' that will feature unique cut-scenes and dialogue options. These special missions will be earned through the rogue-like loot and crawl missions that you will take the characters on.
 Legacy and the coming of age are important themes in the story, Marcus has to manage his knightly  responsibilities, while keeping track of his two very different children. Griff is solemn and quite, and not too excited about taking up his father's pauldron, while Kay is young and rowdy, and likely to get himself killed before his adolescence.  The story begins with the two boys discovering the shell of a wyrm's egg on a simple fishing trip. This indicates that a dragon has breached the protective walls surrounding their realm. Marcus must investigate as they annual tournament celebrations are just days away. The player can jump between three timelines where you can experience the same characters as they change throughout their life.
 In the Pauldron, players will be able to jump to different timelines to discover how time and events have shaped their favorite characters. Think of it like flashing forward and backward in time as an omniscient narrator.
Experience the story in 3 separate timelines.
THE PAST (the war of the sentinels) - Kingdoms that were once in conflict are now joining together to fight against their powerful former rulers... the dragon riding sentinels! Marcus will earn his reputation fighting along-side the future king.
PRESENT DAY (the peaceful kingdom) - The citizens of Camlann are preparing for it's annual tournament celebrating the king's wedding anniversary. A looming threat emerges when Marcus discovers a breach in their protective walls, and a shady conspiracy.
THE FUTURE (the fall of the mighty) - The kingdom is left in ruins. Marcus now urges his son to take up his family Pauldron and leave without him so he can confront the authors of this destruction and end it at all cost.
We have been just as concerned with building a world as we are building this game. The locations needs to feel tangible and real. Here are some fantastic concepts of some of the locations you will visit in 'The Pauldron'.
Agned is a massive scorched landscape with structures not built by man
Farwood is quiet, secluded and teaming with strange life forms
Penthus is an open fertile land, ruled by the greatest horsemen beyond the mist
There is much more concept art, production art and animations that will show up in the pdf art book. We are super excited to share each art asset with this special kickstarter reward.
 We are committed to finishing this game regardless of the funding level. We just want to finish it within a year, and with good quality art, animation, audio and marketing. Take a look at the below stretch goals to get an idea of how we will spend the funds raised.
$ 10,000  Art Boost - Better character portraits and animations!
$ 20,000   Music and Sound Boost - Custom made audio! 
$ 30,000 - Content Boost - Additional story mission and character (to be revealed in an update)
$ 40,000 - Platform Boost - IOS and Android releases post launch
$ + 40,000 - Funds will go toward the success of the series
If we get close to completing these tiers, we have some plans for additional stretch goals.
We are targeting PC first, (Windows, and Steam - let us know if you are interested in other platforms!)  but if success allows, we would like to bring it to as many platforms as possible. We are designing with mobile touch screens in mind and It's already feeling great on Android!
Kickstarter contributors have special access to items that will not be sold elsewhere. Take a look at the rewards for backing at different levels! Some of these tiers are limited and won't last long! You can change your tier during the campaign, but make sure to pledge at the level you wont regret! (Physical copies of PDF materials may be offered at a later date for the price of production)
You will receive a key to download on Windows, Steam, Mac or Linux. Let us know your preferred platform! We will try our best to be flexible to the needs of fans. (if the mobile stretch Goals are achieved, you may choose IOS or Android, but these may release at a later date)
The world is larger than it seems. Keep track of locations and creatures using this world map. You may find something interesting that will help you understand the lore of the game.
Learn more about characters, gameplay and items with this old school instruction manual. Let us know what you want to see in here. Bestiary? Character profiles? Cheat Codes?  (probably not this)
We already have a great collection of environmental art, concept art, and storyboards that we would love to share, and we are just getting started. Like the art you see so far? There is plenty more to gawk at!
Many Characters you will find in the game are randomly generated with random attributes like family sigil, color scheme etc.... Get your family immortalized into the game! (must adhere to a few rules)
Design a weapon, armor or item to use in the game! We need lots of these in the game! Why not help us out with designing your own equipment! (must adhere to a few rules)
There are many dangerous creatures in this world. Help us design the look and AI of one of these enemies you will encounter! (must adhere to a few rules)
There are three types of characters in the game: Story Characters (cannot be completely killed in a rogue mission due to their involvement in the story), Tertiary Characters (can be killed, but have generic portraits etc..), and Generic Characters (in case you kill off all your other characters, you will still have bodies to use) Help us design a Tertiary Character. (and if we like him/her then maybe a story character...  ...also must adhere to a few rules) 
We have been very fortunate in our friends. These guys have already helped out a bunch on our project and we hope to continue working with some of them. 
DEVELOPMENT - HeartBeast - https://www.youtube.com/user/uheartbeast/videos
CHARACTER/STORY ART - Kienan Lafferty - http://knockwurst.deviantart.com/gallery/
CONCEPT ART - Neal Hanson, Tom Scholes, Richard Anderson, Kathryn Thacker
The below names are possible freelance contributors depending on our funding level. Take a look at their inspiring work!
ANIMATION - Z-studios (Aaron Tsai) - http://z-studios.deviantart.com/gallery/
ENVIRONMENT - Drawsgood - http://www.drawsgood.com

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Creative works and projects such as this one are not without a myriad of challenges and risks. Producing a game of this scale is something we have never done before, and working with a cross-discipline team across the US and the ever daunting pressures of time and good health are all concerning.

With that said, I believe we are well on our way and have tackled some of the most difficult challenges already. Funding or not, I am committed to finishing this project.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: How do I get a refund?
updates.update_content: As we stated before, for those who would simply like a full refund, we will begin processing these in March. Keep in mind, that requesting a full refund means you will be listed as 'dropped' and will not receive any more updates on the project. We are cancelling this project, but those who choose not to request a refund will be alerted when the new project materializes and will be entitled to a free game code when it does. Here are the rules for issuing a refund according to Kickstarter:

We planned to have our game in front of publishers at the game developers conference in California last March. We bought tickets for several team members, printed t-shirts, set up some meetings and most importantly, we developed a pitch deck and build for our game.

The plan was to end the Kickstarter with enough funding money in hand to directly refund everyone and allow us to continue development into 2021 at full capacity. We actually had multiple team members contributing art, code and story and our costs (just to get the demo) were a bit high for our  budget (out of pocket for LLC members at close to 10k a month).  As I said in comments earlier, the total cost of development to date is orders of magnitude greater that we had raised on this platform. I had always known it would be greater cost, but never knew exactly how much. Before taking a job at a game company I had planned to do most of the art and animation myself and while you CAN make a game yourself this way, our scope was always quite large and needed to contract much of the work out.

updates.update_content:
Hey everyone. It's hard to come to such a supportive group of folks with bad news, or no news at all, but here I am. I wish I could say we have a big update coming with lots of features and progress to show, but unfortunately we are still in the same boat as before. Our weekly team meetings have been focused on exit strategy, discussing options to pivot and/or cutting features to just release .....something.
The unfortunate truth is that without additional funds, and new team members, the project can't continue. Our developers already devoted more time than anyone should expect from our original agreements, and understandably, cannot complete the project in solitude, without clear direction, and without pay. No one is to blame but myself, who naively thought that I could do everything myself if it came down to it, and that work or life wouldn't stop me.

We are Justin Lucas and Mitchell Lucas, satirical writers behind the Science Fiction parody series The Rockman Chronicles and the parody twitter account @AwfulFantasy—where we post fake excerpts from non-existent Fantasy and Scifi books, with a satirical spin.
We’ve had a lot of fun creating some really awful tweets in our first year on Twitter, and we’ve always been kinda bummed that some of these stories had to end at 140 characters. So we have decided to expand some of our favorite tweets into a collection of short stories! We also like variety, so we'll throw in some honorable mention tweets and some activities and puzzles and stuff.
The first part of the book is a collection of short stories based on a few of our more popular tweets. Each story begins with a beautifully illustrated drawing by the extremely talented Jesse Lucas and ranges from 10-20 pages. They are all chock-full of ridiculously awful prose, bad analogies, horrible opinions, uneducated explanations, and dumb jokes. Following each short story, there will be ridiculous activities based on the preceding tale like word searches, mazes, mad libs, horrible cooking recipes, and more!
Here are some of the short stories:
Cthulu's a Dick
Based on: "Al gazed upon Cthulhu and was consumed with madness. Not the crazy kind, the angry kind. Cthulhu totally pissed him off. Cthulhu's a dick."
Methane in the Membrane
Based on: "Lia stepped off her ship onto the planet. 'That smells gross, Ben.' Ben was confused until they both died. The atmosphere was methane."
Hard-boiled Hobbit
Based on:“Of all the hobbit-holes in The Shire, this dame had to walk into mine. Tall as she was beautiful. 2'3" and feet as hairy as my last case."
The Confusing, But Not Impossible Labyrinth
Based on:"'I smash you to nothing!' said the ogre. 'That's physically impossible,' said Dean. The others agreed, and the ogre admitted he was wrong."
And more!
And in each physical copy of Harris Dies on Page 32 and Other Tales of Awful Fantasy there will be a very special roleplaying adventure for the 5th edition of a popular RPG with a name I can't remember: The Daemon Queen’s Saecret Tower!
The best answer is illustrations. It's a scientific fact that 100% of all things can be made 403 times better with some great art, and we believe that our book could benefit from that math.

We have the gift for deep storytelling, and complex, sophisticated writing, but we don’t draw no good. So, it is our responsibility to see that someone else who is good at art does that stuff and gets paid while we stick to what we're good at: writing badly.

We've recruited the incredible talents of Jesse Lucas to do our illustrations, and it's not just because he shares the same last name as us. We believe his beautiful and clean art style would compliment our project perfectly and are excited to see what more he can do once this book gets funded.

Check out one of the images right now:
"The Dwarves sat down for a game of Offices & Executives. Thimlo, playing as Ted the Lawyer, rolled a 9 to dial out with his +1 desk phone."

In addition to having a Kickstarter for the art, we also need help getting the full-color, physical book printed. We think that having a physical book to hold, open, and touch would be pretty great, and we know that everyone loves to hold, open, and touch things. This book allows you to do all three at once. I can only think of 5 other things in the ENTIRE WORLD with this kind of capability.

A pdf of The Dæmon Queen's Sæcret Tower! An @AwfulFantasy Roleplaying Adventure!
The Dæmon Queen's Sæcret Tower is a very special roleplaying adventure specifically designed to be compatible with the 5th edition of a very popular RPG that I can't seem to remember the name of. It's that one game where you sit around with your friends and you act like you are different people in a fantasy world and you roll dice. There's a person at the table who leads the adventure. Man, why can't I remember what it's called? Oh well, I think you know the game I mean.

In The Dæmon Queen's Sæcret Tower, you and some friends will partake in the most ridiculous adventure ever created. Here's the story:

Once a regal and respected Queen of the Land of Orboz, Queen Fœtida instilled the opposite of fear into the hearts or her loyal subjects. Faced with the knowledge that she comes from a royal line rife with incest and illegal underground dragon fighting, Fœtida was dethroned by the Lord of a lesser house who uncovered her family’s darker past. Queen Fœtida, residing in an old, long abandoned sæcret tower in the Dargon Mountains, is now a servant of Necrosa, and has turned from her love of Contemporary Impressionism to the somewhat Darker Arts—NECROMANCY!
The Undead are invading the peaceful townships and cities of Orboz, consuming the flesh of the living, and ever spreading their vile dark magic and unpopular religious beliefs. Queen Fœtida has been spotted as a shade near the Dargon Mountains, and tale is told she still lives, most likely raising the dead as her own Personal Undead Army of Revenge!
It is up to a small band of heroes (you) to find Queen Fœtida and put an end to her Necromaniacal ways. In the Dargon Mountains lies the decrepit heart of the dark magic that plagues Orboz like a plague. In this metaphorical heart is where you must end the Dark Queen’s evil, vengeful plans (by killing her). Deep up inside The Dæmon Queen’s Sæcret Tower!

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The biggest risk with projects similar to ours is oversight in printing and shipping costs for physical book rewards to backers. Some project creators have found themselves owing way more in shipping and printing costs than they thought, leaving them unable to send backers their due rewards. 

We have mapped out all possible costs and planned for the “worst case scenario,” in which we are funded solely by the backer tier with the lowest overhead. We have made sure that each tier in itself is profitable so each donation has some left over that can ultimately go to art, with no fear of neglecting to fulfill backer rewards.

campaign.story:
Seventh Crown is a unique setting for use with the most popular fantasy tabletop roleplaying systems on the market. It takes a world you think you’ve read about before and turns it into something new and totally different.
This is the finest time to be a tabletop roleplayer since the dawn of the industry. With so many great choices on the market, your imagination has nearly infinite paths for which to choose and expand upon. With the recent release of the newest version of Dungeons & Dragons, players are chomping at the bit to exercise their imaginations and spread their ideas wide. With the Seventh Crown roleplaying game setting and future sourcebook line, you can do just that. Seventh Crown is a narrative setting and sourcebook that can be used with the rules found within many popular roleplaying game systems.
Cover of Seventh Crown Setting Book
Welcome to Seventh Crown
Based initially within the heavily populated continent of Kanis, Seventh Crown is a setting that places the players in the middle of an epic time of change in a world controlled by a select few. What was once a powerful dwarven empire now stands as broken racial kingdoms not defined by borders or territories, but by the ironclad magical control bestowed upon them by the crowns upon their brow.
In Seventh Crown, six golden artifacts of unfathomable power – the Crowns of Leadership – give almost ultimate and untested influence over those of the same race. While wearing the Crown, they cannot help but be king or queen of their people. This has led to a world of kingdoms that are not defined on maps or in war rooms, but instead by the blood that runs in a people’s veins. Authority enforced by magic across countless miles creates alliances, enemies and conflicts unlike those found anywhere else. When the reason for going to war is as simple as the will of who wears the Crown and the battlefield could be as complex as anywhere its people tread, life is a complex thing.
These six Crowns are the most powerful and important pieces of antiquity found anywhere in this world, and are watched and sought after by most of the people in Kanis. The dealings of the Crowns and the choices made by those who wear them are the talk of every town and city, and entire lifetimes have been spent trying to place a Crown on someone’s head – or remove the head currently wearing one. Territorial governments, the constabulary, organized crime and other local powerhouses rule their corners of civilization for the most part, but everyone feels the pull of the Crown bearers’ schemes and machinations.
It is the rumored existence of a seventh Crown of Leadership, the namesake of the game setting itself, which drives some people to scour the world for the mythic artifact. There have been six ruling forces on Kanis for thousands of years, many of which changing hands (heads?) over and over again, but the fact that there have always been six has been a constant for as long as the Crowns have existed. The discovery and donning of a seventh Crown of Leadership would change the world in an instant… or the discovery that it has already been found, and by what.
The continent of Kanis is large and varied in respect to the peoples that inhabit it, the history they have survived, and all of the interactions in between. Depending on the where someone is from, which King or Queen they serve willingly or otherwise, and how they plan to fill their purses or bellies day to day – that is where adventure will spring from in Seventh Crown.
The Surface of Kanis
What is Different?
Anyone can read through the newest game system and see what each creature, species or deity means to a “normal” campaign setting. Seventh Crown takes a lot of these standard ideas found in several rulebooks and turns them into brand new ideas that come together to create a new and unique world where players can portray characters like they never have before. There are plotlines and narrative hooks found within Seventh Crown that will put players in unique new roles as well as give them interactions with the world not commonly possible in other settings.
Just to give a number of good examples, the following are all samples of what makes Seventh Crown unique, interesting and a great deal of fun in which to roleplay.
The current King of the Elves is a sadistic dark elf warlock with the long term plan of breeding out the surface elves by forcing hospitality between the Surface World and the Great Beneath. Over the centuries dark elves have become a much more accepted sight on the surface, and travel to the depths of the Great Beneath is more commonplace despite its inherent dangers.
The halfling people suffered massive losses during a horrible war that forced their people into nomadic, extended families that travel Kanis in search of joy, profit and adventure. Their stories and culinary crafts are welcomed almost universally in Kanisi civilization.
Icon of Vimbre Po; Laughing God of Halfling Nomads
The dragonborn of Kanis are primarily mercenaries and seafarers, with those of chromatic heritage leaning toward life as sell swords or pirates; metallic dragonborn finding more favor as professional soldiers and trading corsairs. The two sects of dragonborn are constantly at odds, and many conflicts have begun based solely on “scale color.”
One corner of the continent is currently dealing with a large scale guerilla war between the goblinoids and the kobolds, putting some local civilizations in strange circumstances for unlikely social situations and alliances.
There is a militant sect within the dwarves that harken to the days when their bloodlines ruled the entire continent as a royal Dynasty. These dwarves are old-minded, somewhat racist toward certain peoples, and belligerently aimed at returning the dwarves to former glory.
The gnomes of Kanis are willingly subservient to dwarves and have been for thousands of years. Their acceptance of a lower station in life is a key element to a larger meta-mathematical equation that their ancient scholars believe will finalize with the gnomish people ruling the entire world. Effectively, the gnomes believe they have discovered the formula for complete domination of Kanis; it only requires a few more centuries of servitude to come to fruition.
And much, much more!
Symbol of Foeslen, God of Thieves and Muggers
What will be in the Seventh Crown core book?
The Seventh Crown core book, the goal of this Kickstarter, when published will be a hardcover tome of roughly 150 pages written, designed, illustrated and laid out by industry professionals to create a complete sourcebook for the continent of Kanis and the Seventh Crown roleplaying game setting. While it will contain some rules information specific to the Seventh Crown setting, it will NOT include a core system of rules. Instead it relies upon the player(s) to use it alongside obviously compatible rules systems.
The Seventh Crown Core Setting Book will include:
A detailed History of the continent of Kanis, its many Cultures and its current Rulers
A detailed Pantheon of Kanisi deities, including their effect upon Clerics, Paladins and Druids in Seventh Crown
A detailed look at the Geography and Civilizations of Kanis
New Kanisi Backgrounds, Feats and Spells
Full Color Unique Illustrations throughout
Full Color Maps of the Kanis surface world and the subterranean Great Beneath
Narrative Stories set in the world of Seventh Crown (some starring characters from higher-level Backers!)
Plot Hooks and Adventure Ideas; including two detailed 1st-level Campaign Starters
A Glossary of Seventh Crown terms to help with pronunciation and explanation
What do you get for your backing?
Aside from being a part of the launch of a great new game setting, hopefully giving it enough fan backing to begin a full Seventh Crown line of sourcebooks and such in the near future, you faithful backers can get some really awesome rewards for helping us get off the ground!
The Copper Piece Level – For just $2 or more you throw in your attentions to the campaign and help keep the Kickstarter “Hot Picks” eyes peeled on our little project here. Not only does this help us out, but it also allows you to ask questions in the Comments section, or purchase some of the additional Add-ons when the campaign succeeds.
The Silver Piece Level – For a $20 campaign pledge, this is just the electronic PDF copy of the Seventh Crown Core Setting Book, special thanks in the final product and access to purchasing Add-ons.
The Electrum Piece Level – At $35, this is aimed at the normal MSRP of the printed publication and would be considered the “average” backer level. At this level you will receive not only the electronic PDF copy offered at the Silver Piece level, special thanks in the final product and have access to Add-ons, but you will also receive one printed hardcopy of the Seventh Crown Core Setting Book. In addition, as the campaign moves up through the Stretch Goals, you automatically receive each Stretch Goal Bonus Product with your pledge!
The Gold Piece Level – For a $45 campaign investment you receive an electronic PDF copy of the Seventh Crown Core Setting Book, special thanks in the final product, access to Add-ons, all unlocked Stretch Goal Bonus Products, and a printed hardcopy of the Seventh Crown Core Setting Book signed and personalized by the author, Bryan Steele, and the lead artiste, Natalie Patterson.
The Unionist Level – For a $65 campaign investment you receive an electronic PDF copy of the Seventh Crown Core Setting Book, special thanks in the final product, access to Add-ons, all unlocked Stretch Goal Bonus Products, a printed hardcopy of the Seventh Crown Core Setting Book signed and personalized by the author and the lead artiste, as well as a random piece of original art from the setting book (not an art print!).
The Thornrellan's Mercy Level – For a $75 campaign investment you receive an electronic PDF copy of the Seventh Crown Core Setting Book, special thanks in the final product, access to Add-ons, all unlocked Stretch Goal Bonus Products, a printed hardcopy of the Seventh Crown Core Setting Book signed and personalized by the author and the lead artiste, and the backer reserves a seat at one of three special charity gaming events at GenCon 2015!
These special events will be narrative D&D 5E story-arc play sessions for 5 pre-generated player characters that will be re-living and re-enacting famous moments from Kanisi history – with the game designer, Bryan Steele, running each event as DM! During these events we will be taking charitable food donations (Canned and sealed-boxed items only) from the players AND bystanders to be given to the local Food Finders Food Bank (http://food-finders.org/) to serve as points of Inspiration to modify the game in progress. The catch is that while the players can donate their food products to play as Inspiration for their own characters during the game, bystanders can donate food products to either help out the Player Characters OR give Inspiration for the rolls made by the DM! No matter who is getting the Inspiration played for them, Food Finders will be the true winners in the event.
The Platinum Piece Level – If you are one of the limited backers at the $100 level, you receive an electronic PDF copy of the Seventh Crown Core Setting Book, special thanks in the final product, access to Add-ons, all unlocked Stretch Goal Bonus Products, and a printed hardcopy of the Seventh Crown Core Setting Book signed and personalized by the author and lead artiste. Additionally, within 60 days of the campaign closing you will be in direct e-mail contact with the setting’s designer in order to work the Player Character of your own design into the greater Seventh Crown narrative background as a character of note. So, if you want the favorite of your unique and interesting characters to be a part of something official and in the limelight for thousands of readers and players to interact with… this is the Backer Level for you!
The Crown Level – At $500 and limited to only possibly 8 backers, this is the ultimate backer level. you receive an electronic PDF copy of the Seventh Crown Core Setting Book, special thanks in the final product, access to Add-ons, all unlocked Stretch Goal Bonus Products, and a printed hardcopy of the Seventh Crown Core Setting Book signed and personalized by the author and lead artiste. Also, like with the Gold Piece Level, you will not only work with Bryan to have your character immortalized in the pages of the setting… but also to have it transformed into a physical representation by way of a 30mm scale resin miniature! Perfect for map-based encounters or simply to show off to your fellow gamers, you will work with Bryan to describe the character well enough to have it professionally sculpted and take its place as one of the first products in the Seventh Crown RPG Miniatures line! (Expect some slight delay after regular products ship for the miniatures to be released due to time, talent and resources needed.)
IMPORTANT NOTE: All shipping costs within the continental USA are included with the backer levels, with additional US shipping showing under each Add-on. For backers/purchasers outside the continental USA, there is an additional $15 shipping charge to handle international postage.
Pre-Miniature "Green" for Shrevak, Copper Dragonborn Bosun
The Future of Seventh Crown
Our hopes with this Kickstarter are not just to create a single publication to release Seventh Crown – we have much, much more in the works for this setting. Should this campaign go well enough to show us a solid fan base in the works, we plan on getting Seventh Crown print runs into common distribution and hopefully into game stores all over the world.
Additionally, we have plans to write a series of Seventh Crown setting products that will better flesh out the world, its many plotlines and some major events that take place in the overarching story and expanding world setting.
Some of the products we have planned are as follows:
various Adventure Modules that cover specific plot arcs important to the Seventh Crown storyline
Bestiary of Kanis Sourcebook; introducing numerous native species of creatures to encounter
Farsteader’s Atlas Sourcebook; a guide to the lands beyond the primary continent of Kanis
Seventh Crown novellas surrounding epic events within the world
Essentially, we want this Kickstarter campaign to go well enough to warrant making Seventh Crown into a larger roleplaying setting capable of launching more products through future Kickstarters and eventually on their own merit. We need your help, support and some good old fashioned word-of-mouth advertising for that to happen!
Add-Ons
The following are all Add-on products that Seventh Crown backers may purchase using the Campaign Manager Backer Kit.
Seventh Crown Tee Shirt ($15 and $5 shipping) – A simple, high quality black tee shirt with the Seventh Crown logo printed upon it. Perfect for a devoted DM or player!
Pathfinder Rules PDF for Seventh Crown ($5 and free shipping) – A high-quality PDF file of a chapter that contains new Feats, Spells, etc. written for Seventh Crown using the Pathfinder rules set. Everything a Seventh Crown player will need to use those rules in the Seventh Crown setting!
Poster-sized Map of Kanis ($10 and $3 shipping) – A high quality, folding 2’ x 3’ poster map of the surface world of Kanis. Great for game room walls and adventure planning!
Poster-sized Map of the Great Beneath ($10 and $3 shipping) – A high quality, folding 2’ x 3’ poster map of the subterranean world of the Great Beneath. Perfect to map out and plan adventure down in the darkness under the world!
The Great Beneath Full Map
Extra Copies of the Seventh Crown Core Setting Book ($30 and $5 shipping) – This is just an extra physical copy of the Seventh Crown Core Setting Book. This is a great way to get extra books around the game table, or gifts for those you plan to play with!
Stretch Goals
We sincerely hope that the Kickstarter campaign for Seventh Crown goes very well, and we have lots of plans to make sure that our backers get excellent goodies if they spread the good word and bring in lots of great pledges. While none of these are remotely possible until after we hit our initial goal and then beyond, we thought we could at least show you what we have planned for our first two Stretch Goals…
$17,000 – Pathfinder Rules Content! (LOCKED) … this Stretch Goal adds a pdf chapter containing Seventh Crown special rules (Feats, Spells, etc.) specifically written for the Pathfinder rules set to every Electrum Piece Level or higher backing level automatically.

campaign.story:
Border: Remembrance is a fast paced, high difficulty Metroidvania game, in the spirit of Castlevania games mixed with Dark/Demon souls. The pixel art visual style delivers a weird and twisted tale of a world’s last 3 weeks.
In the interest of time, here is the short summary of what this game is:
A grand misery.  
Nonlinear storytelling.  
Multiple endings.
 Countless secrets.
 Architectural level design.
 Alternative routes, shortcuts.
 Different characters have entirely different routes for the same level. • Up to 20 different weapons and spells for each character.  
Destructible environments; burn, blow and slash your way through obstacles. Who needs keys when you have a rocket launcher?  
No tiles. Each level is hand drawn.  
A mixed technology setting; swords meeting magic and space age technology.  
Themes inspired by the works of H.P. Lovecraft.
Read on for a detailed description, but why just read when you can play the demo instead?
"Gameplay is King"
While many play games to seek out good stories or characters, gameplay still needs to be a priority when considering a game. Games are interactive and you cannot deliver an interesting world unless your gameplay compliments the art.
Border’s first goal is to deliver a smooth and fast paced game, one that is fun and fair to play while still being really challenging.
Upon starting the game, your goal will be clear, you will have 3 characters to choose from and 3 of the huge main areas open to you.
Each character has an entirely different entry point and portion of the map accessible to them; aside from the end bosses of each of these areas, they won’t share any bosses. This means that replaying a level with another character is an entirely different experience.
Once selecting your area you will have a clear goal but multiple ways to reach it. The architectural level design ensures that shortcuts are present and many in number. Hand drawn areas make navigation easy, also helpful is the fact that defeated enemies and their remains will never disappear.
You will eventually come across unique enemies or fallen warriors who will grant you access to new weapons or spells.
Weapons and Spells.
These are the focus of your character. They all have entirely different move sets, strengths and weaknesses. Many of these weapons and spells can grant you access to new areas, similar to the traditional Metrodvania formula. All of these weapons and spells use the same resource: your stamina. All of these areas are full of secrets and Easter eggs.
The game uses a natural method of storytelling where the environment tells a story on its own, without much exposition. Additionally the game’s "cut scenes" will never wrestle the control away from the player; the camera never loses sight of the player, and if you don't want to listen to your enemy’s monologue you can always interrupt them with a well-aimed punch to the face.
On your journey you can sometimes come across NPCs who are neither friends nor foes, some will talk to you, but you might never know if they will become your enemies later or not.
Sooner or later you will die. When you do so, you will lose all of the souls attached to you. However, they can be recovered - similar to how it works in the Souls series of games.
Aside from your weapons you will have a few things always available to you, these are as follows.
Healing: you can only heal with charges in your crystal fragment, these replenish at every checkpoint.
Protection spell: each character has their own altered version of this basic spell. It deflects weapon hits and reflects projectiles, but cannot defend you from area of effect spells and traps.
Shifting: it’s a form of dash that allows for a short burst of rapid movement. It also allows you to trigger traps and area of effects without being harmed.
Overextension system. This is an extremely powerful offensive ability available to you. When used it will increase all of your stats drastically and provide a special move set that can decimate foes, and turn the odds in your favour. However, to activate this you need to sacrifice one of your charges used for healing.This mode lasts only for a short time, unless you sacrifice another charge while the mode is active.
Once you reach your destination at the end of an area, and complete your mission, you will return to your base of operation: the Nagifar. On this space-worthy ship you can upgrade your skills, exchange a few words with the other characters, and learn a bit about the world you’re in.
Bosses are a big focus of the game. They are usually one on one affairs, many of them will try and communicate with you in some way, some have multiple ways to defeat them, and these ways can alter the story and the NPCs that you might come upon later on. Expect these to be challenging encounters.
Once ready, you select the character and the area of your choice again.
Based on your choice of who finishes which area, the story will shift and change and you might understand a bit more about the world, and why it will end...
Border: Remembrance takes place in what is known as a mixed technology setting. This is a world housing nations with largely different levels of technology and prosperity. After a cataclysmic war, the world reawakened with newfound magic, and new forms of life, with some survivors using advanced technology some even living in space.
From sprawling city nations to abandoned temples to lads crawling with robots, this is a chaotic world.
Visit the Forest of the Seal, where once a great nation gathered mages to perform "The First Summoning", now the land is overtaken by nature and infested with Demons. Still, the descendants of the few survivors still guard this place and fight to stop the spread of Demons any further.
Forest of the Seal.
Fight your way through the city nation of Berelaai, the largest remaining Human kingdom, and witness as the church turns to madness in the face of imminent destruction.
City of Berelaai.
Battle with the elements as you search the new South Pole for the hidden city of Artificial Intelligence: this city houses Millions of AIs who escaped the last Great War. See with your own eyes how the calculus of AIs deal with the destruction of the moon.
Unity AI.
Delve deep into the Sunken City, where Geometry and conventional logic will be of no help to you. Fight the cursed inhabitants of this ancient and unnatural place.
Sunken City.
Enter the space station of Yggdrasil, where the gears of technology never stopped. Decide the fate of the scientists now thrust into a civil war, and the moon threatens even the station.
Yggdrasil space station.
A group of these scientists decided to completely isolate themselves from others and delve into experiments with the new found magic in the world.
Project Aesir.
This project gave birth to your playable characters: humanoids with inhuman everlasting life given to them.
Frey
Midir
Baldar
Sif
At the beginning of the game, you, the player, trigger a terrible explosion on the moon. This will cause 35% of the moon’s mass to break apart and begin its 3 week long journey toward the earth. This means the end of all complex life on the planet for good.
You caused this, and there is no saving the world this time.
The story focuses on 3 characters form the Aesir project who can be considered a new race of humans. They have everlasting youth and possess bodies more resilient than those of normal humans.
These Demigods will set out on a journey to form what are known as the Mana Stones, fuse them with as many souls as they can and find a new world to plant these souls after the destruction.
But as this cataclysm waiting for the world is absolutely undeniable, the people of this world will have a hard time dealing with the concept of certain doom.
You will visit the two great kingdoms of man who are at each other’s throats, each blaming the other for the destruction of the moon. Uncover the remains of the Demon Palace, where a once great soul was sealed away. Enter and marvel at the nation of Artificial Intelligences built for themselves. Delve deep into the cosmic chaos of the Sunken Capital. And witness a pointless war just before the end of the world.
Your journey will deal with themes of absolute certain loss, cosmic insignificance, and how the different cultures reflect on their actions near the end of everything they know.
By the end you might even uncover why the destruction was triggered, and expose a great mystery.
You might say that there is a strong atmosphere of desperation and unavoidable destruction in Border… well, you'd be right! One way of setting the tone is with an engaging storyline, but to really feel as if you are actually there you're going to need music. Whether it is just simple background ambience or full-blown musical scores, with Border, the aim has always been to enhance whatever scene or idea I have been given to work from by creating music around it - thus creating a real emotional connection with the player.
The music creation is actually a two-way process. I am given a detailed description of either a character, event, battle, area or scene using keywords. I may also be given specific restraints such as which instruments to use, or how the music should progress. Then with this information I will usually begin to formulate ideas in my head, imagining certain emotions that may be present. Usually this begins on piano only, then I will add more instruments in once I have a confident starting point.
Once this has been roughly assembled, it will be sent to Istvan for feedback. From there changes can easily and quickly be made if need be. This whole process for one piece of music takes between a few hours to a few days - depending on the complexity of the music and time constraints. The benefits of working this way are clear - not only is the whole process extremely quick, but the constant feedback ultimately provides Istvan with music that compliments the original design intentions and the atmosphere that is needed in a game like Border: Remembrance.
Note: To clarify all console versions listed will be released, stretchgoals only means they can be released the same time the PC versions will be released. If stretchgoals are not reached we will still release on the listed consoles but only some time later.
---£4.000 Flyable world map.---
A fully detailed world map you can fly your Spaceship around, and even discover hidden areas and secret bosses.
---£5.000 Forgotten age Dungeon.---
An endgame dungeon featuring 7 Bosses of extreme difficulty, offering more clues about the language used in the game.
---£6.000 More Music.---
More haunting musical tracks from the talented Jamie Warne.
---£8.000 Hiring Help from community.---
Hiring help to work on even more enemies’ pixel art animations, this means a faster development, and more content.
---£10.000 PS4 and PS VITA Versions on launch.---
Console versions with Console specific controls. Stretchgoal is ONLY to ensure the console versions will release on launch. If the goal is not met, the first sales on PC will cover the costs of the porting, meaning around two months delay.
---£12.000 local Co-op & Duel Mode.---
Pick up a second controller, or do it the good old fashioned way and share the same keyboard. Challenge your friends in a super fast paced Duel arena, up to 4 players.
---£16.000 Voice acting.---
If available using the voice talents of: Megan Hollingshead (Pokemon, Code Geass, and countless amazing video game performances.) for the role of Frey.
Johnny Yong Bosch (Code Geass, Haruhi, and hundreds of amazing video game performances.) for the role of Baldar.
Liam O'Brien (Bleach, Code Geass, and hundreds of amazing video game performances.) for the role of Midir.
*If said voice talents will be unavailable the voice work will be hired from indie voice actors.
---£18.000 Nintendo WII U version on launch.---
Thanks to Nintendo`s latest policies this can become a reality. Console versions with Console specific controls. Stretchgoal is ONLY to ensure the console versions will release on launch. If the goal is not met, the first sales on PC will cover the costs of the porting.
Why Kickstarter?
Because aside from the music, this is purely a one man game. Currently I`m working odd jobs through temporary employment, I have little time left, and given a successful Kickstarter I can dedicate more time to the game. Pixel work and Coding takes a lot of time.
Releasing a game also involves taxes, and that requires paperwork. Setting up a proper website and distribution of the DRM free version is not free either.
Kickstarter is also a great opportunity to interact with the target audience, survey their feelings about the game and potential ideas on how to improve it - more eyes see a lot more.
This means I plan to do weekly updates, during and after the Kickstarter. If you want extra reassurance follow me on Twitter where I`ll be talking about my daily progress, and sharing art from the game on a regular basis. From YouTube gameplay snippets, to Twitch pixel art and GML coding sessions, to crafting Music with Jam, I plan to make the development of the game a more open experience.
Backers can expect a playable demo of the game for pc shortly after the end of the Kickstarter.
Our Website: http://www.fallenvalkyriestudio.com/
Our Press kit: http://www.fallenvalkyriestudio.com/press-kit/
For more art, please visit my Tumblr: https://www.tumblr.com/blog/fallenvalkyriestudio
Or our IndieDB page: http://www.indiedb.com/games/border-remembrance
Or just follow me on Twitter for daily Pixelart, and updates on the game`s progress: https://twitter.com/FValkyrieStudio
Thank you very much for reading.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Aside from the Music this is a one man effort.
There are obviously positives and negatives to this. The negative is the possibility of getting swamped, luckily the game`s code is 70% complete. Most of my time will be spent on asset creation. The upside of this is the ability to keep the vision and game design consistent.

I have a really clear vision of what this game should be, and value the responsiveness and comfort in gameplay firstly.
This means I am to make a game that first feels solid and plays smoothly before trying to deliver my artistic goals.

The game is currently fully functioning, and all coding besides menus is finished. Using GML means that even if problems were to occur, they are incredibly easy to fix. At this time the game has no bugs or glitches, and the game runs at a steady 60fps on 1080P resolution on 5 year old computer hardware. Performance still persists when using over 100 enemies on screen!

The only risk I can run into is being late on release, I value a strong finished version over buggy and barely functioning early access.

The main challenge is obviously time. There is a LOT of sprite animating to be done here, but again a lot of training got me to a really efficient method, which should make all of this possible in the desired time frame.

As I stated earlier I will make the development of this game very open to the public, I have nothing to hide, and will do everything in my power to be transparent!

Thank you very much for reading.

campaign.story:
The Show 
Cannon Busters is an animated adventure about the value of friendship and just how far one is willing to go to maintain it. If The Wizard of Oz met the Hidden Fortress with influences derived from Escaflowne, hip-hop, and classic RPGs -- you get Cannon Busters, one wild ride of fun, suspense, action, and wackiness. It's a roadshow-style adventure of epic proportions!

The Story
Follow the adventures and exploits of S.A.M, a high-end, royal-class friendship droid who's joined by a quirky, discarded maintenance robot and a brash, deadly fugitive. Together, the unlikely trio embarks on an unforgettable journey in a fantastic and dangerous world in search of S.A.M's best friend, the heir to a powerful kingdom under siege.
The Main Characters
The World
The story takes place hundreds of years ago in the vast and magical world of Gearbolt. As the centuries passed, the practice of magic became extinct, and many have forgotten its power, regulating it to mere superstition…
The Project
Cannon Busters is an animated project created by TV animation producer/director LeSean Thomas. The goal is to produce a 8-10 minute pilot episode (1 act) through Kickstarter. We're looking to you to help us raise, at the very least, the minimum goal of $120,000 (8-10 minutes). If we surpass our minimum goal, our stretch goals will increase the length of the episode by 8-16 minutes, ultimately providing us the funds to create and develop a full 24-minute episode!
The Team Players
Here's some of the team members who you'll be supporting to help bring Cannon Busters to life!
 LeSean Thomas, Creator/Director/Writer (https://twitter.com/LeSeanThomas)
LeSean Thomas has contributed to television animation in the United States for over 10 years. His most notable works include Peabody Award-winning series The Boondocks on Adult Swim serving as Co-Director (Season 1) and Supervising Character Designer (Seasons 1 & 2), Nickelodeon's The Legend Of Korra (Book 1) as a storyboard/production artist, and most recently Black Dynamite: The Animated Series as Creative Producer (Season 1) and Supervising Director (Seasons 1 & 2) on Adult Swim.
Recently, Thomas spent several years working abroad in South Korea as an animation production/storyboard artist, honing his skills and developing Cannon Busters while lending his talent to hit shows. He is driven by his passion and enthusiasm for animation production and enjoys sharing his knowledge with the animation & art community online. Drawing from Western and Eastern influences, Thomas's work displays a level of stylistic expression and dynamism that makes him highly distinguishable among his peers. Through his unique vision and your support, he hopes to bring Cannon Busters to life!
Joe Madureira, Contributing Character Designer (http://www.airshipsyndicate.com)
One of the most influential artists working today, Joe Madureira is a celebrated comic book creator, illustrator, and game developer. His breakout work on titles such as Marvel's Uncanny X-Men and his creator-owned comic book Battle Chasers has earned him much acclaim. He also served as Creative Director for the hit video game series Darksiders (1&2). Madureira's energetic and distinctive style combines Western comic book influences with aspects of Japanese manga. We couldn't be more excited about his contributions to Cannon Busters!
Thomas Romain, Mechanical Designer (https://twitter.com/Thomasintokyo)
Thomas Romain has been a creative force since he moved from France to Japan over 10 years ago. As the Co-creator of Code Lyoko and Co-director/Character Designer on Oban Star Racers, Romain caught the attention of legendary Mecha Designer Shoji Kawamori (http://www.satelight.co.jp/kawamori/) and joined the famous animation studio Satelight Inc. (http://www.satelight.co.jp/eng/), where he helped co-create Basquash! Now a BG and Mecha Designer at Satelight, his most recent work has been lauded around the globe thanks to his unconventional Mecha designs for the popular Toonami series Space Dandy. His newest work on Cannon Busters promises to go even further!
Tim Yoon, Consulting Producer
Tim Yoon has worked as a producer in the American TV animation industry for over 10 years with notable works such as Batman: Under The Red Hood and The Legend of Korra (Books 1& 2). Having served as producer for The Killers "Miss Atomic Bomb" music video and most recently, the animation producer for the Drake Vs. Lil Wayne Tour, Yoon's wide range of experience -- in and outside animation -- is a valuable asset for Cannon Busters. 
Bahi JD, animator
(https://twitter.com/bahijd)
Bahi JD is one of the most promising up-and-coming animators working in TV animation today. Garnering online acclaim for his gif set animations years ago, he has since blossomed into one of 2D animation's growing talents. He's contributed his talents to various projects such as the Skullgirls video game, Shinichiro Watanabe's Kids on the Slope, the Mitsuyo Miyazaki/Koji Morimoto-directed short A Better Tomorrow, Space Dandy, Ping Pong, and most recently Ghost In The Shell: Arise. Bahi's kinetic and expressive flair will bring just the right touch to Cannon Busters!
Eric Calderon, Writer ( https://twitter.com/ericcalderon )
Eric has been in the international animation business for 20 years and has been the force behind the development of no less than 15 animated TV series in the genres of action, prime-time comedy, and kids entertainment. As a writer and co-producer for the legendary series Afro Samurai & Afro Samurai: Resurrection (starring the voices of Samuel L. Jackson, Kelly Hu, and Ron Perlman with music by the RZA), he helped lead that project into becoming the only anime in history to ever be nominated for a prime-time Emmy (the series also won an Individual Achievement Emmy for best Art Direction). Why Use Kickstarter?  
As kids growing up, we had a plethora of animated shows on American TV that spanned all genres -- action, adventure, comedy, dark humor; some content with mature themes and some educational... But over the years, the economy has influenced studios to become more risk-averse towards new ideas that don't already have a built-in following (e.g. celebrity talent) or an established franchise. And if so, it catered more towards comedy.
As a lover of comedy and big franchises myself (and having worked on dozens in my time), I still secretly yearned for more adventure shows that had plenty of comedy, but also a sprawling drama at its core -- along with kick-butt action and memorable characters! 
Enter crowdfunding, one of the most liberating platforms for the independent creator! After giving it a lot of thought (and much encouragement from my peers), I thought, ''What if I just brought an action-adventure dramedy series to the fans and admirers of this genre, instead of going through a network who would use focus groups to determine if my project was even worth seeing the light of day? Why not go the REAL focus group? The ones who would actually donate to see a project like this come together with some of the most exciting talents--domestic and abroad-- in the industry today?"

So here we are. We're trying to make this unique and exciting journey a reality -- and we need YOUR SUPPORT in backing this project! Let's make Cannon Busters happen! 
Where Your Donation Funds Will Go
All donations will go to the production and increased quality of one episode of Cannon Busters! Each donation from you, the backers, will get us closer to delivering something new, exciting, and high quality! In the event that we unfortunately fail to reach at least our passion-project minimum of $120k before the ending campaign date listed above, Amazon will not charge you and we will not achieve our goal.
