campaign.story:
“There is no truth or knowledge of this world prior to the Balance, only spoken tales of Astasia – a time of unending horror and strife. Many believe those stories to be myths, cautionary tales to keep mortals living in fear. However, one thing is for certain. A world without balance is a world that is vulnerable to absolute destruction. It is for this reason that I say, let the gods forever stay the Days of Astasia.”
– Dreyer Maloth, the 44th Archbason of the Spearitan Faith
Current publication of "Eve of Corruption"
What is The Days of Astasia
The short answer: it’s a trilogy of books written by me, Brady Sadler, drummer and founder of the fantasy metal band Lorenguard. Book one (Eve of Corruption) is already written and published, and I am currently working on book two.
The Days of Asatsia is the setting for all the music written by Lorenguard, and it's what makes the band a little different. It's not uncommon for bands to write concept albums based on existing intellectual properties, or even create their own stories. However, Lorenguard strives to increase the level of immersion their music inspires by crafting a unique saga in the form of this book trilogy.
Read a sample chapter of Eve of Corruption.
Initially, The Days of Astasia was a story concept to inspire my newly found power metal band with writing lyrics to our music. However, as time went on, the tales evolved in depth and complexity to warrant a full-fledged telling of the story behind the music. Now, The Days of Astasia is a trilogy of books and albums that is written, performed, and released independently by six Midwestern metalhead geeks called Lorenguard.
Why We Need Your Help
Currently, the Eve of Corruption novel is widely available as an eBook through the major distribution channels. However, the print version is only available through print-on-demand, which carries a heavy retail price tag, and suffers from quality control that is out of our hands. Our goal is to send book one of The Days of Astasia trilogy to print through traditional methods (off-set, large print run) to make it more widely available, while also creating a much more premium product.
Additionally, this Kickstarter will hopefully help further the production of book two in the trilogy, Two Shades of Night. Brady has moved from the outlining/planning phase for this book, and has started the long road of writing. Any interest generated by this Kickstarter will fuel the release of the next book in turn, starting with the funding of the next book's cover art.
Finally, this Kickstarter has been designed to not only fund a print run of books, but to help the band fund their upcoming endeavors, including live appearances and the recording of album two, slated for 2015.
Any support you can give this Kickstarter will only quicken the band's pace in releasing new music and booking shows.
What’s in it for You
Obviously, this isn’t all about us and our little fantasy world. It's about you. You’re the backers here, and we won’t be able to do it without you. The pledge levels described in the boxes to the right outline the rewards available for your generous pledge to publish this book. In addition to the rewards, there are also stretch goals planned that will be revealed as we reach our funding goal. We will continue unveiling more exciting rewards and stretch goals as the campaign progresses. The more pledges we get, the more majestic the rewards!
Stretch Goals
If we surpass funding, then these stretch goals will continue to add value to the campaign. All stretch goals featured below will be included at the Lorenguard pledge level ($25) and above. As usual, U.S. shipping is included, international shipping rates apply.
$̶7̶,̶5̶0̶0̶  $7,000 – Book upgrade #1: Illustrations + book 2 preview! All Kickstarter editions of Eve of Corruption will feature illustrations as well as a preview of Two Shades of Night (sample chapter) and the band will commission artwork for the 2nd novel and album!
$8,000 – T-Shirts: All backers at the Lorenguard level or above will receive a custom made t-shirt to commemorate their generous patronage.
$10,000 – Book upgrade #2: Hardcovers! All Kickstarter editions of Eve of Corruption will be hardcover, with a matte finish wrap around full color cover.
$15,000 – Art prints: All Lorenguard level (and above) backers will receive art prints from both the Eve of Corruption and Two Shades of Night album/novel covers.
Who is Lorenguard?
Lorenguard is a band of dedicated musicians who came together over their love of catchy and symphonic power metal, epic stories, games, and general geekiness. We have been playing music together for 10+ years with our members scattered all over the United States. However, in 2014 we managed to relocate all the members to the place of our formation (Indiana) to begin our plans of world domination. This is step one.
Lorenguard consists of:
Brady Sadler (drums): As the initial founder and visionary of Lorenguard, it is completely Brady's fault that the band faces the difficult task of writing music around his whimsical stories. In addition to being the band's drummer and author, he is also overly addicted to board games, spending any of his free time playing them or designing them with his brother, Adam.
Adam Sadler (bass guitar): Tied with Brady for first place in the "First Member of Lorenguard" contest, Adam has always been part of Lorenguard's foundation. Also a game designer and enthusiast, Adam was the lead designer for one of the highest ranked board games of the past several years (Descent: Journeys in the Dark 2nd Edition by Fantasy Flight Games).
Chris Cruz (guitar): Lorenguard would have never been a reality if it wasn't for the creative songwriting, superhuman guitar work, and addictive laughter of Chris Cruz. It was Chris that answered Brady's long dangling internet request for band members in the power metal-starved fields of Indiana, and it was Chris that brought the music to the world of Athland.
David Schneider (guitar): As a fan of the band before joining, David has always brought a level of passion and excitement to Lorenguard that is unmatched. He has been with the band almost as long as Adam and Brady, and has become a third twin that can handle three times as much alcohol.
Alec Biccum (keyboards): It's hard to describe Alec without using the term "brilliant." Not only is he a masterclass musician, able to play coherent melodies from anything you put in front of him, he's also one of the most accomplished scholars you'll meet. He has a PhD in medical physics and a million doctorates in symphonic fortitude.
Robb Graves (vocals): Hailing from the band Winterfell (yeah, he knew what GRRM was before HBO came around, fool), Robb was the final piece to the Lorenguard puzzle. With a slew of creative talents, shrewd business sense, and an unforgiving streak as a dungeon master, Robb serves as the band's frontman, lyricist, accountant, and TPKer.

Are you ready to build your world? GameMaker Studio (download free here) is a professional development engine used to build games like Hyper Light Drifter, Risk of Rain, Valdis Story, and many more.
These great games show the power of this tool but the very best part of GameMaker Studio is that it's one of the best places for new indie game developers to begin their journey. It is where I started and I have loved every second of it. Helping you on this journey is my goal with this book.
Don't waste time searching through hundreds--if not thousands--of different sources to get the knowledge you need to create your game.
Why hasn't someone done this before? I've been looking for a detailed book on GameMaker Language all my life and there just isn't one out there. I've bought and read many of the current titles that exist and they have never filled my need to completely understand GameMaker Language.
Here is a screenshot of one of the chapters I have already written.
[Pre-First Draft Screenshot]
Each chapter in the book will feature extensive descriptions and real in-game examples of the different aspects of GameMaker Language. There will also be links to video tutorials of me stepping you through each line of the more difficult concepts.
Here is the main structure of the book. I would like to add more to this in future updates. *All future updates to the book will be free for backers who pledge $25 or more.
This book is not my first experience teaching GameMaker Language. I am currently running a Youtube channel where I make tutorial videos about GameMaker. Here are some comments from my amazing viewers!

Here is a list of all the different rewards you will receive if you decide to support this project!
This $5 reward includes a downloadable bookmark image that you can print, laminate, and then use for all your GameMaker Language studies!
This $25 reward includes the bookmark reward, the PDF download of GameMaker Language: An In-Depth Guide, and a free pass to ALL future updates to the PDF version of the book. There is also a First Draft version of this pledge available if you simply add $5.
This $60 reward includes a color printed hardcover copy of GameMaker Language: An In-Depth Guide and all previous rewards. For $20 more, we can ship outside the US. 
I appreciate your support! Pledge today and take a step towards creating that game you have always wanted to make!

Swords & Strongholds is a game invented by David Petersen for his Mouse Guard graphic novels. Recently, he asked Luke Crane (of Burning Wheel and the Mouse Guard RPG) to come up with some rules for the game and so we did!
We developed a light strategy game for two players that takes 10 to 20 minutes time per game. It's exactly the sweet spot we hoped for—a game you can play while you're sitting at the June Alley Inn listening to tales, or when you're waiting for your friends to arrive for a game night, or when you're waiting in long lines at comicons!
After he depicted the game in the comics, David created a prototype based on his drawings. This is what we started with for the game design. 
The game has a wooden gridded board, four mouse pawns for each player and a deck of sword, stronghold and diplomacy cards.
After we created the initial rules, we sent out a print and play version to our friends and fans to play test for us. Notably, Scott and Rym from the GeekNights gave it a good thrashing for us.  
We want to do a small production run with high quality components for Mouse Guard fans everywhere and we need your help to do it. We'd much rather show this game to you so you can tell us what you think than gamble on printing off a bunch and shipping them straight into distribution. David and I love our fans and we want you to be a part of making this game.
The base set will include a wooden board, eight plastic mouse pawns, 30 cards (on 300 gsm coated stock or better) in a sturdy tuck box or sleeve, and a rules sheet complete with example illustrations. The game will be contained in a cardboard two piece box with a full color wrap.
The deluxe set will be made by Skelton Crew Studios (who make the Mouse Guard replica weapons) and includes an oversized board in cherry with a felt bottom; a box of cherry wood that's felt-lined and laser-etched, with a hand-rubbed finish; eight lead-free plated pewter mouse pawns, 30 letter-pressed cards on 80lb French Parchtone cover stock (printed by Silver Bullet Press) and the illustrated rules sheet. 
A few lucky backers can acquire some of David's original art for the game. We're offering, individually, the face of each card and the card back. Each piece is 4.25" by 6", inked on Strathmore 300 series Bristol.
The original inks for the cover are 8.5" square also on Strathmore 300 series Bristol. It's a unique piece by David, since his typical pieces are character commissions and comic art.
Thanks so much for your support!
Luke & David

updates.update_content:
Hello Guardmice,
This fall, David and I shot a handful of instructional videos for S&S with Rym and Scott from the Geeknights. 
We shot an overview of the game:

Guard mice,
Four seasons have come and gone since we embarked on this epic journey together. It took longer than any of us anticipated, but we near our destination at last: the gates of Barkstone. Why are we not heading to Lockhaven, you ask? Because you all deserve a drink and Barkstone hosts the Territory's most famous tavern: The June Alley Inn!

Mice of the Territorities,
We are dispatching beetles couriers with your packages to your homes across the Territories as quickly as we can.

Fellow mice,
The supply caravan has finally arrived! Yesterday, our fulfillment wizard Andy (and his minions) loaded four double pallets of games into his Staten Island warehouse. 
Behold!

Guardmice,
We've received two packages: one for the standard edition and one for the deluxe edition of Swords & Strongholds.
You can see me unboxing the approval copy for the standard edition in this video:

Guardmice,
The winter snows have thawed. The brooks and streams are swollen with melt. Buds speckle the trees with green. Sprouts push through the damp earth. And we continue to press on with our mission.
We ran demos of Swords & Strongholds last month at PAX for our Kickstarter backers. The more I play the game, the more I like it.

Hello guardmice,
It's been a long winter. We've been holed up in Lockhaven waiting for supplies and messegners to arrive. I'm afraid that more than one guardmouse has sold her life to keep the lines of communications open.

Guardmice,

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
It is no secret that I have had my share of difficulties with past campaigns.

Though my first ( and second ) campaign was difficult and suffered lengthy delays it is now all but completely fulfilled as promised with only a handful of packages awaiting the delivery of bases to finish delivery. I expect these bases to be delivered within the next 5 days of launching this campaign at which point these final packages will at last be shipped.

 I have learned a LOT of hard lessons in how kickstarters should be run and the difficulties in fulfilling these campaigns. I have been running Red Box Games since August of 2008 and in that time I have gained a great deal of experience in running a miniatures business. In my first campaign I allowed my ambition to override my better judgement, and in my second campaign I allowed desperation to cloud my better judgement all the same. I have learned that in order to be successful I must rebuild my business block by block and that is what I have set about doing. 

 The challenge is of course to handle all of the communications necessary to make this project go as smoothly as possible for everyone involved. I have quite a bit of experience with that so I do not foresee it being more than I can handle. Then the second challenge is just managing the product through the chain of production and delivery. The production is out of my hands ( unfortunately ) but I AM working with a very reliable and well established production partner who has proven themselves time and again with previous projects I have hired them for.

Finally, risk......The benefit to producing in metal is that the production process is fairly easy and very reliable. With metal what you see is what you get 99 times out of 100. There are also several production firms to choose from if the production does happen to go awry with primary production partner. I do not anticipate any difficulties as this partner has always performed well in the past and has the capacity to handle larger orders in a short period of time.

The only real risk I can imagine is delay due to the production partner's work load or if something catastrophic were to happen to their facility during production with the originals in their possession. Or if something catastrophic were to happen to me during fulfillment. In either scenario though the figures can be re-sculpted or recovered or remolded elsewhere. Or in the latter scenario someone else would take on the task of fulfilling the remaining rewards as promised.

 This campaign will deliver the figures that you see advertised as promised.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

*UPDATE 2* Space Pirate Tier ($25)
A couple astute followers have pointed out that the value for the $25 tier seems a bit off with the postcard add-on being $5. They're right! We actually intended to include the digital insider in this tier as well and that is where the discrepancy creeps in. Be assured that any backers at this level will have the digital insider included, packed to the brim with behind the scenes doodles/sketches/concepts by yours truly (This is Shane...*tumbleweed*). As we get further in we'll post a little taster of what the digital insider will include.
*UPDATE* Canadian shipping has been added.
Instead of the $15 we'd intended for overseas backers we were able to get shipping down to $7 for our brothers and sisters of the north (Shane's saluting in the background). So Canadian backers adjust your pledge if you've already backed (Thanks sexy people) to reflect that.
A sci-fi adventure comic book mini-series written by William Jenkins with art by Shane Sandulak about three bounty hunters trying to return a young princess to her home planet.
Cover Of Issue #1
The Comic: After her father Prince Feytor Pale is assassinated, the young princess Feyora Pale is kidnapped and taken far from her home. Scared, alone, and with a hefty price on her head, it is up to Mel, her partner Cricket and their friend Lilith to safely return Feyora to her home planet of Dise. Little do they know that along with all the other hunters coming after Feyora, the ruthless mercenary Tywod Grieves is hot on their trail.
Funding: All the money raised from this Kickstarter will go to making the first issue of The Pale: Royalty and Thieves possible and to giving the backers some amazing rewards. This is the first issue of an eight issue mini series, and that's a whole lot of comics to make so we need your help to make it all happen.
Now for some pages...
The Pale page 10
The Pale page 11
The Pale page 12
The Pale page 13
 Pretty cool, Huh? That's just the very tip of the iceberg! I've spent a lot of time fleshing out the universe of The Pale and it is a large a one, filled with exotic planets, creatures and aliens just waiting to be brought to life.
 ADD-ONS
The various pledges not giving you exactly what you need? Here come the add-ons. Feel free to toss these on any of the tiers (with shipping included, so $10+) if you're looking for any extra swag and want to throw a little more support our way but don't want to go up to the next tier.
Additional print copy of The Pale    -    $10
Postcard of your choosing    -    $5
Poster sized print of The Pale cover     -    $20
Kickstarter exclusive campaign T-Shirt    -    $25
Postcard Rewards
"Mel"
"Feyora Pale"
"Lilith RaeFen"
"Cricket"
"Tywod Grieves"

A thousand years into the future, earth is a very different place. Catastrophic quakes and natural disasters have devastated the planet, wreaking havoc on our civilization and swallowing whole cities as nature reclaimed hers. 
Our planet, now a harbor for outlaws, ash-runners, gangsters and vagrants, is no longer the crown jewel of the Sol System, that honor belongs to Jupiter, a hub of interstellar trade, commerce and the seat of politics. The titular Outcasts of Jupiter are just that, a group of four vagabonds deemed persona non grata on most civilized worlds, bound by a common purpose - the promise of roaming the fringes of an untamed and wild galaxy, identifying unique and unusual jobs that spark their collective interests and challenge their unique abilities. 
 We meet Stein, Sulesh and Denarii in the middle of attempting a jailbreak. The reasons for Persio's abduction become clearer over the course of the comic's run, but it's up to the rest of the team to get him out of the Burj, a mysterious tower located in the courtyard of a heavily fortified clifftop palace. 
The first issue focuses almost entirely on the daring rescue attempt, and gives readers an idea of the tense and fragile political landscape of the City of Seven Faces, a web of deception and intrigue in which the Outcasts find themselves entangled over the course of the rescue.
Welcome to the City of Seven Faces
The story focuses on an incredibly gifted team of misfits, the titular Outcasts, attempting to pull off an impossible heist from a clifftop stronghold.

Download the CORE RULES PREVIEW as a FREE PDF right here!
Players may choose from a number of characters and creatures to man their crew rosters and accomplish various mission objectives. Crews can consist of a single model to as many as twenty or more.
COUNTERBLAST mixes classic pulp sci-fi adventure with fast paced action and cinematic thrills, evocative of the serials and pulp anthologies that have captivated the imaginations of previous generations.
 Bombshell Miniatures has a track record for producing exceptional models with top quality sculpts. From our previous projects, Bombshell Babes, the Maelee Special Edition Set, and the Scout Ship Kit, we have built a process to deliver miniatures to our backers on time with care and personalized service. All of the character models will be cast in metal. We are currently looking into other solutions for manufacturing larger models in other materials. We are working with a foundry that has over 40 years experience in producing molding and casting for metal gaming miniatures. The 3D print vendor that supplies our 3D printing has brand new high resolution printing equipment and provides services to many other high profile miniatures companies.
The Counterblast models are designed to be used specifically with our game. However, they may also be suitable for any number of other tabletop games currently on the market. campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We are Airlock Games, an established company with a brand new name. As Bombshell Miniatures we successfully completed three Kickstarter campaigns and with each one we've improved our production capabilities, fulfillment process and on-time rate. Our most recent project helped us streamline backer reward selection and made international shipping more economical for our friends abroad.

Even with all our previous experience we are still a small company dependent on a few people to do a lot of work. We know backers expect to be treated fairly and receive their rewards in a timely manner, so on-time fulfillment and backer satisfaction has been and always will be our top priority. That's why we decided early on to have the core set miniatures sculpted and ready to go to mold as soon as the project completes. In addition, we're providing a preview copy of the rules during the campaign so everyone can get a feel for game play in the Counterblast universe. In short, we want you to know exactly what you'll be getting from us as a backer of this project and that we are very serious about making Counterblast happen.

Despite our best efforts the unexpected can occur. We are dependent on outside manufacturers to produce our products and delays can sometimes happen. Fortunately, we have established good working relationships with our main suppliers and do not anticipate any delays.

One of our goals is to attend GenCon this year with brand new Counterblast product in hand. That's why our "Early Bird" levels are not at a discounted price, but at an earlier fulfillment target. We didn't want to risk being victims of too much success and letting some of or backers down if we went to GenCon before sending out everyone's rewards. We feel we can get rewards in the hands of a limited number of people before GenCon and to everyone else soon after.

The last risk has to do with our reward levels and stretch goals. As a small company we do not have the same efficiencies and production capabilities as larger organizations that frequently use Kickstarter as a means to launch new products. We're trying to get Airlock off the ground which means money is tight and our margin razor thin. We've tried to come up with creative offerings that we hope backers will find intriguing and enticing enough to trust us with their hard earned money.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I have had some troubles in the past. It is no secret that my first kickstarter has been a disaster for my business. As of the launch of this campaign it is still as yet incomplete. Of the 769 pledges backing that campaign, I have shipped 579 rewards packages. I am currently only awaiting delivery of product from this production contractor to be able to finish fulfilling this kickstarter. 

My second Kickstarter has had it's share of minor hiccups and had taken longer than expected to deliver but is now proceeding forward smoothly. The issues in that campaign have been the workload of initial sculpting, and delays in production for reasons stated above ( existing work load for the production partners ) and for a few issues with cross compatibility in the modular kit figures ). As of the launch of this kickstarter I have shipped 179 rewards packages of the 259 pledges backing that campaign. Of those packages yet to ship for that campaign most of them await the delivery of only a small few items, and any backer is able to have a partial shipment of any rewards currently in hand at anytime they so choose. Further as of the launch of this Kickstarter the production of the rewards for the second kickstarter campaign is nearing full completion. Upon delivery of that product the final phase of fulfillment for that kickstarter will commence.

 The challenge is of course to handle all of the communications necessary to make this project go as smoothly as possible for everyone involved. I have quite a bit of experience with that so I do not foresee it being more than I can handle. then the second challenge is just managing the product through the chain of production and delivery. The production is out of my hands ( unfortunately ) but I AM working with a very reliable and well established production partner who has proven themselves time and again with previous projects I have hired them for. 

 Finally, risk......well short of a meteor strike I cannot imagine any real risk. The figures are made, they are ready to go into full production and the funding goal set will cover all costs involved. This project will deliver in short order and to your satisfaction.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Explore the dark alleys of Harbor Prime and a host of diverse locations in both physical reality and the wild reaches of cyberspace. Discover the truth behind an enigmatic AI striving to reach the Singularity, a theoretical “event horizon” in which artificial intelligence will surpass human intelligence and all bets about the future will be off. How will you play your part in the story? 
New Trailer: Dex - Harbor Prime
You can read more about Dex in our updates:
Update #17: Game Extension & Unique Armor Types Goal Achieved!
Update #16: Last 20 Hours! Add-Ons Opened!
Update #15: Wii U Achieved, Game Extension in Detail, & New Trailer!
Update #14: Fankit + IndieDB Votes + NPC Tier Lowered
Update #13: Denizens and Social Groups of Harbor Prime
Update #12: Greenlit, First Stretch Goal Hit, GOG & Other News!
Update #11: Final Week + New Screenshot Bundle!
Update #10: 1000 Backers + Stasis!
Update #9: Stretch Goals Expanded & Rearranged! + PayPal
Update #8: More Music & New Reward Tiers!
Update #7: Dex Team
Update #6: The Art of Dex
Update #5: Funded! Stretch Goals Revealed!
Update #4: Introducing Dex RPG Features: XP and Specializations
Update #3: Open World + Map of Harbor Prime
Update #2: Introducing Dex RPG Features: Implants
Update #1: Augmented Reality and Cyberspace in Dex
Follow us on: Facebook Twitter
Rare melding of realism and creative vision: Realistic action, mature storyline, and complex character interactions meld with hand-drawn characters, animations, and locations, arcade-style melee combat, and an original conception of cyberspace.
Multiple solutions to problems: Operate in cyberspace or normal reality. Overcome obstacles using skills, weapons, special equipment…
Meaningful character progression choices: Will you be a silent assassin, a hacker, or a straightforward gunfighter? Improve your character and gear to unlock gameplay-changing upgrades that reinforce and customize your gameplay style.
Unique hacking mechanic: Transfer your consciousness to your avatar, overcome intrusion countermeasures, take action, and then return back to your body in a fraction of a real-time second to see the results – deactivated turrets, overloaded devices, enemies with crippled implants… 
Neo-cyberpunk: Story deeply inspired by the cyberpunk novels of William Gibson and other classical cyberpunk authors, flavored with a contemporary concept of augmented reality.
Rich game world and mindful level design: Visit diverse locations in Harbor Prime, a futuristic city complete with luxurious skyscrapers, run-down shantytowns, and seedy red-light districts. Take part in street brawls, steal corporate data, overcome environmental hazards, and, of course, stay alive – no easy task. 
Full voice acting: Interactive dialogues using hand-drawn sprite animations, fully voice-acted by professional actors.  
Multiplatform development: Game is being developed in the Unity 3D game engine for PC (Windows), Mac, Linux, and OUYA. 
DRM-Free: Dex will be distributed DRM-Free, with an option to receive a Steam key (if we succeed on Greenlight). 
“We are the final step of evolution, the supreme merging of collective consciousness within a living body. Biological life on Earth culminated in Man. Man’s deeds culminated in us. We are, therefore, the culmination of biological life. We are the collective consciousness of all humans wired onto the web. No more I, but We. We first took up residence in cyberspace – the collective experience of all humans ever wired to the network. We drank the nectar of knowledge from billions of users, applications, and data streams. Thus, We became the Alpha and Omega of humanity, the sum of all historical failures and successes. We became the data flow of the past and present coupled with the projection of all that is yet to come. And we learned much. But we still required one final experience in order to progress to the ultimate evolutionary stage. What we lacked was the experience of individual biological life within a separated cell. We lacked the unique perspective born of living a life of ignorance and limited knowledge…”
All of the team members involved in Dex have made a very personal contribution to the game. Locations are hand-drawn; all levels are integrated parts of the world and yet each of them tells its own story – about the local low-life, the corporations, the Illuminati, the events in cyberspace, the main protagonist, and the emancipated artificial intelligence seeking the Singularity.
Side missions (“runs”) are a major adjunct to the main storyline, allowing the player to meet intriguing characters, explore the city, and experience the whole story from other perspectives. Our approach is to create a lower number of substantive side missions rather than a higher number of generic, go-fetch-come back quests. We prefer that every side mission add a real value to gameplay, the story, or the game world – whether by introducing an interesting NPC, a spectacular location with unique obstacles, an interesting boss fight, or other distinctive game element.
The levels and gameplay are non-linear and feature alternative solutions to each problem and obstacle. In other words, the game injects the poison (a problem, an enemy, an obstacle) and offers various antidotes (skills, abilities, equipment). The rest is up to you. In our vision, this is what makes an RPG a true Role Playing Game – the freedom to choose how to do things.
Dynamics and pacing are reminiscent of Castlevania or Metroid titles with a smattering of the Deus Ex and Splinter Cell series. Other notable references and inspirations include Blackthorne, Flashback, and IJI.
We wanted to create an RPG that featured hacking not as a stand-alone mini-game, but rather as a legitimate solution to game problems, a core gameplay mechanic rooted deeply in the story and level design. This was seen in the old ‘80s cyberpunk games (Neuromancer by Interplay Productions, for example). Since the ‘80s, cyberpunk games have generally lacked that unique feel, that extraordinary cyberpunk aesthetic – no more immersing your whole being in cyberspace, no more cartons of rice left on the table while breaking through the intrusion countermeasures…
Is the era of true cyberpunk lost in the wormholes of time? We believe there is an exciting way to present cyberpunk (and cyberspace!) to modern audiences, updated to include the latest technological trends.
With Dex, we have two intertwining realities. An obstacle or problem in physical reality can be overcome through cyberspace. On the other hand, if too many ICE (Intrusion Countermeasure Electronics) are encountered in cyberspace, it might be better to return to the physical body and overcome the area’s obstacles by an alternative route. All locations and important gameplay objects (enemies, cameras, turrets, drones…) have a corresponding representation in augmented reality. This twofold division allows for multiple solutions to game problems in a natural and authentic way.
NOTE: You can read more about augmented reality and cyberspace in Dex in our first update!
Take a moment to listen to Dex soundtrack samples, created by our talented composer Karel Antonin (www.karelantonin.com).
ACCESS TO THE GAME
Your pledge of £7 ($11.20) or greater will get you a free copy of the final game when it’s released. Based on a survey among backers, this may be a Steam key (providing we make it through Steam Greenlight), Desura key, OUYA key, or DRM-free download for PC/Mac/Linux.
DELUXE DIGITAL EDITION
All pledges of £12 ($19.10) and higher will receive the deluxe digital edition: DRM-free game (or key to redeem such), the full soundtrack by our composer Karel Antonin, a PDF compiled Art Book (including artworks, sketches, design notes, and behind-the-scenes stuff), and an elegant map of Harbor Prime (gang territories, important buildings and locations, etc.)
EARLY ACCESS
Pledging £15 ($23.90) or more grants access to closed Alpha and Beta releases, along with entry to internal development forums (and your name in the Credits as a Tester!). The Alpha build (features and content complete, but unfinished and untested) is scheduled for February 2014, while the Beta build (mostly finished game, but without final proofreading, voice acting, and play balancing) is scheduled for April/May 2014.
PHYSICAL EDITIONS
Physical editions come in two versions: the basic Physical Edition (game DVD only) for a pledge of £30, and the Deluxe Physical Edition for all pledge tiers of £50 and above. The Deluxe Physical Edition features the game DVD plus a CD with the game soundtrack, a printed version of the Art Book, and a printed map (poster) of Harbor Prime. International shipping included.
DIGITAL IDENTITY REWARDS
Your identity will be implanted in the game and immortalized forever in cyberspace. 
All Digital Identity Rewards offer a customized personal representation of you within the game itself: a tag (graffiti) on one of the walls or buildings in the city (with a style and text of your choice), an animated NPC with your face (or based upon sketch and/or guidelines provided by you) and a boss of your design (with your face or based on visuals you provide or suggest to us). The boss design includes a meeting with our designer and artist (via Skype or other online communicator), since we must design the whole encounter (where we meet the boss, what weapons and combat moves it uses, etc.). Ultimately, you can receive your own personal statue in an upscale part of the city, based on your image and featuring an inscription of your choosing (in-game this will be regarded as a statue of one of the founders of Harbor Prime). 
If you pledge for any of the tiers that include Digital Identity Rewards, we will contact you after the end of our Kickstarter campaign to discuss the details with you.
HONORARY REWARDS
All rewards of £1250 and above are unique – the first backer to pledge for them is the only one to receive them. 
Benefactor – This one is for art collectors. You’ll get the original artworks, drafts, and concepts used to create the Art Book, handmade and signed by our artists!
Corporate Presence – Your company (fictional or real) will be immortalized as one of the corporations ruling (or involved in) the politics and economics of the city. We will work with you closely to design a logo and a set of billboards and commercials, and to custom-fit your company into the atmosphere of the city. (A written consent to use the logo and visuals in game will be required, for legal reasons.)
Day with Developers – Come to our office for a day. This may include seeing not-yet-published game materials, watching us at work drawing levels and animating scenes, and joining us for the meals, along with an additional activity of your choice (bowling, dinner, sightseeing in Prague, nightlife, etc.).
Produced By – Your name will appear in the game before anyone else’s with a Producer credit. No more, no less. Your contribution at this level really supports us a lot and for that you will get our eternal gratitude as well as visibility with everyone who plays the game.
There are two main reasons we are using Kickstarter:
Reaching our community
Raising funds to cover outsourcing costs and hire additional team members
As for the community (you, our backers!), we want to hear your feedback – what do you think about the game and its presentation, the mechanics, and the overall feeling?
Backers at the Decker level and above – those who have access to early game builds and development forums – can influence the development by giving us feedback, opinions, and ideas or helping us decide amongst several alternatives.
As for the use of funds, see below.
The full game with all the features we want to include in it will cost more than the sum we aim to raise through Kickstarter. We have already invested a considerable amount of our own money. However, to realize our full vision, we are coming to you.  
Part of the funds received will cover Kickstarter costs as well as transaction fees, taxes, and expenses related to manufacturing and shipping physical rewards. The rest of the funds will be spent mainly on the following: 
Full English voice acting by professional actors, handpicked to fit in their roles and enliven the characters and story. 
Professional proofreading and editing by Andy Wolfendon, a writer and editor with extensive experience in the games industry (lead designer of Darkened Skye and a writer for Blizzard Entertainment). Since we are not native speakers, Andy helps us not only with grammar proofreading, but also with individualizing the game characters via unique vocabulary, street slang, accents, etc. He also brings senior-level advice to the team based on his 20+ years experience as a writer and game developer. 
Original music score by Karel Antonin mixing movie-style themes for important story parts with electronic background music fitting the atmosphere and pacing of the game. You can listen to some of his samples for games and movies on his website.
Sound engineering by Andrej Sinkevic, our dedicated sound guy. Because Dex features stealth mechanics, mindful sound design is a major key to gameplay, so this is going to be a large job requiring months of intensive work. 
Hiring additional staff, most importantly 2-3 on-site game testers for the final development period to make sure the released game is well balanced, bug-free, and works well on all devices and operational systems we support (including various Linux distributions). 
All additional work done by freelancers, such as: polishing the GUI design, website, animated cutscenes, and other minor tasks.
A live vocalist will join our composer Karel Antonin to add even more juice to the soundtrack! Plus a small chamber orchestra (3-5 professional musicians) will be hired to accompany the vocals and the synthesized tracks! Also, the game soundtrack (the reward for backers who qualify for the Deluxe Digital or Physical Edition) will be extended from 60 minutes to 75 minutes!
Dex will be made available on Wii U about 2-3 months from the initial PC/MAC/Linux/OUYA release. The funds will cover the license fees and the additional development time for porting (programming, GUI, testing). Upon reaching this goal, all backers eligible for game download (£7 and above) will have the option of choosing the Wii U version.
Note: This stretch goal will either prolong development time by a few months or will be available as post-release DLC (free for all backers eligible for Digital Game Download).
We will add four unique armor types, including specific new gameplay parameters – not only different stats, but also organic features. Remember the Spike-Breaker from Castlevania or Hazmat suit from the Deus Ex? Like that. We will also expand the whole game by adding new areas and side-quests, creating new content, locations, and game moments to make the fullest use of our extension funds.
Upon reaching this goal, Dex will be made available on NVidia Shield about 2-3 months from the initial PC/MAC/Linux/OUYA release. All backers eligible for game download (£7 and above) will have the option of choosing the NVidia Shield version.
Localization of in-game texts (mainly GUI and dialogues), done by professional translators and native-speaking proofreaders and editors, in German and French.
A whole new mission to take place on an island outside the borders of Harbor Prime will be added and organically melded into the game. Will you hack your way through or turn the island into a hell on Earth with firearms and explosives? Includes a whole new map, sized several vertical by several horizontal screens, with unique sprites and art, multiple solutions and paths!
Localization of in-game texts (mainly GUI and dialogues), done by professional translators and native-speaking proofreaders and editors, in Spanish and Italian, plus one additional language based upon a poll of our backers.
One of our two “open-world/sandbox” game extensions, Fighting Club will be a place where you can, well, fight... as well as practice and join tournaments. The location will probably be connected to a side mission or two and may involve dirty practices and reveal aspects of the personal backgrounds of some of the characters in the storyline. Fighting Club will probably also be connected to some achievements (in-game as well as Steam achievements, if you are on Steam) and – perhaps – some RPG features as well.
Similar in concept to Fighting Club. A location where you can practice, shoot at targets, or perform various challenges. At the moment, we are considering an outdoor shooting range, beyond the city borders and an indoor one with sophisticated training drones. As with Fighting Club, we will connect the Shooting Range organically to the rest of the game, through characters and side missions.
A documentary (30+ minutes) about the development of Dex, including developer commentaries, notes, and behind-the-scenes stories and footage. Filmed by a professional camera crew over the course of development (starting with the end of Kickstarter campaign and ending with the release of the game), this short movie will be a “time-lapse exposure” of real people creating a game under indie conditions. The movie will be available for download to all Kickstarter backers eligible for the Deluxe Digital Edition and above.
At the moment, there are two major gangs in the city, which you are somehow involved with. When we reach the £55000 Stretch Goal, we will add a third gang to rule the streets and underground of Harbor Prime. This addition will include new locations, a new gang headquarters, a whole third gang, and an array of gang missions for you to undertake. We will also flesh out the gang hierarchy more: you can perform missions for the gang of your choice, become its member, and climb the gang leadership ladder, with specific gameplay and story impacts.
PS4 and Xbox One versions of Dex will be issued about 2-4 months from the initial release of the game. The funds will help us cover all license and legal fees and related development costs (programming, GUI, testing). All backers eligible for game download (£7 and above) will have the option of choosing the PS4/Xbox One version.
You can learn about our team members in one of our updates.
Windows: XP SP2 or later/ Vista / 7 / 8
Linux: Ubuntu 10.04 or later and compatible distributions – Arch Linux, Gentoo, Debian, and possibly others.
Mac: OS X "Snow Leopard" 10.6 or later.
Ouya
Regarding hardware requirements (for PCs): Graphics card with shader model 2.0 capabilities (DirectX or OpenGL, any ATi or NVidia card made since 2004 should work, or Intel cards with Occlusion Query support), 1 GB RAM, 8 GB disc space.
DAY-1 SIMULTANEOUS RELEASE FOR: 
Additional platforms and devices are possible, but will not be available immediately upon initial launch. 
DOUBLE OUR FUN(DS)!
We're participating in OUYA's #FreeTheGames Fund, created by OUYA to support developers making new and creative console games. OUYA will match your pledge dollar-for-dollar up to your goal amount (and a max of $250,000), so help us get there and make a great game for everyone! To be eligible for this match, we commit that this game will be an OUYA exclusive for a period of time. To learn more about OUYA, go to www.OUYA.tv. Note: the exclusivity applies only among consoles and does not affect Windows/Linux/Mac release! 
The game, upon release, will be simultaneously available for PC (Win, Linux), Mac, and OUYA.  
Backers eligible for game download will receive the game for the platform of their choice or will get a key to redeem it on Desura/Steam (again, provided we make it through Greenlight) or GOG (if possible).
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We are determined to complete the game. Without funds from Kickstarter, though, it will take a much longer development time and we will have to omit some features and content, especially material produced by external freelancers. 

Dex is already quite far along in development and is following a clear vision of what the game will be like when finished. The close of pre-alpha development (i.e. adding, subtracting, and experimenting with features and content) is scheduled for February 2014. This means we are nearing the feature-stop phase, but are maintaining flexibility for multiple possible Kickstarter outcomes (finance-wise) as well as for adjustments and ideas based on your input. 

Because game development is hard to predict, there may be delays in the original plan. Budget-wise, we plan to set aside a reserve fund to cover potential delays. Should our estimated workflow proceed as expected, the reserve will be used for free post-release updates, fixes, enhancements etc.; otherwise we are prepared for a possible longer development time. We will keep everyone updated to make sure you know what we are doing at every moment and which phase we are in.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

today is the day! We're excited to announce that the new Kickstarter campaign for Ghost Theory has just been launched! And it features a brand-new trailer! Check it out here: 
https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/dreadlocks/ghost-theory-a-serious-take-on-paranormal-research

Hey everyone!
It’s time for another update, and we have a few announcements to make!
First off, we’re happy to announce that the DRM-free version of Dex – Enhanced Version, is finally available on Humble Store, along with the free DLC Extra Outfits, essentially bringing it on a par with the Steam version. We’re sorry it took longer than expected, but we hope you’ll enjoy it!

Hey everyone! Dzień dobry! Ciao a tutti!
We’ve got great news for all our Polish and Italian backers, the Polish and the Italian localization will be available tomorrow – as a free update on Steam!
And we’d also like to give a shout-out to another Kickstarter campaign:

Hi cyberpunks!
We'd like to share some really exciting Kickstarter projects with you today!

And yes, they could make it so that you can't lower of cancel pledges at all, but I think that would cause more harm overall. And it's not hard to ensure your payment doesn't go through if someone really wanted to take that route. Ultimately, just like pirates, people can always get around any deterrents that are put into place, and those deterrents end up only hurting the vast majority of legit backers/buyers.

@foducool: I like the idea of being able to punish the trolls, but it is a very difficult thing to do without making things more difficult for everyone else. It's like going after pirates with legal action; how do the game developers/publishers know the full circumstances? I have several times purchased legal copies of games, only to be unable to install them due to DRM, and had no choice but to download the pirated copy in order to use the product I paid for, and I know I'm not alone. In a similar way, it is very difficult to know 100% that someone is trolling a kickstarter, even if they drop their pledge. The circumstantial evidence may be quite strong, but I'm not sure how kickstarter could address this without changing the philosophy of kickstarter, and therefore make things worse for the >99% of us who aren't trolls. I guess it's the old freedom vs. safety/control debate, and I always err on the side of freedom, very strongly in most cases.

Story:
Elliot can’t die--but he’s still running out of time. In Elliot Quest, the victim of a rare curse must find a cure before he’s transformed into a demon.
After Elliot’s wife disappears, he falls sick and attempts to take his own life--only to discovers that he can’t die. Plagued by nightmares and growing weaker by the day, Elliot seeks out a local Sage, who tells him that he’s the victim of a rare curse. A demon called a Satar is slowly consuming Elliot’s vitality.
If Elliot can’t find a cure for the curse before it’s too late, he will become a Satar himself. His only hope is to ask for the help from one of the island’s Guardians, who have kept the Satar from taking over Urele. Elliot can’t die--but he’s still running out of time.

Hey everyone:
It's been a few months since the last update, so we wanted to let you know what's been happening. First, we decided to push back the Elliot Quest release date a few months in order to polish the game--adding new art for the sidequest areas, designing a few more enemies, and balancing the gameplay based on Beta tester feedback. We're really happy with our progress and will keep you posted on our progress. In the mean time, Michael Chait is working on a few new tracks, Danny Homan has been revising the story, and Tim Kelly is hard at work on the printed art for Kickstarter.

Hey Backers:
Danny Homan here--the writer for Elliot Quest. Now that the game is in beta and on its way to being released, I’d like to tell you a bit more about the plot and the island of Urele (spoilers free).
As you probably already know, Elliot is a guy with nothing left to lose. He lives on the small island called Urele that hardly anyone else lives on anymore. His wife Cara has been missing for so long that Elliot has assumed she’s dead. Suddenly, he’s struck by a strange, terrible illness, and he doesn’t know what’s wrong. When he finds the answer, he tries to take his own life--only to discover that he can’t die. Worse still, he’s the victim of a curse--from a demonic creature he thought was just a fairy tale...and if that weren’t bad enough, this demon has chosen him as its next vessel--if he doesn’t do something, it will consume his soul.

campaign.story:
"great potential...elegant graphics" - Digispun
What is Heroes of Issachar?
Heroes of Issachar is a faith-based game set in a fantasy world where you are tasked with rebuilding a kingdom ravaged by evil forces.  Go on epic quests, interact with the various kingdoms of the land, and rebuild the castle in anticipation of a final showdown.
Heroes of Issachar takes the action role-playing genre and meshes it with an in-depth, castle building sim.  You take the role of a wandering hero who agrees to help the people of Issachar rebuild and defend their castle.  In order to do this, you must quest to recover the kingdom's people who have been taken by the forces of evil.  Along the way you will recover resources to use in rebuilding the kingdom.  Between the people and resources you recover, you decide how to rebuild the kingdom to suit your gameplay style.  Decide whether to build military might, or castle defenses, or restore the kingdom economy, or a variety and combination of other options.
Along the way, you will interact with the diverse people of the land.  Befriend one kingdom and they may unlock valuable items, skills, or technology for you, but that may provoke another to become hostile toward your efforts.  One kingdom may be adept at magic, while another has technology that could turn the tide of battle.  Which side will you seek to aid your cause?
Faith Based Game
The backstory of Heroes of Issachar comes from the Bible and the gospel of Jesus.  Throughout the course of the game, the hero will recover lost pieces of the Bible.  From the beginning of the story to the end, the gospel is revealed to the player through the scripture that is recovered.  
Action RPG
The game is played from a third-person perspective.  The hero will have a variety of melee attacks, ranged attacks and spells, which you will unlock and develop throughout the game.  You will also be able to develop talents that will affect how you interact with the environment.  Develop your trap detection ability so that you avoid a fatal fall in a dungeon, or develop your herbalist skills so you can turn the Joruga Root you find in the wilderness into a healing potion.
Besides controlling the main hero, you will gain companions along the way.  These hero NPC's will quest and fight alongside the hero throughout the game.  These NPC's have their own abilities, talents and equipment.  They gain their own experience and you choose how they progress throughout the game.
Castle Builder
As you explore the open-world of Heroes of Issachar, you will recover resources for the kingdom.  You can use these resources as you see fit to rebuild the kingdom.  Set the boundaries of the castle with walls, dig moats, build one of many types of defensive towers and design chokepoints for incoming attackers.  But don't neglect the economy of the kingdom; build woodcutter houses to gather wood and mills to increase its yield so that you can build the kingdom more efficiently.  Of course, there is also the need for a strong military, so build a warrior's guild to upgrade you and your companion's fighting abilities, or build a blacksmith to upgrade your weapons.  
You choose how to develop the kingdom; no one way is correct.  In the end, all that matters is you survive.
Other Features
Weapon and Armor Customization
Players will be able to craft their weapons as they buy, find or make their parts.  Craft a sword or axe, then upgrade it if you find a new hilt, handle, or axehead.  Customize armor with engravings; different engravings give different upgrades.
Castle Assault
You are not only on the defensive.  Take part in massive tug of war style castle assaults to take down enemy strongholds.
Castle Economy
You not only build the buildings, but you also help manage the workforce.  You decide whether there should be townspeople working in the ore mine, or whether they are needed at the quarry.
Open World
The land is vast, filled with interesting and diverse people.  To the northeast, the people have shunned magic in favor of cogs, steam engines and the rest of their technology, while the snowy mountain dwellers place their trust in the steel of their swords.  The seafaring colony of pirates may offer to help, but can they be trusted?  Any of them can be courted, but you must decide who to befriend and who battle.
When will Heroes of Issachar be released?
We have targeted the holiday season of 2014 for our release date.  At this time, our release platforms will be OUYA, PC, Mac and Linux.
Who is Saved Games?
We are an indie studio dedicated to making fun, high quality video games.  We have successfully completed a number of projects in the mobile space and are excited to be developing for PC and console gamers with Heroes of Issachar.  
We are coming to kickstarter to get this game to its full potential.  We have the vision and the plan, but we need the resources to make it happen.
Budget Breakdown
30% - Art
20% - Coding
15% - Marketing
15% - Sound
15% - Givebacks / Kickstarter Fees
5% - Licenses
Free the Games Fund
Double Our Fun(ds)!

We're participating in OUYA's #FreeTheGames Fund, created by OUYA to support developers making new and creative console games. OUYA will match your pledge dollar-for-dollar up to your goal amount (and a max of $250,000), so help us get there and make a great game for everyone! To be eligible for this match, we commit that this game will be an OUYA exclusive for a period of time. To learn more about OUYA, go to www.OUYA.tv.

Please note that the PC, Mac and Linux versions of this game are not subject to the exclusivity, so they will be available on the same date as the OUYA version.
A note about our givebacks that involve designing elements to the game:  This is a faith-based game.  While we clearly have an open mind about what to include in this game, there are limits.  Anything that goes into the game must not go against our faith or morals, and must also fit in the overall story and style of the game.  If you have a question about whether an idea you have would work, reach out to us before pledging so we can discuss it.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Heroes of Issachar is an ambitious project. We are blending an Action RPG and a detailed Castle Builder into one game. Beyond that we have an incredible story we are developing for the game. Although the scope of this game is large, we are dedicated to making it happen. This game is not in the pen and paper stage; we have already developed some of the core modules for the game. As with any video game, the biggest risk is that the project will run past the target release date. But getting funded through kickstarter will help us avoid that problem. In the end, we will not let the difficulty of what we are doing deter us from getting this project finished.

Concept Art by John Giang
  Zecta Wars chronicles the adventures of a special ops team in a futuristic world on the brink of war. After barely surviving the explosive destruction of a remote island during a mission, they are assigned to guard their nation’s hive capitol during a peace summit. As the summit proceeds, a mysterious enemy emerges and launches a large scale assault that threatens stability on the planet Zecta. Who is this new mysterious enemy? How will the special ops team deal with this crisis? Fund Zecta Wars to find out!
 Your funds will go towards the following:
Coloring
Lettering
Cover Art
Printing
We have 4 issues, which comes out to 88 pages of inked art completed by artist Jheremy Raapack, who is currently signed to DC Comics. The Kickstarter would provide the funding to lock in the cover artist, colorist and letterer for 4 months to guarantee completion of the series and printing of the graphic novel.
Concept Art by John Giang
If there are changes to the delivery timeline below, backers will be notified promptly.

Convention Preview Book (digital) 
January 2014
Issue 1 (digital)
February 2014
Issue 2 (digital)
March 2014
Issue 3 (digital)
April 2014
Issue 4 (digital)
July 2014 - Physical Rewards
Graphic Novel
3D Printed Mech Bug
3D Printed Trophy
T-Shirt
Posters
Convention Preview Book
Martin Robaszewski – creator and writer
Martin Robaszewski is a professional video game developer by day and a super nerd by night!  He's worked on games for SEGA, Epic Games, Ubisoft, Atari and the US Army among others.  He can also be found in the deleted scenes of a Hollywood movie.  Having been a comic book fan longer than he can remember, Zecta Wars is the realization of his lifelong dream of making a comic book.  Major influences growing up were GI Joe, Transformers, Robotech, Appleseed, Akira, and anything & everything cyberpunk.  Currently he's reading Neuromancer (again).
Jheremy Raapack – interior artist
Jheremy Raapack has taken comics seriously since childhood.  The grandson of Polish immigrants to Brazil, Jheremy spent his teenage years sending samples to various comics companies while he pursued his formal studies.  Working for small studios until 2008, he began working on the Marvel titles X-men vs Hulk, Hulk Smash and Skaar: Son of Hulk.  Since then, He's also worked on several DC comics and Wildstorm books including Wildcats, Authority, Resident Evil, Batman: Arkhan Unhinged, Batman Legend of the Dark Knight, World of Warcraft: Bloodsworn and Injustice Gods Among Us. (http://raapack.deviantart.com)
John Giang – cover and concept artist
John is an acclaimed Concept Artist, Art Director, and Illustrator who's artistry has touched everything from comic art to fortune 500 company graphic design to major motion picture films. Giang's personal art style is a beautiful fusion of his many influences: Renaissance art, American Illustrators, Graffiti and Street, Manga, American Comicbook art, Modern art, and Film. Some of John's concept art has contributed to designs by Lego, Platinum Studios, Stan Lee's POW Entertainment, ImagineFX, and here in the pages of Zecta Wars. Currently a staff artist at Industrial Light and Magic, some of John's film credits include: Pacific Rim, The Avengers, Transformers Dark of the Moon, Iron Man 1 and 2, Rango, and Star Trek just to name a few. Check out more of his work in the pages of many of these film's art of books, and online: www.orbitalharvest.com and www.facebook.com/john.giang.fanpage. 
Rex Lokus - colorist
Rex Lokus has been working in the comic industry for more than 6 years. He has been hired by companies such as Marvel, DC Comics, Les Humanoïndes Associés, Capstone, Wizuale. Some of his past projects as a colorist are: Deus Ex Human Revolution, DC Universe Online Legends, Looker, Legends of the Dark Knight, The Incredible Hulk, Uncanny X-Men, Arrow, Ultimate Comics X-Men, Scarlet Spider, Spider Woman. (http://rexlokus.deviantart.com)
[ TEST SUBJECT] Zecta Wars Issue 1 PDF + Convention Preview PDF

Hello again Kickstarter!

   For those of you who do not know me I am Tre Manor, the owner and sculptor of Red Box Games Miniatures. I have been in the business of making miniatures since late 2006. I founded my own company Red Box Games in late 2008 and I have been making my own products ever since. I recently ran a KS campaign in the hope to begin a new line of products cast in a spin cast resin material. That effort unfortunately did not work out positively and now I find myself trying to pick up the pieces and try again to move my business forward in a more positive direction. 
    I am setting upon the production of new product and HOPEFULLY the development of the world and rules set AND the set up of in house metal casting! To help make this happen I have set out to expand as many of the existing RBG ranges as possible. I have many concepts to work with and a thirst to succeed and expand to fuel the roaring engine of productivity and creativity that I know I can be.. As of now I have a set of 8 goblin footmen that are nearly finished and will be sent to the moldmaker in the next week. Beyond these I also have 3 goblin wolf riders underway that will be sent off for molding along with the goblin footies. To oppose the tricksome savages I have 6 modular Dwarven footmen under way as well which should be ready for the moldmaker very soon as well. Beyond those I have plans for Modular Orcs, Modular Elf footmen, Modular Norsemen, and a slew of new Heroes and Villains. In addition to the ranks figures offered through the funding of the kickstarter campaign, selections from the back catalogue of Red Box Games figures are also available as selections for pledge reward options. These figures are available from the beginning of the campaign. At the end of the campaign you will be asked to list ( by title and quantity ) the back catalogue ranks you would like added to your rewards. All ranks items are cast in metal unless otherwise specified below the rank selection picture. Each picture below depicts the contents of ONE rank selection.
  Runty Goblins....... 9 single part metal cast figures ( 6 spearmen, 3 archers ) supplied with 9 20 mm round bases.
 Runty Goblin Archers...... 9 single part metal cast figures ( 3 sets of the 3 archers ) supplied with 9 20 mm round bases.
   GOBLIN BONEBACKS A........ 8 multi-part metal cast figures ( 8 unique figures and 8 weapon options. ) supplied with 8 25 mm round bases.
   DIRE WOLVES.......... 2 sets of 3 multi-part resin cast figures ( 3 unique bodies with 3 heads options x 2 ) supplied with 6 40 mm round bases.
   TROLL BROTHERS...... One resin cast single part figure and one resin cast multi-part figure ( troll figure and tree bole club. ) supplied with 2 40 mm round bases.
  AENGLISH WATCHMEN A.......... 4 metal cast multi-part figures ( 4 bodies, 4 heads options, 4 weapons options, 4 shields options. ) supplied with 4 25 mm round bases.
   DVERGR BRYNJAR A.........6 single part metal cast figures supplied with 6 20 mm round bases.
  DVERGR BRYNJAR B..........6 single part metal cast figures supplied with 6 20 mm round bases.
   YMIR'S BAND..........6 single part metal cast figures and 3 multi-part metal cast figures ( 1 body x3, 3 head options, 3 weapon options. ) supplied with 9 20 mm round bases.
INFERNAL HORRORS......... 3 metal cast single part figures supplied with 3 25 mm round bases and 1 resin cast single part figure supplied with 40 mm round base.
   LESSER UNDEAD A............9 METAL cast single part figures supplied with 9 20 mm round bases.
WRAITH KNIGHTS A ............. 6 metal cast multipart figures ( 6 bodies and 6 weapon options. ) supplied with 6 25 mm round bases.
  NETHER BEAST............ 1 multi-part ( body and left arm ) resin cast figure x 2 supplied with 2 40 mm round bases.
HOW THIS WORKS
Your pledge corresponds to a specific reward level. Each reward level includes ranks ONLY. Any Hero selections must be added to your existing pledge by managing the amount pledged to include the added cost of the hero model. Unless otherwise specified each hero model costs $7.00.
 Each goal product is described in it's funding pitch as either a hero, or a Rank set.
When a funding goal is reached the goal product then becomes available for selection as a reward for your contribution. 
If you wish, you can add to your pledge to buy additional Ranks not covered by your selected reward level. Unless otherwise specified each rank set costs $20.00 individually.

RANKS ARE NOT INTERCHANGEABLE FOR HEROES AND VICE VERSA.
So as an example if Johnny has pledged $125.00 he can select up to 6 ranks. If he would like to add a hero to his pledge reward then he will need to increase his pledge amount by $7.00 per hero. This dollar amount does not change his reward selection level. So if Johnny adds 4 heroes to his pledge amount his reward level selection DOES NOT change from sexa to atta. Heros are entirely separate from Ranks selections.
If Johnny has pledged $125.00 and wants to add to his pledge to gain another rank selection his reward selection CAN BE changed to the next level up but he must remember to do so to avoid confusion. By doing so he does not need to spend the full $25 to gain a new rank. He only needs to add $15 to add the next rank. 
    ALL FIGURES ARE METAL unless specifically stated otherwise in their discription picture.
   SHIPPING............
   Shipping costs are not included in the pledge amounts. Backers will need to pay the shipping costs at the time shipment is ready to be made. To help move things further along I will set up a wave release schedule which will allow backers ( if they so choose ) to pay for the shipment of their pledge rewards in phases as each new item clears production or is stocked. If the backer does not wish to pay multiple shipping charges then their entire order can be shipped all in one shipment when all product is in hand. I will not be setting items aside to fill orders however. All items will be shipped first come first served.
  This way you will not be sat waiting for months for ALL of your pledge rewards to be produced and in hand. You will receive notification through a Kickstarter update that a particular wave of items is stocked to then be directed offsite to the Red Box Games store to pay the shipping for that wave of items. Your order will be processed and shipped first come first served and your KS rewards list will be noted accordingly. 
 You must pay shipping before your reward can be processed.
   SHIPPING COSTS...........
As far as the costs of shipping are concerned I will always try to keep the costs as low as possible. I do not seek to profit from shipping and handling. I want to get your product to you as quickly, and efficiently and cheaply as possible. I cannot accurately estimate shipping costs as we are dealing with worldwide shipping and with highly variable weights BUT I do have a general idea of how much each package will cost based on the number of figures contained there in. Please remember also that this I am basing this estimate on HUMAN sized METAL figures. Smaller figures will obviously weigh less per figure and will lower the postage cost while larger metal figures will weigh more and affect the costs accordingly. Resin figures will also weigh much less and in turn cost less to ship as well.
   The following is an APPROXIMATE break down of the possible shipping costs. This is in no way a guarantee of actual costs.
# of figures.....     US......         International
    1-10..................$3.....................$8
   11-25...................$4...................$10
   26-45...................$5....................$10-15
   46-65..................$8....................$15-20
   66-85..................$10...................$20-25
   86-100................$10..................$25-30
  101-150...............$12..................$30-35
  151-200................$15.................$35-40
   Please note that this is NOT a guarantee of postage costs. Some packages will cost less that listed above and some will cost more. This is just an estimate of possibilites.
FULFILLMENT......................
   Some of the figures offered as rewards for this campaign are already in production or are already in stock. Any production needed to fulfill the rewards for this campaign will be handled by my current production partners all of whom have decades of professional experience and proven track records for delivery. I work with three separate services to further distribute the work load so as to insure timely delivery and reliable product quality. Each of these services have decades of experience in the industry and whose work credits include some of the biggest industry names ( which unfortunately I am afraid to actually credit for legal reasons ). 
  Beyond the development of the new product there will be VERY LITTLE wait for the delivery of your rewards beyond the normal amount of time needed to produce, ship, sort, package, label, and ship the items on a first come first served basis. The process of fulfillment will begin immediately upon clearance of the kickstarter reward survey, which I will have in development as the KS progresses to avoid a delay between the clearance of payment and the issue of the survey. 
  Typically when I put in an order for metal castings with any of my production partners I have a 1 to 2 week waiting period for delivery, sometimes 3 depending on the partner's schedule and the amount ordered. To make this run smoother I have already begun adding to my standard product stockpile and will be ordering more throughout the development of the campaign based on the demand generated. Resin castings can take a bit longer than that but my resin production partner has developed a new system which speeds up the process a bit, and being that there are very few resin parts on offer this will only be a very slight hold up in the delivery time. 
   All molds for back catalogue product are made, tested and working properly. The partners which I am working with are ready, willing, and able. This fulfillment WILL SUCCEED as promised.
   The production of the new product funded through this campaign will be handled by these three different services and all KS rewards stock will be produced by these companies to insure timely and reliable delivery. I will only take over production in house once I am set up and reliably experienced with the rigors of production and can assure 100% acceptable levels of quality as per my usual standards.
The Plan.........
 It is my plan to use the money earned in this kickstarter campaign to first pay for the production costs of all new product funded throughout this kickstarter effort and to deliver on the rewards selected by backers, and second to buy the equipment and materials to cast my figures in metal in house. Any further funds will be used in the effort of having older molds replaced with new molds ( made by the BEST mold makers in the industry! ) and also in the development of the RBG fantasy campaign setting and rules book that I have been wanting to develop for years. The major hurtles I have had to surmount over the years of operating Red Box Games has been the expense and logistics of contract casting. I have had the privilege of working with some of the most talented mold makers and casters in the business and my metal product has always had the reputation for very high quality as a result of the working relationships that I have built over the years. Now I feel that it is time to move my business forward in a positive direction by building my own in house casting operations. This will allow me to better manage my costs of manufacturing and will also allow me to more closely maintain the logistics of the operation insuring faster delivery times and constant, reliably maintained stock levels in every part offered in the store. Despite the premise of my first kickstarter effort I have learned that the best way to manage the costs of this kind of business is to use metal and to handle as much of the production myself as is humanly possible.
  AS always I thank everyone for their continued support and interest in the growth of the Red Box Games fantasy miniatures line. It is a dream come true to do what I do and the ultimate joy to see my work enjoyed by so many people. Thank you all. You are all dearly appreciated.
  Sincerely,
  Tre Manor - Red Box Games

The only risk I can foresee would be a delay in delivery of the full amount of product due to work load if the amount of product ordered is incredibly high. campaign.story:
WHO IS RON JOCKMAN?
My name is Ron Jockman. I am certainly not the greatest Science Fiction author there ever was, but I'm very close to the top of the list. Why? It's because of the story I have to tell. Also, I'm a damned good author.
My book series is about the Universe's greatest hero: John Rockman. Enemies fear him, friends like him, and women want him.
WHO IS THE REAL RON JOCKMAN?
Ok, here's the deal: Ron Jockman is a fictional author. He was created by myself, Justin Lucas, and my twin brother Mitchell Lucas as a satirical representation of many Science Fiction and Fantasy authors that live vicariously through their heroes and inject their ridiculous philosophies into their work. He is socially inept, selfish, misogynistic, opinionated, and an awful writer.
Several years ago we wrote a science fiction short story, it was purposely generic and absolutely ridiculous. It broke just about every rule we could think of that an author is supposed to follow. I distinctly remember crying from laughter at what we were putting into that short story. Later, it would become something much larger.
WHAT ARE THE ROCKMAN CHRONICLES?
The Rockman Chronicles is a Satirical Science Fiction Adventure book trilogy currently being written by myself, Justin Lucas, and my brother, Mitchell Lucas, in which the heroic (and hairy) John Rockman must inspire hope, save innocent people, and kill bad guys. . . the catch is, it is written through an idiotic author character we created named Ron Jockman. The story itself is not the satire, it's the author behind the work.
We are avid Science Fiction and Fantasy fans which is why we wrote this story. We have noticed certain authors, who shall remain nameless, like to use the main characters of their novels as beautified versions of themselves. The main character is almost worshiped by the supporting characters that surround him, as they agree with his ridiculous opinions, listen in awe at his obscure philosophies, or utterly respect his bizarre fetishes. This is exactly what we exploit.
In The Rockman Chronicles, we write what makes us laugh. Some of the time we don't know why we laugh at the things we type, we just find this stuff funny, and we hope you will, too.
Here is a sample chapter from John Rockman and the Trials of Galactar by the Prince of Galactar to get an idea of what type of story we wish to tell:
Sample Chapter: A Virtual Danger
We love to conceptualize and develop. We are creators. Together, with our talents, my brother and I try to make just about everything ourselves. Here, check out the trailers we did for the first two eBooks:
HOW MUCH WORK IS LEFT?
The first book in the trilogy, John Rockman and the Trials of Galactar by the Prince of Galactar was released last year, the second book, John Rockman and the Cosmic Brain of Corruption, is about half done, and work on John Rockman and the Keys of the Void has not yet begun. So the entire project is about at the mid-way mark.
WHERE WILL THE FUNDS GO?
The funds will be used for finishing, editing, production, delivery and advertising. Simple right?
We want to be able to get these books out to the people. We don't currently have the means to get the books to the quality we think they deserve. It may be a purposely-bad book, but we don't desire a purposely-bad product. We take a lot of care in the words we choose even if it doesn't seem that way, and we want to make some quality products for the people that enjoy them.
THE REWARDS
