campaign.story:
WHAT'S THIS ALL ABOUT??

  Many of you very generously supported my previous Kickstarter campaign which is delivering as I type and the reactions to the effort have been incredible. Now I am set to finish the transition from metal to plastic for the rest of the RBG line. This is still a VERY significant investment and not something that I can afford without your support. It is my intention to offer the entirety of the RBG line a material that I can price to bring RBG figures to every gamer's table in the hobby. It is further my goal to expand RBG to encompass more of the Traditional Old School Fantasy Spectrum. I want to produce, Characters, Monsters, and even Terrain! I can do this with your help. The HelsVakt kickstarter was a great step in the right direction and with your help and support we can make this Kickstarter into something huge! 

  We are beginning with the goblins by popular demand but I have a LOT of stuff to retool and I will be taking every comment and request under consideration as the campaign progresses. It is my plan to move on to the Dvergr or the Aenglish after the goblins are retooled, hopefully there will be enough time in this campaign to make that happen but that is all up to you!

 HOW THIS WORKS
Your pledge corresponds to a specific reward level. Thus far the rewards for this campaign are structured by dividing the different goal products into Solos, Lesser Ranks, and Special Ranks. Each goal product is described in it's funding pitch as either a Solo option, lesser rank option or Special rank option. When a funding goal is reached the goal product then becomes available for selection as a reward for your contribution. So for instance up to the $15,000.00 funding mark if you pledge to the Raiding Party level you can choose 2 " ranks " of spear men ( 12 models in each set ) and 3 sets of  archers, after the $15,000.00 mark you can choose either the spear men or the footmen or both to fulfill your lesser ranks selection.

    If you wish, you can add to your pledge to buy additional ranks or solos not covered by your pledge. The values for each are as follows;
    SOLO .............................$5.00
    LESSER RANKS...........$25.00
    SPECIAL RANKS.........$35.00
     THE STORY
  So here we find ourselves....Stalking the root twisted floor of the Dokk Wolds. Bent low beneath the wicked reaching bones of the gnarly oaks aged and weathered. The day long passed into night. The moon high but barely more than a ghost shrouded by heavy clouds bearing low the first snows of the winter. The chill wind whips about our cloaked forms bitter and spiteful. Our breath spirited a-fright, our steps furtive, our hands be-gripped the hilt of sword and axe and hammer. Hung from our weary shoulders our shields ragged and gouged bear the story of the melee that drove us from the road and harrowed us by day to this cursed knot. Our ears wide and listening, fooled at every crack of twig under foot or creak of barren branch. Fools! Our hunters will make no such warnings to us! It is our eyes narrowed and keenly watching and our wits clear and calm that will find the watchers in the shadows now awaiting our strength to sap and our will to break. They, our would be death, the creeping, fanged, feral bastards of the Wild God, Great Horned Bas. Scampering little devils so gleefully cruel,  what for the mad blood thirst of their degenerate Gods drives them so.

 It is no matter. We must steel ourselves to live another day. Limber your arms fellows, for death awaits us on point of rusty spear and barbed arrow, and looted sword and sax. Pray you fervently that those vicious hulks, sharp bones through their skins and drugged stupor in their eyes, do not walk amoungst them.........For if they do, then this day we are surely lost.......Odin's Breath be strong brothers....
 THE FIGURES
 DIRE WOLVES!!!
 Nigh the size of a man and beset the ravenous hunger of the great wolf god himself the Dire Wolves race through tangled wood and over open ground with equal ferocity slathering jaws agape to rip and rend the flesh of their prey, man and beast alike it matters not when the Howling God leads the way.. Summoned forth from the deepest primordial wilds they serve the will of Fenris only!
Add the Dire wolves to your pledge for an additional $15.00 per set of three. Or $25.00 per set of six. The Dire wolves are NOT considered a lesser or special ranks selection. These are a separate item all together. The Dire Wolves are modularly fitted for universally interchangeable heads and are supplied with 40mm round bases.
LESSER RANKS SELECTION
 RUNTY GOB SPEARMEN!!!!  FUNDED!!!!
Feral, vicious, and swarming the goblin hordes inhabit the deepest darkest of forests only venturing out in search of pillage and plunder. Small as they may be they are dangerous and devious! The most commonly encountered goblins are the runty gob spearmen and archers. Though small and lightly armed these goblins are no laughing matter for they are cunning and vicious and often employ wicked poisons and devious traps or ambush.

  Goblins are pictured on 20 mm bases

  SOLO OPTION
  RUNTY GOB ARCHERS!!!
 Upon reaching our goal of $5,000.00 the runty gobs will be made available as a selectable option. The Spearmen are selectable as lesser ranks option with each rank consisting of 2 sets of the 6 figures pictured above in each rank. The Archers are available together as a solo option with all three figures pictured above counting as 1 solo option.
STRETCH GOAL # 2 $12,500.00
    LESSER RANKS SELECTION 
   RUNTY GOB FOOTMEN!!!!! FUNDED!!!!
   All new and ready for battle the runty goblin footmen. These are the honoured warriors of goblin kind. Earning the spoils of victory by strength of arm, or skill in battle these goblins bear the arms of fallen dwarves, men and even elves. They are not as cowardly as most goblins and are usually smarter as well. A formidable force that NO goblin warband can be without!

  These figures are available as a themed set titled " Runty Gob Footmen " Each set includes 12 footmen figures and 3 weapon sprues. Each footman is modularly fitted for universally interchangeable hand weapon options.  The goblins here are pictured still WIP on 20 mm round bases. and are available as a lesser rank option upon funding.
STRETCH GOAL # 3 $15,000.00 ..............FUNDED!!!
DOG'SBANE!!! Cruel and devious Dog's bane has clawed, kicked, bitten, stabbed, poisoned, burned, smashed, drowned, bashed and speared his way to the top of the long howlers' spearmen. Under his snarling barks the Runty gob spearmen don't dare turn tail and run, unless Dog's Bane does first! ( pictured here on a 20 mm base )
BLACK TONGUE!!!
foot cheiftan of the Long Howler's Gnawed Leg clan. Unique amoungst his kind Black Tongue fights with more of what could pass for courage than most other goblins. He fights with skill and cunning and puts great effort to make an impression upon friend and foe alike for his cruelty and ruthlessness.
STRETCH GOAL # 4-5 $ 18,000.00 -$21,000.00 - $25,000.00
 SPECIAL RANKS SELECTION 
   GOBLIN BONEBACKS!!!
   Brutal, Fearless, and dumb as a sack of rocks these goblin Brutes are the biggest, meanest, and most dangerous goblin kind to rage out of the Black Woods. Battle mad and usually drugged stupid with rotted poisonous mushrooms the Bonebacks fling themselves into the thick of battle without the slightest regard for themselves and no other intent but bathing in the blood of anything that happens to get too close be they friend or foe. It is their implaccability that makes them so incredibly dangerous. They do not turn and flee and they do not flinch at even horrible pain. ( pictured here on 25 mm bases. )

The goblin bonebacks are modularly fitted for universally interchangeable weapons. The weapon options to be included in each set will be 2 cleavers, 2 swords, 2 clubs, 2 small axes, 2 large axes, 2 maces, and 2 hammers( all cast in metal. The Bonebacks are available as a special rank set option upon funding . The first set of 4 will unlock at $18,000.00 and the second set of 4 will unlock at $21,000.00. Then the final set of 4 will unlock at $25,000.00. If the final total of the KS campaign does not go above $18,000.00 then you will receive 3 sets of the first 4 models to complete the ranks selection for the Bonebacks. If the final amoutn does nto go over $21,000.00 you will receive two sets of the first set of four and 1 set of the second set of four. But if the final amount DOES go above the $25,000.00 mark then you will receive 12 unique boneback figures to complete the bonebacks rank.

      Stretch goal # 6 $35,000.00
    SPECIAL RANKS SELECTION 
    RUNTY GOBS WOLFRIDERS!!!
    The most honoured amoungst the Long Howlers tribe are the Wolf Riders. Famed through out all the goblin tribes these goblins are part warrior and part shaman sharing a spiritual bond with the beasts on whose backs they ride terrifying into battle. Combining the strength , agility, and speed of the wolves with the devious combat prowess of the goblin and some slight shaman magic as well the goblin wolfriders are a force to feared by any whose path they cross. Whether armed with bow, blade, or spear the Wolf riders make any goblin force an army of merit. These figures are available as a special rank set titled " Wolf Riders A. " each set includes 4 wolves and 4 hand weapon riders options and 1 sprue of weapons. The riders are fitted for universally interchangeable hand weapons.
STRETCH GOAL  # 7 $45,000.00
 SPECIAL RANKS SELECTION 
   THE TROLL BROTHERS!!!
Nothing strikes fear into the hearts of the Northlanders and goblins a-like as do the long shadow of the great Troll Kind. Often keeping to the deepest caves and forest valleys the Troll Kind only venture into the lands of the Dvergr or Njorn or Aenglish for plunder or revenge, but sometimes they ally with their lesser cousins the goblin kind at behest or fear of great magick. Just such is the story of the Troll Brothers. Strong enough to throw huge stones over castle ramparts Rocklobber is a name feared far and wide, while Hogsquasher's legendary gleeful cruelty and ferocity has stopped many a great hero in their tracks on hearing the name of this great beast. Add the Troll Brothers to your existing pledge as 1 special rank set. ( Pictured here on 40 mm bases )
STRETCH GOAL # 8 $50,000.00
    INDIVIDUAL HERO SELECTION
   CROWBITER!!! 
   Older than any living goblin can remember, more crazed than any shaman to boil the red mushrooms before him, and more wicked than even the Old Horned One himself, it is Crowbiter who leads the Long Howlers more so than that fat, stupid, slathering oaf Horsebane, but a cunning leader is he who pretends to serve another. By Crowbiter's magicks have many a battle turned in favour of the fanged kin, and it was by Crowbiter's powers and persuasion that the great Troll Brothers first sat  at the Stone Circle to feast with the Long Howlers on the Dwarves of Garmingen's Fort. By his magicks do the dire wolves howl and heel, and by his will do the Long Howlers kill and steal.

  Crowbiter will be available as a singular solo option upon funding.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I have been operating Red Box Games for 5 years now. In that time I have developed a reputation for prompt, personal service and reliability. I work very very hard to insure that every customer is HAPPY with their order and the service provided to see it to them. I know what it takes to make a miniature work for production and shipment and to also work for the general use of gaming and painting. Almost every one of the miniatures proposed for production in this Kickstarter are already ready for production. At this point all that is left is for them to be remolded and cast in a new material. The only challenge involved here is in the productive capacity of the mold maker / caster and any difficulty encountered there will be resolved as it arises by hiring on new help to create the manpower necessary to deliver the product as advertised and on time. Troll's forge is a very well established and reliable service and is dedicated to seeing this effort through to it's greatest success.

Beyond that only the fulfillment effort on my end would be any other foreseeable challenge, which will be fixed with the hiring of a full time employee if this campaign funds as I hope it will.

 I am now in the process of delivering on my recently successful Kickstarter project. The delivery is behind schedule ( originally intended for October of 2012 ) but is now in the final stages of fulfillment. We encountered set backs of varying nature through out the production process but have since made the necessary corrections and have learned how to avoid them on future works. Primarily I was just too optimistic in my expectation for the length of time needed to deliver on the project. Ed and I have conferred extensively on this matter and we have decided on a much more realistic delivery date for this next Kickstarter campaign.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hey Y'all,
   Well after a great deal of very careful consideration I will be cancelling this KS campaign today. The reason being that we will not make the funding neccessary for the bonebacks and wolf riders and based on most of the private messages I have received and the forum posts and comments I have read those two items are the most desired rewards. I choose rather to be sure that you guys have the items that you actually want than to force you to pay for items that you do not. Believe me it is NOT easy doing this. 

   My plan from here is to finish two of the wolf riders and concept or finish a wolf rider hero. I will then relaunch the campaign with the first goal covering 6 of the footmen, 6 of the bonebacks, and 2 wolf riders. After that the stretch goals will be spaced apart by $5,000.00 to insure that we regularly achieve to finish filling out the goblin horde. I will also be structuring the rewards in such a way that no one is pledging toward options that do not yet exist so as to avoid the problems we have had here.

  Do not worry about the delivery time slipping. I have spoken with Ed and have confirmation that we can keep that date. He understands my reasoning and has confidence in the potential. Further the Relaunch will only be about 1 or 2 weeks away from now. In that time I am going to work very hard to get all the bells and whistles in place for the next campaign to be sure that it is as clear as possible.

Well, here I am again..... We have now slipped below the $15,000.00 mark and I think we will probabyl begin to slip even further still rather than bouncing upward. So I am thinking that in the best interests of you guys it might be best to kill this campaign and relaunch with a different sequence of figures, prioritizing the Footmen, Wolf Riders, and BoneBacks in that order as that seems to be the most wanted sets out of this campaign.

campaign.story:
UPDATE
Funding successful! Thanks to everyone who made this a possibility. There are still a few days left to go. Any additional money raised will go recouping the payment for the first half of the pencils and for the coloring.
I sent off the first few pages to a handful of publishers late last week, so fingers crossed.
Black Lotus Empire is a 12 issue, full-color comic book series that explores what life might be like in China almost 100 years from now.  In BLE, China is now the sole economic and military superpower in the world, and the government frequently engages in intimidation, violence, and control of information to keep the people in line. But cracks are forming, and the leaders know that unrest may threaten their rule, so a sinister general has been giving the authority to create a fighting force to combat China’s only true enemy: her own people.
The comic was created and written by me and features stunning artwork by Carlos Gomez (pencils) and Neeraj Menon (colors).
Sparrow: the protagonist. Pencils: Carlos Gomez, Colors: Neeraj Menon
Ok, but what is the story?
It is the dawn of the 22nd century. For a century, China’s leaders have bought their peoples’ submission with continued growth and prosperity, but as the economy grinds to a halt, protests have broken out in the megacities. Life for urban dwellers is still far better than for those in the impoverished rural areas, which have borne the scars of China’s ongoing industrial revolution. Pollution has contaminated the water, the soil, and even the food the people rely on. Severe birth defects occur in record numbers, though many go unreported. Most families cannot afford to take care of a crippled child. They need a strong, sturdy son to help them earn a living. Because of the one-child policy, many babies born with deformities are simply abandoned by their parents. The military, under the ambitious General Ying, has begun the practice of taking these unwanted children and experimenting on them to create a force of Supersoldiers called the Chāo Shìbīng. Their mission: to combat the growing number of internal threats to the stability of China. The protagonist of BLE is one of these unwanted children. Sparrow was abandoned by her parents because she was born with wings. Fortunately, she was adopted by a kindly army officer who sought to protect her from Ying’s program. In time, she was discovered and taken away; her father imprisoned. After years of training, General Ying has activated her to assassinate a high ranking dissident leader who has suddenly surfaced.

The story begins with Sparrow fighting against the Dissidents, but a discovery leads her to change sides. Now she must turn a rag tag group of dissidents into a fighting force that can take on the military, while simultaneously overcoming her crippling temper, and coping with her feelings for a fellow freedom fighter.

page 2
page 3

page 5
What is the money for?
Good art ain't cheap! The amount I am asking for covers half the cost of the pencils for Black Lotus Empire #1, plus all Kickstarter and Amazon fees, and costs for printing and shipping the pledge rewards. I am really happy to be working with Carlos Gomez, a talented young artist from Spain. I paid the first half out of pocket, and I will be paying for the coloring out of pocket as well.
Type 9 “Black Lotus” Light Combat Uniform. Pencils: Carlos Gomez, Colors: Neeraj Menon
What's the ultimate goal?
I plan to shop issue one around to comic publishers to see if anyone will pick up the 12 issue run. If not, I will self publish and hope to make enough money off of each issue to fund the next one.I don't really plan on making a penny off of the comic, and may even lose some money, but I am having fun writing it and I would love to see it come to life. If this works out, I have a couple of other stories I want to start work on.
Type 9 “Black Lotus” Heavy Combat Uniform. Image by Jeff Miller
What if the funding goal isn't met?
If I can't meet my funding goal, then I will have to dip further into my savings to pay for the book.The truth is, I don't have a huge Facebook following, or millions of followers on Twitter. This is the second time I am running the Kickstarter project, this time with a lower goal and better rewards. I'm just an average guy trying to live out a piece of his childhood dream, and I truly appreciate anyone who gives a dime to help me make that happen.Thanks for taking the time to view.

The Game
Goalsystem Delves provides rules and adventures for playing character-driven skirmish games in fantasy worlds of mysteries, magic, and monsters. These rules harken back to the days of classic dungeon crawls and the world’s most popular fantasy RPG.  Players take the roles of a group of hardened adventurers seeking treasure, glory, and the defeat of the festering evils that remain hidden in the darkest corners of forgotten dungeons.
Dungeon Skirmish?
Goalsystem Delves seamlessly blends RPG and tabletop miniature elements into a fast paced tabletop experience that provides the depth of an RPG with the fast paced action of a tactical miniatures game. Delves plays fast, allowing players to run a multi-encounter Adventure in a single session and epic campaigns over multiple sessions.
Using the proven and popular Goalsystem, Delves delivers character driven action that’s deep enough for RPG gamers and fast enough for miniature gamers. 
Delves works with any 28mm or 15mm miniatures in your collection. 
Oni Mage miniature concept art
Fantasy Toolkit
Delves features 6 character classes and 12 sub-classes that cover all of the major tropes of the dungeon fantasy genre. In addition to a dozen player character races, we also include more than 30 monsters, 30 spells, and lots of weapons and equipment that you can use to bring your adventures to life. But Delves is your game, and we provide the tools you need to run dungeon skirmishes your way. To this end the game also includes rules for creating your own races, classes, and creatures, making Delves the ultimate fantasy toolkit!
Sample Page
What We Will Produce
We have a lot of great rewards that you can pledge for individually or as part of one of our great packages.
The Book: A 6” x 9”, 248pp, black and white, hardcover book. Made in the USA with a Smythe-sewn binding. This book will last a lifetime of gaming sessions.
Dice: A set of 10 custom Goalsystem dice. these are 19mm dice produced by Chessex with the Goalsystem logo replacing the six.  
T-Shirt: An official Goalsystem Logo T-Shirt (pictured below)
Figures: A set of five special edition miniatures made available especially for this project.
Terrain: A set of expertly painted dungeon terrain produced by our partner Tinker’s Lair. Made from recycled tires, this terrain is the next evolution in dungeon terrain.(pictured below)
T-Shirt (not finalized)
Who's Involved
We have a lot of really talented  people from throughout the tabletop game and comics industry involved in the productions of Delves.
Scott Pyle: Game Designer - Creator of Goalsystem, Scott has a number of RPG and tabletop titles under his belt; highlights include SuperSystem and Chaos in Carpathia. Scott also contributed to the Savage Worlds superhero sourcebook, Necessary Evil.
Chris Moeller: Artist and Illustrator - Chris is the creator of the Iron Empires sci-fi universe. He has done extensive freelance work in the comic and gaming industries, including projects for DC comics (League of One) and Wizards of the Coast (D&D, Magic the Gathering).   
Enrico Nardini: Marketing/Social Media/Video Production - Rico's a regular on the US convention scene, and in addition to his work in marketing, social media, and video production, has contributed both fiction and design assistance to the Delves project. He is also the Editor of the Play Unplugged online gaming magazine.
Joe Dragovich: Designer/Illustrator - A Kickstarter veteran, Joe is coming off of of his latest Goalsystem project, The Department which was successfully funded and released earlier this year.
Thomas Scioli: Illustrator -   Tom is the fan-favorite comic book artist for Image Comics' Godland. Tom has also worked for Marvel Comics on the World's Greatest Comic Magazine Fantastic Four maxi-series. His own work includes the critically acclaimed Myth 8-Opus. Check out more of his amazing stuff at his blog.
Carrie Posing: Illustrator - Carrie is a talented, up and coming artist capable of working in multiple mediums. She also provided some excellent play-test work during rules development! Check out her work at her own web site. 
Joshua Dahle: Illustrator - Just finishing with his BFA, Josh Dahle can't wait to make his mark on the adventure gaming industry! He may be new to the gaming biz, but he won't remain unknown for long!  Check out his powerful work at his blog. 
Chelsea van Tol: Illustrator - Chelsea's a favorite artist and designer among the paper miniature community, and she's lent her wonderfully subtle lines to character designs on the Delves project. Check out more of her cool stuff at Offbeat Orc.com. 
Rachel Masiliamani: Illustrator - Rachel's a graphic novelist whose own RPM Comics have drawn critical acclaim. While she does not enjoy drawing fight scenes, she does love magic bookshelves!
Jan Annarella: Illustrator - Jan's a longtime contributor to Goalsystem games, with his art debuting in the first edition of SuperSystem in 2002. Jan's clean style and exacting attention to detail make his work ideal for this project.
Schuyler Hernstrom: Writer/Illustrator - Sky's nifty little line drawings help to give Delves a gritty, pulpy feel that fits so nicely with the core of the dungeon fantasy genre. His prose work possesses a painterly quality that both informs the world and entertains the reader.
Donald Gentry: Terrain Designer - One of the men behind the War Torn Worlds line of pre-painted terrain, Don and his partner have pioneered the process of using recycled tire rubber to make hyper-durable gaming terrain. Through his new venture Tinker's Lair, Don has specially produced our Cavern of Blood dungeon terrain set especially for this Kickstarter. 
Tom Mason: Sculptor - Tom runs Effigy Miniatures, and he's the designer of the Oni-Mage, one of the five miniatures available for this project.We're super-excited to have Tom and Effigy on board for this project!
Andy Dormer: AKA Soapy, this brilliant British sculptor provides awesome figures for Crossover Miniatures. He's lent his amazing talents to the Delves project for our amazing Half-Orc Monk figure reward. Stay lucky, Soapy!
Part of the Caverns of Blood dungeon set in action!
The complete Caverns of Blood set laid out... that's a lot of dungeon!
The Money Side of Things
We're raising money for our creative and printing costs for the books. We have decided to use domestic production (in the United States) for this project. The book we are producing will be collector quality with the best available paper and binding. We'll also be stuffing the book full of excellent illustrations to inspire you to greater dungeon glory.
Stretch Goals
$13,000 - If we reach $13,000, we will produce an additional SE miniature to commemorate our spared kobold captive. That's right, Squeekik, The Kobold Retainer (the crying kobold from our advertisement "Back Goalsystem Delves Or We'll Slay This Kobold!") will be immortalized in miniature. This figure will be included automatically in any backer reward package of $100 or more and will be made available to our other backers as an $8 add-on.
$15,000 - If we reach $15,000, we will produce a complete PDF adventure, GD-4 Nightmare at Nordtown. This low-level adventure includes setup grid maps and unique adversary write-ups and will be a bonus reward to those who pledge $15 or more. 
$25,000 - If we reach $25,000 we will produce Goalsystem Delves: Myths, Magic, and Monsters, a softcover, black and white rules supplement that contains even more monsters, spells, and weapons. JUNE 7th UPDATE: We're in the final stretch! Bonus gift: Blade Raiders wallpaper
Click this link for all the various wallpaper sizes and download links:
http://www.kickstarter.com/projects/165903443/blade-raiders-fantasy-roleplaying-game/posts/242039
MAY 31st UPDATE: 1st look at the Limited Edition hardcover
MAY 26th UPDATE: Initial goal reached! A Gift & Stretch Goal
A big thanks to all of you who've pledged! We've reached our initial goal -- and with over two weeks left to go! :) Thank you so much for being part of this project and for helping to make my RPG game a reality. I have two exciting announcements:
1) As a "thank you" gift, I'm immediately including a new reward for everyone who's pledged $10 or more -- Creature Cards!
2) And we now have a Stretch Goal of $9,000. If we hit this new amount, everyone who's pledged $25 or more will receive an "Adventure Folder."
Please click on the "Updates" tab above and check out my latest update (#3) for more information on the Creature Cards, Stretch Goal and Adventure Folders. And thanks again for all of your support!
MAY 21st UPDATE: 1st look at the character sheet, and exciting new Pledge Rewards!
As I write this, we're about 60% funded, which is amazing. Thank you so much to everyone who's pledged! :) As a little "thank you" for your support, I thought I'd offer a first look at the character sheet. Keep in mind, this is the working version. As I flesh things out and do some game testing, details and design elements are sure to change. But at least this gives you a pretty solid idea as to what you can expect. Click here for a bigger version: http://grantgould.com/art/brcs.jpg  Also, I added new Pledge Rewards: ORIGINAL ARTWORK from the book at the $200 level (limited to 30) and a PDF at $15. So please check those out. Thanks!
What is Blade Raiders?
Blade Raiders is an epic fantasy tabletop roleplaying game. Swords and sorcery, high adventure, creatures and quests -- All of the elements you crave, but presented with a unique spin you've never experienced before. The game will be written, assembled, and fully illustrated by me (you can check out my full bio on the right side of this page), and I'm confident people will enjoy the end result. I've been playing and running tabletop RPGs for over 25 years, so I know what makes a fun game and a great social experience. I look forward to sharing my vision with you and your gaming group. :)
Can you tell me more about the actual book itself?
This first book is the core rulebook. It contains everything you need to play the game, aside from dice -- World overview, character creation, combat rules, monster stats, and everything else needed to begin your adventure. The book will have an 8.5"x11"/magazine-size format (like many RPGs: Dungeons & Dragons, Palladium, Pathfinder, etc.), softcover, perfect-bound, featuring black-and-white interior pages and full-color covers. **A limited-edition hardcover version is available as well. See the rewards section for more info.**
When will the book be done?
If I reach my goal, I plan on having the book completely done by September and back from the printers by late October. If I don't reach my goal, then the project will be shelved. I just can't afford to spend the time needed on this unless I have some help. So, please, if you want this game to happen, make a pledge and tell your friends.
So what do I get if I pledge?
Rewards! :) Along the right-hand side of this page, you'll see the list of rewards based on the various amounts that you can pledge.
What does my money pay for?
Your money (assuming I reach my Kickstarter goal -- if the goal's not met, then you don't pay a penny) will make it possible for me to pay bills while I work on Blade Raiders. Being able to set aside a large chunk of time to illustrate the book and put it together is a huge part of making it happen. Additionally, your money will help pay for printing, rewards, and shipping costs.
Will there be more Blade Raiders books coming after this?
I certainly hope so! If the goal is reached, you can be sure that the first Blade Raiders sourcebook will be coming in early 2013.
If you have any other questions, be sure to check the FAQs below -- and if you don't find an answer there, feel free to message me. Thanks!
- Grant

-WHERE TO BUY CREATURES AFTER THE CAMPAIGN-
CREATURES: The Card Game will be available for purchase directly from us at www.creaturescardgame.com, along with shirts and magnets, but only after we have finished sending all of our Kickstarter rewards out (check back sometime late December 2011). 
Look for CREATURES also on www.amazon.com, www.boardgamegeek.com and other distribution outlets in the future!
-Update ~ $40k and 45k stretch goals: additional T-shirt designs!
Our backers voted for their favorite T-shirt design--here it is!:
But we'll be offering two additional designs if we hit $40k and $45k!  Find out more information on our latest stretch goals at Update #12.
-Update ~ $6000 stretch goal: send CREATURES to ORIGINS!-
Thank you all so much for putting us over our goal in less than 72 hours!  Now we want to take CREATURES to the next level, all the way to the Origins Game Fair!  This is the biggest annual board/card game trade show in the US, held in Columbus, Ohio in the Spring, and we want CREATURES to take it and the gaming industry by storm.  We are asking for funds to cover the cost of a booth (~$900), booth design, airfare, hotels, lots of extra decks to sell, etc.  so we have set a stretch goal of $6000 to help fund this grand adventure.
If/when we hit the $6000 goal, there will be an extra special bonus reward added to EVERY backer level $5 and above-- a special, limited edition animal to be added to your deck available only to kickstarter backers!  The mystery cards will be revealed on the backer's blog upon reaching the goal.  Keep up the great work!
-ABOUT THE GAME-
CREATURES is a creative, strategic card game that blends friendly competition with a good laugh!  It is intended for 2 to 6 players, ages 8 and up.  The game is comprised of 96 playing cards consisting of either a ‘FRONT’, ‘MIDDLE’, or ‘BACK’ portion of 32 particular animals.  Each animal is illustrated across the three cards, and includes a fun fact about that animal and a corresponding ‘strength’ value ranging from 1-10 (e.g. a mosquito is strength-1, and a grizzly bear is strength-10). 
Gameplay occurs as players mix and match ‘FRONT’, ‘MIDDLE’, and ‘BACK’ cards in their hand to create entirely new creatures, and stage attacks against the creatures in other players’ hands.  For example, the ‘FRONT’ of Octopus (4), the ‘MIDDLE’ of Hippopotamus (7), and the ‘BACK’ of Armadillo (1) combine to create OC-POTA-DILLO (12)! 
The illustrated portions of each card align to create an image of the new creature with a zany new fun fact.  A creature which conquers all other players in a single turn becomes a ‘Champion’.  Can you be the first to achieve 5 ‘Champions’?  May the strongest creature win! 
-WHY CREATURES IS AWESOME-
CREATURES is not a veiled re-boot of existing face card games such as poker or bridge, but a refreshingly new and creative game unlike anything else.  It is a harmonious blend of the simplicity of traditional card games such as Uno or Skip-Bo with the strategy and creativity of more complex card games such as Canasta or Phase 10. 
The game is fun for many levels, easy to learn, and difficult to master. 
When is the right time to attack?  Which creature should defend an oncoming attack?  What if someone holds a *POISON* creature!?  The quirky artwork and jumbled-up animal facts keep players of all ages engaged and amused.  With almost 22,000 possible CREATURE combinations, the gameplay is always fresh with every hand delt!
-WHERE YOUR MONEY GOES-
The pledges YOU make will cover the costs associated with designing and printing the first edition card decks professionally, including tuck boxes, shrink wrap, etc. as well as registering the CREATURES trademark and copyrights.  Did you know it costs $40/month to list a new item on Amazon.com?  This is where your money goes!  We will also be printing CREATURES T-shirts and refrigerator magnets so you can show off your undying support of the game to friends and family.  Any amount we raise in excess of our stated goal will go toward trade show exhibitions, marketing material, additional deck printing, etc. so please continue to support!
-MORE INFORMATION-
Please visit the official CREATURES website at www.CreaturesCardGame.com for more information, images, rules, etc.
Hit us up on Twitter @CreaturesGames!
Thank you for pledging and helping make CREATURES become a reality!

campaign.story:
--- IF OUR TOTAL REACHES OVER $190,000, WE WILL MAKE THE OVER NINE-THOUSAND VIDEO AND RELEASE IT TO EVERYONE! --
--- 10/21 UPDATE ---
Today is the LAST DAY to support VGHS and be a part of the project before we go into production!
We've added a $30 Blu-Ray option, just in case you had a hankering for HD. If you already pledged for the DVD, you can change your pledge. If you pledged more than $30, don't worry - you'll have the option of picking between the Blu-Ray and the DVD edition. Aside from HD-ness, there is no difference between the two versions.
And remember - if you pre-order our DVD/Blu-Ray, you're ensuring that the final product is that much better! We're going to be starting shooting next week, and every bit helps!
We can't wait to show you VGHS, and from all of us on the team, thank you!
-fw
-----
What is Video Game High School (VGHS)?
It's the near future: You're dead. Your kids are probably dead. Your grandkids (if they're alive) are playing video games. Why? Because professional gaming is the biggest sport on earth.
Around the world, millions of players duke it out in fighters, RTS’s, First Person Shooters and more. To the victors go the spoils: glory, clan contracts and million dollar endorsements. The best young gamers are recruited by elite boarding schools to sharpen their skills. The best of the best go to VGHS: VIDEO GAME HIGH SCHOOL. 
VGHS is a feature-length action/comedy web series (9 episodes, ~10 mins per episode) about best friends, first loves, and landing that perfect head shot. It follows Brian, a young FPS player stuck in a town where he doesn’t belong. His fortunes change when he scores a massive kill against the world’s top amateur player: VGHS senior “The Law.”
Brian rockets into the national spotlight and lands an invite into the hallowed halls of VGHS. There his skills will be tested as he fights to fit in with the most talented gamers alive. Along the way he’ll make unlikely friends, fall in love with no-nonsense FPS hot shot, Jenny Matrix, and face powerful enemies – namely The Law, who vows to destroy Brian for good.
Will Brian’s dreams end before they’ve even started? Or will he pull it together and become the gamer he was born to be?
Who is behind VGHS?
VGHS is co-created by Freddie Wong and Brandon Laatsch and Matt Arnold. In addition to acting as showrunner, Matt is also a writer, along with Will Campos and Brian Firenzi (founder of 5secondfilms.com). It is based on a concept by Will Campos and Chris Pappavaselio.
Freddie Wong and Brandon Laatsch run http://youtube.com/freddiew, the 7th most subscribed YouTube channel of all time. Collectively their videos have over 450 million views, with over 2 million subscribers tuning in every week to watch their work. Their work has been featured on CNN, BBC, ESPN, and The Huffington Post, and they've worked with actors such as Eliza Dushku, Andy Whitfield, and Kevin Pollack.
Most recently, they worked with director Jon Favreau for a crossover video for Cowboys and Aliens, and appeared on Jimmy Kimmel Live to talk about their work.
Brian Firenzi is the founder of 5secondfilms.com, a comedy website that has churned out five second short films every single weekday since 2008. 5sf has been featured on "Tosh.0" and "Attack of the Show," screened at SxSW and ComiCon, and they've worked with actors such as Peter Stormare and Patton Oswalt.
Matthew Arnold is a collaborator and business partner with freddiew. After graduating USC, he was an assistant and than associate producer at Disney Interactive Studios for 2.5 years where he worked on nearly a dozen projects that polluted kids minds and emptied parents wallets (nah games are great for kids). Matt left in 2010 to start his own game company and create VGHS. His first iPhone game - an action adventure marble game - is set for release this holiday season. 
Will Campos has been a long-time friend and collaborator. He is a graduate of the USC School of Cinema Screenwriting program, and has the professionalism to make the rest of us feel like children. 
How is this project funded? What's the funding for?
Making a feature-length project can be surprisingly expensive - there are numerous costs involved with doing a project legit, including production insurance, location permits, actor and crew salaries, and legal paperwork. In addition, the scale of the project means we'll have to hire on additional post-production personnel, such as editors and visual effects artists.
Over the last year and a half of making weekly special effects laden YouTube videos, we've learned to be flexible and resourceful with our budgets. Every cent raised for this project is going into the production, so the more we raise, the bigger we can go with this project.
Also to put things in perspective, we're asking for less than 1/1000th of the budget for the upcoming Twilight movie.
Why a webseries?
We strongly believe the foundations for the future of digitally distributed content will be laid by webseries. We don't see a webseries as a stepping stone to get a feature film project, or a TV deal - a good webseries is an end unto itself. The webseries format is uncharted territory, and we want to explore it.
What's the status of the production?
VGHS is currently in pre-production. The scripts have all been written. Production is scheduled to start mid-October, with the project finishing early 2012.
How can I help?
By pledging an amount, you will be eligible to receive rewards exclusive to those pledging through this Kickstarter page. Take a look at the rewards column on the right -  you can think of pledging as placing a pre-order for the product once it's done.

campaign.story:
The galaxy is at war!  Turn a fledgling alien race into a vast, powerful empire.  
Empires of the Void is an epic, space empire-building game playable in two hours.  The game is for 2 to 4 players and has an intuitive, yet flexible rule system that allows for many different strategies.  Players can win by conquering planets, using diplomacy, researching technology, or focusing on ruling the galactic council.  Feel like ruling every planet you encounter with an iron fist?  Want to outsmart your opponents with sneaky, underhanded maneuvers they don't expect?  Or perhaps you desire superior technology so you can outgun the competition.  It's all possible in the game.
Empires of the Void has a heavy emphasis on theme and story.  Each round starts with a random event to enhance the flavor of the setting.  The game comes with seven starting alien races to choose from, each with unique abilities and play styles. There are also fifteen additional neutral aliens to conquer or befriend, each with unique abilities and strengths.  The variable board comes in seven hexagonal pieces, so each game will be a different experience.
For further details on the game, please visit these pages:
http://boardgamegeek.com/boardgame/98347/empires-of-the-void
http://dicehateme.com/2011/05/space-for-more-an-interview-with-empires-of-the-void-designer-ryan-laukat/
The Goal
All we need to get this thing launched is your help!  The goal of this project is to pull together enough funding to help cover manufacturing costs.  And to show you how much we appreciate you, we've decided to include an additional starting alien race for all backers, the Pirates of Cidran.  The Pirates are a blast to play- they can use credits to bribe allies to join them, and every time they destroy an enemy ship, they collect credits from scavenging the wreckage.  This starting alien race is limited to this Kickstarter.com campaign and will never be available anywhere else!
This is a big game, with lots of components, and we know you won't be disappointed with how much is in the box, or how engaging the game is.
At the $50 level, you will receive a copy of the game, free shipping, and the Pirates of Cidran starting alien race.  That is $10 less than suggested retail.  We promise to ship out all backers' rewards before the game will be available in stores, online, or at conventions.  
The art is almost completely finished and the game has been tested extensively.  The screws are tightened and the chrome is polished.  Help make our dream a reality!
New Race at $25,000!
We made it to our goal!  Thank you everyone!  Empires of the Void will be printed.  I'm very excited to announce that a new alien race will be included in EVERY COPY of the game if we reach $25,000.  This race has a completely different feel and play style, and uses additional components.  Tremble at the terrible power of the PARASITES OF SREECH!
The Parasites of Sreech not only conquer and befriend neutral aliens, they also INFEST them.  They also have their own ship, the Infestor, a truly terrifying creature to behold.  When the Sreech infest a planet, they have access to that planet's special ability.  They can infest any planet they do not control, including planets controlled by other players, and it is fairly difficult for anyone to remove an infestation.  The ability to infest planets opens up many new strategic possibilities.
Please take a look at this video review!  http://boardgamegeek.com/video/11164/empires-of-the-void/dice-tower-reviews-empires-of-the-void
All titles approved for Springboard campaigns are vetted by Game Salute. During this comprehensive evaluation process, we work with the publisher to ensure quality. This includes ensuring solid designs, thorough playtesting and refinement, excellent presentation, and high quality components.

updates.update_userinfo: Empires of the Void at Origins
updates.update_content:
Hello everyone,
We are currently gearing up for the Origins Game Fair.  We'll be demoing Empires of the Void at the Game Salute booth, and we're looking for volunteers to help teach the game.  If you are interested, please visit this link: http://www.gamesalute.com/home/volunteer and take advantage of all the great benefit options!

Hi Everyone,
I'm happy to hear that many people are starting to receive their games!  If you do not have it yet, and never got an email, don't worry, the game is on its way to you and should arrive soon.  Most likely the email got lost in your spam box.
I've also updated the FAQ/Errata file with a few more questions and one new section in Errata, so please take a look.

Thank you for your patience as we learn a lot about board game production and shipping delays.  I apologize for any inconvenience and grief the delay in shipping might be causing you.  I misunderstood some of the info I was given.  What I was recently told is that almost everyone should receive a confirmation email by tonight except for a few people with 1 or 2 day shipping.  The reason for this is that my warehousing/shipping partner uses a staggered shipping policy to make sure that backers receive their copies in the closest possible time frame.

Hello everyone,
I've recently been made aware that some backers are still waiting for a confirmation of their game being shipped out.  I contacted my warehousing and fulfillment partner, www.gamesalute.com, and they assured me that all the packages will be shipped out by today.  Please let me know if you do not get an email by the end of the day.

I wanted to let you know that we are processing the Empires of the Void shipping right now, but that it's taking some time because there are so many orders.  You will get an email soon to let you know your game has shipped.  Thanks for your patience!

I have good news!  I'm very happy to tell you that the shipment of Empires of the Void is at the warehouse here in the US!  We're going to work to get it shipped out as quickly as possible.  It takes a few days to process the orders, so the games will be shipped out next week sometime.
And in celebration of this, I want to tell you about a new, downloadable, print-and-play alien race: the Mining Guild of Astra.  The fur-covered Astrans live on a cold, snowy world rich in minerals.  They have influence over the galactic market, and each round can choose a trade good that gives extra income for the owner (even other aliens).  The Mining Guild also collects extra victory points for controlling multiple goods of the same type.  You can see them here:  .  This race is still in development but will be available soon from .

Hello everyone!  I'm as anxious as anyone for Empires of the Void to arrive.  But while we wait, I've decided to post some short previews on boardgamegeek.com about various aspects of the game, thanks to a suggestion from a friend. The first preview is on Diplomacy Cards:  http://www.boardgamegeek.com/article/8917460#8917460.
Also, I'm happy to announce the first downloadable promo for Empires of the Void: the Capital City cards.  The Capital City cards are meant to give players a way to mitigate the luck, and add a few interesting decisions to the game.  At the beginning of the game, each player receives one Capital City card and places it next to his player board.  At the end of a player's turn, he may collect one Photon Bomb or one Ambassador and place it on the card (use credit and victory point tokens to represent as indicated).  Photon Bombs may be spent to add one each to combat rolls, after the roll, and Ambassadors may be spent to add to one each to diplomacy rolls, after the roll.  This promo will be available for free download from and also  on the Empires of the Void page.

If you missed out on our Kickstarter campaign, we're sorry, but happy to see you now !
You can get one or sign up for updates here : shop.cwandt.com
Thank you for your unbelievable support !
Hi Kickstarters!
We love Hi-Tec-C pens.  If you've ever written with one, you know what we're talking about.  If you haven't heard of these pens, check out jetpen's blurb.http://bit.ly/hitecc 
Pen Type-A is a stainless steel replacement for the Hi-Tec-C's cheap plastic housing. To us, the Hi-Tec-C cartridges deserve a more durable home.

The design is minimal, the construction is super solid, and indestructible to protect and cherish these coveted ink cartridges.  It has a dime screw on one end to allow for easy ink cartridge replacement.  Its shaft is a solid smooth surface with no branding, no fancy grip or grooves, and just the right thickness and weight so it feels comfortable in your hand.  The entire piece is milled and turned from a block of 304 stainless steel.  The raw steel finish today is how it’ll look 50 years from now.  This thing will last forever. 
The pen slides slowly into its sleeve, which doubles as a ruler.  The notches on the ruler are in cm and inches.  An internal lip at the bottom of the sleeve protects the tip from getting shoved in any further than it should. The tiny amount of space between the sleeve and the pen creates an effect like a pneumatic cylinder, so the pen slides in slow and smooth.

We'd love to share our passion for this pen.

With your support, we'd like to gather enough pre-orders to cover the tooling costs to get this pen into your hands.  It also makes a great gift, so we've opened up higher pledges for those of you who want more than one.

Your support is greatly appreciated!
Love, CW&T
PS. The Pen Type-A is selling here for $50 as a limited pre-sale Kickstarter price.  After this campaign, the pen will retail for $99.

Pen Diameter: 9.72mm

Sleeve Length: 120mm
Sleeve Width: 12mm
Compatible Ink Cartridges:  Pilot Hi-Tec-C and G-Tec-C Cartridges (0.25, 0.3, 0.4, 0.5mm widths in many colors!)
Retail Price: $99

Okay guys... I think I should probably update and clarify my previous comment. After spending some more time with the pen and really taking a few long moments to look it over, touch it and really take it in, I'm liking the pen more and more. The writing quality isn't a testament to the Pen Type-A as much as it's a testament to the amazing ability of the Hi-Tec-C to deliver a precise line using quality ink. But the pen itself feels great. The smooth barrel and heavy, but gentle weight of the piece balances well and makes for a great writing experience. As I said previously, I've got another metal pen (a couple actually) and this one isn't a whole lot different, but there is an incredible attention to detail here and it's something I appreciate. Do I think this project could have gone much differently? Yes. Does the final product excuse the delays and lack of communication? Not really. I hope that cw&t will take this experience and run with it because I think they've probably learned some important lessons and given us a front row seat to both their misfortunes and their success. I appreciate the level of quality. Would I recommend it to a friend? Yes, but only if I knew that person could appreciate this type of product. It's not versatile or portable. It's almost a novelty. Would I be proud to give this as a gift? Absolutely. I think once cw&t get this project finished up and start producing them in the US and offering them in a retail setting (via their website or boutiques or whatever), this pen will be fairly successful, especially considering the cult-like following of the Hi-Tec-C. So, in closing, yes, I do like the pen and I am very glad to have it.

I've said it before and I'll say it again... While I'm proud of them for diligently checking each and every pen that comes through their door to ensure that we get a great product, this wouldn't have happened if they had manufactured here in the US. This is not to say that other countries aren't capable of manufacturing a precision product, they are. But... cw&t is located in Brooklyn, NY. When something goes wrong with the manufacturing process in China, they can't be there to oversee the corrections or to even oversee the problems. All they get is a defective pen and they have to figure out how to translate the problem and solutions via email/skype/phone. It's ridiculous. They should have found a local or semi-local metal shop with precision machinery to make this product so that they could keep an eye on the process. They wouldn't have to deal with shipping and customs delays and they could make sure that the pens were right before ever leaving the manufacturer and sent to them. Shipping from China alone probably takes 2-4 weeks with customs. If they've had 10 shipments, that's an additional 5-8 months on average added to the timeline just in shipping delays. To me, that's inexcusable. A small start-up should be manufactured as such. They're not making iPhones here. It's an industrial product made by specialized machinery. They could have done this closer to home, even at a slightly higher price point. I got my PHX pen a week or more ago and it's a fantastic product. I gave up on the Pen Type-A a long time ago. By my guess, I'll get it in 2 more shipments, which puts me at August or so. I think that's exactly a year after I backed the project. I appreciate the attention to detail and the time and effort, but this is the last cw&t project I'll ever put money into.

campaign.story:
The first unit to arrive was local Officers Angelo and Kaplinsky, seven minutes after the original dispatch. They secured the area, clearing out the civilians who had yet to flee. In the five minutes in which this took, DFM agents Florin, York, Yoren and Renault arrived. They assisted in clearing out the area and instigated a case perimeter. 
Initial investigation revealed one suspected fabricant (SUS-F) holding four hostages in the diner. One hostage was already seen to be dead. Upon approach, the SUS-F shouted that he wanted the officer to step back or he would execute the hostages he held. The officers, upon further observation from a greater distance away, believed they had enough evidence that the suspect was in fact a fabricant. His behavior conformed with classic hostage-taking programming…
-Excerpt from DFM case file 556-447-322 
The Game
The Department is a tabletop miniature game set in a near future America where Fabricated Human Simulants, also known as fabricants, walk among us. Players take on the role of agents from the U.S. Department of Fabricant Management, a government department charged with policing fabricants and fighting the increasing instances of fabricant-related terrorism. The Department is meant to be the first tabletop police procedural game that requires no Game Master to play. Players will use sleuthing, investigation, interrogation, and combat to hunt down and stop fabricant terrorist cells.
The game draws heavily on the noir and police procedural dramas and blends in elements of robotic sci-fi. The Department is not cyberpunk: it’s Blade Runner meets Law and Order meets I-Robot meets American Gangster meets Mad Men meets The Maltese Falcon and more. 
Where Wargame and RPG Meet
The Department uses the popular Goalsystem, written by Scott Pyle. Building on this proven base, The Department features an innovative, cooperative campaign system where players play scenarios in order to gather a diverse array of evidence points. Players then use these evidence points to acquire warrants, follow up on leads, and finally hunt down the leadership of the fabricant terrorist cell. The campaign constantly challenges players to use their limited investigation resources wisely, as their department’s patience will eventually run out and the players will be thrown off of the case.
While it is meant to be played as a tabletop miniature wargame that requires no game master, The Department can be played without miniatures as a map based tabletop RPG. Our goal is to create a rulebook that allows you to explore the streets of 2060s America your way.
What We Will Produce And When We Will Produce It.
The Department will be an approximately 150 page full color soft cover A4 sized book chock full of art, fiction, and a complete ruleset ready to play straight away.
We will also be producing a full color PDF as well as a kindle, ebook, and a printer-friendly Pdf version. 
Currently, production is on schedule and we aim to release The Department in Q1 2012.
All contributors will be acknowledged in the print and electronic versions of the game.
You can find more information on our official website. www.departmentoffabricantmanagement.com   
The Money Side of Things
We’re raising Kickstarter funding to cover our creative costs and an initial print run.
We are a global team working in three countries, but our printing operations will be done in the UK. Please consider adding in the cost of shipping (we recommend $7) for physical items shipped outside of the UK.
If you are a distributor or a store and would like to make a bulk order, please contact joseph.dragovich@gmail.com to discuss a custom donation.

Hey everyone,
It's humid, and we did yardwork today.  With that in mind, we felt like it'd be nicer to give you an audio demo tonight as opposed to a video demo.  :)
This is "Sum of Me", a song inspired by Alece Ronzino and this post that she wrote.  As I read her words, I found myself singing them in my head, and I couldn't wait to get it down on paper.

Hello!
I had hoped to get this demo out to you earlier, but crazy work schedules and Strep Throat have made it a little difficult.  Nonetheless, I'm excited to share this song with you! 
Brittani (co-writer of Little Lights) and I have talked about the fact that writing music feels more like discovering than creating.  I've heard authors speak of this phenomenon, as well.  Sometimes, a song (or a poem or a story) simply comes to you.  Without hardly any work or effort, you've all of a sudden got a complete work of art to share with others.

What do you do after a 12-hour work day?  You record a (very raw) demo of the first single off your upcoming EP!  :)  (You can see the video at the bottom of this post!)
Brittani Cicirelli and I wrote this song a couple of weeks ago, and, eventually, it will have a bridge and a full band behind it.  Until then, we hope you enjoy this sneak peek of the music that will be included on Little Lights!  :)

campaign.story:
There’s a long history of giant robot stories in popular culture, most of which involve massive battles, clean-cut heroes, and evil, over-the-top villains.
Well, that’s not quite what Giant Robot Warrior Maintenance Crew (GRWMC for short) is about.
With GRWMC we deal with the people who operate strictly INSIDE a giant robot, and try to keep its internal machinery from breaking down. And we never actually reveal what the exterior of the robot looks like.
Our story unfolds through the eyes of a young woman named Erica Pratch. She’s new to the Maintenance Crew, and joined up because she wanted to travel and be part of something exciting. But the reality of working inside a giant robot warrior isn’t anything like she expected. This is a high-stress job done in the most ridiculous situations possible, where people routinely snap under the pressure. On top of that the pilots of the robot don’t know what they’re doing, and alien monsters run loose in the service tunnels.
But someone has to keep that giant robot functioning. No matter how much back-breaking, soul-crushing, life-threatening work it might take.
Giant Robot Warrior Maintenance Crew is a three-issue mini-series that should appeal to fans of Spaceballs, Aliens, the Hitchhiker’s Guide to the Galaxy, and of course giant robot stories. It’s an idea we’ve been itching to get made for several years now, and the time has finally come to make it happen.
Though while we are working with a small publisher, we still need help to tackle production costs and marketing. Plus, Mervyn will have to turn down some freelance work to make time to finish these pages. A large chunk of the funds will be used to make sure the guy can eat.
So with that in mind we’re offering a great series of rewards for any pledges given, including collected sets of all three issues, original artwork, and even appearances in the story. If you live outside the U.S., please include an extra $5.00 to help cover any shipping and handling involved.
And if you like our project then please take a moment to send our link around, and help spread the word on what GRWMC is all about.
Thanks for your consideration, and we look forward to bringing Giant Robot Warrior Maintenance Crew to you soon.
- Nathan and Mervyn

campaign.story:
$5,000 And Beyond!
Oh, there you are! Hold on a sec'...I see you looking at those numbers up there in the corner and hovering over your browser's BACK button. You're thinking "It's all over and they don't need me, now."
Well, you're wrong, Spaceman!
Yes, we made the $5,000 goal to guarantee that Alien Frontiers will be printed. But the dirty little secret is that $5,000 is only about a third of the actual printing costs and I'm draining my savings to make up the additional $10,000
YIKES!
Ya, that's a chunk-o-change...so every new backer we get between now and June 26th will help a lot to defray those additional costs. If you sign up as a $50 Backer right now you'll get the game when it's printed (we're hoping for August or September) and some spiffy bonuses that won't be available after June 26th. And if you REALLY want some sweet rewards, just look at the higher backer packages.
OK, that's the pitch and the plea...now, jump in and see what it's all about. An Overview of The Game
Alien Frontiers is a board game of resource management and planetary development for two to four players. During the game you will utilize orbital facilities and alien technology to build colony domes in strategic locations to control the newly discovered world.
The game board shows the planet, its moon, the stations in orbit around the planet, and the solar system’s star. The dice you are given at the start of the game represent the spaceships in your fleet. You will assign these ships to the orbital facilities to earn resources, expand your fleet, and colonize the planet.
Winning the game requires a mix of strategy and luck as you assign your fleet, integrate alien technology and territory bonuses into your approach, and block your opponents from implementing their own plans. Do you have what it takes to conquer an alien frontier? A Few Words from the Game Designer
My name is Tory Niemann and I’ve been designing games (with varying levels of success) since I could play them. I came up with the basic framework of Alien Frontiers in early 2009. Even from those first primordial play tests with the wife, I could see I had something good. Unlike many games I’d made, it was fun. It wasn't finished, but it was fun.
Perhaps the most unusual influence on this project was the game Kingsburg by Luca Iennaco and Andrea Chiarvesio. The influence was not from the game itself (I hadn’t played it at the time), but a brief review of the game I read online. From that synopsis, I developed an idea of how the game was probably played, and I thought it sounded interesting. Later I found that my concept of this game was totally wrong because the description I’d read was misleading, but the game I’d thought it was still intrigued me. Another influence was the dice game To Court the King by Tom Lehmann. I really enjoyed the concept of rolling dice and then changing them in the most creative way to suit your purpose, but I wanted a deeper game than To Court the King provided. I combined these two influences to create a new, unique game.
Originally, the game was called Race for Mars, or, as my wife called it, "that Mars game." It was printed on two pieces of cardstock and used cubes of sculpting clay for resource tokens. After several revisions and reworkings, I shifted the theme of the game to colonizing of an extrasolar planet and named it Alien Frontiers.
Now, after extensive play testing, dozens of changes, adjustments, and tweaks, Alien Frontiers is on the verge of being a REAL game. Most importantly to me, it’s a game that I really enjoy playing and others love too. This is an exciting time for me as the designer and I can't wait to get Alien Frontiers out to the public. A Few Words from the Publisher Hi...I'm David MacKenzie and Clever Mojo Games is my tiny little game design company. As a sole proprietorship, CMG has very limited funds, nevertheless, I am committed to publishing Alien Frontiers this year and I'm already in talks with a couple of manufacturers. This is where you and Kickstarter can help. The funds you pledge will go directly to offset the printing costs for a run of 1,000 copies of Tory's amazing game. Your support will insure than Alien Frontiers is published and that Clever Mojo Games is around to produce more quality games in the future.
By supporting the Alien Frontiers project with your pledge of just $50 you are pre-ordering the game (retail value $40.00) plus you'll receive four spiffy rocket tokens for the score track and a Kickstarter-Exclusive "Space Crane" Alien Tech Card. When the games are printed and delivered I will ship your copy to you anywhere in the world at no additional charge. You're definitely getting your money's worth at this sponsorship level! (Limit 700 Sponsors)
At the $100 level you'll get the game, rockets and card from the $50 level plus your choice of a second copy of Alien Frontiers or a copy of Ogre Castle, a fun family game that my brother, Fred, and I designed and self-published in 2009. Two games...rockets...exclusive Alien Tech card...and shipping included!! (Limit 100 Sponsors)
At the $200 level you'll get the game, rockets and card from the $50 level plus a sweet photo book of Alien Frontiers art showing early concept sketches and finished pieces...and it's signed by the artist, Mark Maxwell, and by the game designer, Tory Niemann, too. As always, shipping anywhere in the world is included!!! (Limit 20 Sponsors)
At the $300 sponsorship level you'll get the game, rockets and card from the $50 level plus a high quality giclee print of the Alien Artifact floating majestically over the barren alien planet. This 15"x20" print is signed by the artist, Mark Maxwell, and is suitable for framing. Worldwide shipping and insurance included!! (Limit 10 Sponsors)
Finally, at the $500 sponsorship level you'll get the game, rockets and card from the $50 level plus an original piece of art created for the game's Alien Tech Cards. These 8x10 acrylic paintings are one of a kind originals signed by the artist, Mark Maxwell, and ready for you to frame and proudly display in your game room. We're only making five pieces available and they'll be awarded on a first-pledge-first-choice basis. The pieces are: Plasma Cannon, Stasis Beam, Alien Monument, Temporal Warper, and Orbital Teleporter. Yup, worldwide shipping and insurance included!! (Limit 5 Sponsors) Every little bit you pledge helps support the game. If you're not ready or able to pledge for a pre-order, your $10 pledge will earn you a certificate of thanks signed by the game designer, Tory Niemann, and you'll get the rocket scoring tokens, too. And remember, every person who pledges will have access to the "Backers Only" updates here on Kickstarter. Spread the word to all your friends and co-workers, on all your social networks, at your gaming groups and church gatherings. Alien Frontiers is coming in 2010 and with your help it will be a big success. See the Kickstarter Rewards here: http://www.clevermojogames.com/alienfrontiers/kickstarter.html
Visit Mark Maxwell's portfolio website here: http://www.aeromancy.us/
Visit Alien Frontiers on BGG here: http://www.boardgamegeek.com/boardgame/48726/alien-frontiers

The Kickstarer Reward for backing Alien Frontiers at the $300 level was a 15" x 20" giclee print of the Alien Artifact artwork. About three-quarters of the way through our project I added a giclee print of the Box Cover artwork to this reward level in hopes of attracting more backers. It didn't work. We only ever got one $300 backer, my brother Fred. So, Fred, you get one of each of the Alien Frontiers giclees. Each is signed by the artist, Mark Maxwell.

The Kickstarter Reward for backing Alien Frontiers at the $200 level was an art book showing the evolution of the game art from sketches and ideas, to computer renderings, to final painted works. We only had one backer at the $200 level, Tom Hillman, one of our key play testers, but I went ahead and had five copies of the book made anyway so that Tory and I and some others could have copies of our own. I had them delivered to the artist, Mark Maxwell, and asked him to sign them all and to keep one book for himself. Simple enough, and all I expected was a scrawled signature and maybe a date. What Mark did, however, was, as usual for him, above and beyond. Each of the four copies that he sent back to me has his signatures and date...but it also has an original and unique retro-scifi sketch on the title page! And he sent along three spiffy spacemen, too. Thanks Mark!!!!

campaign.story:
Thank you for your interest in The Zombie Game Experiment!
Please make sure to visit our official site: ZombieExperiment.com
As we are always wish to improve the project, please contact us if you have any suggestions.
The Basics
This is an experiment in "Community Game Development". The public funds the development and the public helps to design the game. All donors are given free access to the final version of the game. This game will be a light heated zombie game, which material we can equate to a teen rating.
We accept donations for the experiment which funds the development of the game. 25% percent of the donations and game revenue are donated to TeamFox of the The Michael J. Fox Foundation for Parkinson's Research.
Details
Please review ZombieExperiment.com as well as the FAQs.
We have modified the forums to work with this project and continue to do so. If you wish to be involved with the design process of this project you will need to register on these forums. Registering is very quick and easy to complete.
Wait for the registration email to come to your email box. When it arrives, click on the link in your email which confirms that you are a real person and you are set! Your email will not be used for spam.
Donations
You may donate via KickStarter. If you wish to design the game, you will then need to send a confirmation contact with your forum user name so that we may enable your special forum status.
You may also donate via our automated forum PayPal system.
We have broken the funding milestones into four stages.
Stage One is the initial design stage where we begin to design the game and develop rough builds of the game.
Stage Two is the Alpha Build stage where we have a more stable version of the game with your ideas implemented.
Stage Three is the Beta Build stage where a nearly completed version of the game will be available for testing.
Stage Four is the Gold stage where we begin to market the game and sell it to the public.
We are currently funding: STAGE ONE
Design
Once you have donated you will have access to the design forums!
You may be able to pitch design ideas on the design discussion forums.
As the community agrees and votes on design ideas we will add the designs to the design documents.
A base design is being created by the project management to help start the project. We must start with a base design in order to plan for the total development costs. We are envisioning an iso-metric zombie shooter in-which you gain power-ups. More details will be released as the game is designed!
Development
The Hive Media team will be completing most of the development at reduced costs for the Zombie Game Experiment. Other professionals are welcome to donate their services! If you are interested in donating your services please contact us with your idea and previous work samples. As an incentive, we may be able to add you in the professional credits.
While the development team is still being assembled, here are a few of the people involved:
William Weaver is the Development Director.
Aaron Rosenberg is the Lead Writer. (Information on Aaron can be found in the middle of the linked news update.)
Andrew Lackey is the Sound Designer.
Jonathan Coulton has worked with us to use his "Re: Your Brain" song. (Wikipedia)
The Game Designer is YOU.
Software:
The Zombie Game Experiment will be using the Unity3D middle-ware game engine.
A Few Sketches and Concepts:

Spread the Word
Other than donating and being active in the community, the best way to help this project is to tell as many people as you can!
Add us to your Twitter, MySpace and FaceBook.
Tell others about the project! Use the above mentioned sites and Digg, Reddit, forums, chat rooms, blogs, anywhere you can think of! This project is dependent on the community!
The most important thing is to have fun. That is what this project is about, people having a good time and helping a good cause through Community Game Development.
